loans.name: Jackline

texts.en:
Jackline is a married woman. She has 4 children. 

She operates a farm where she grows crops. She has been involved in this business for 3 years. 

Jackline describes her biggest business challenge to be price fluctuations. She will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy farm inputs. She hopes that in the future, she will be successful. 

She will use the anticipated profits to open a retail shop.

loans.use: buy farm inputs.

loans.name: Felix Renato

texts.es:
Felix tiene 24 años de edad, de estado civil soltero, vive solo en la comunidad Camaron perteneciente al Cantón Echeandia Provincia de Bolívar. 

El se dedica a la siembra de guineo y a la cria de cerdos . Solicita el crédito para  el mantenimiento del cultivo y para la compra de cerdos para engordarlos y venderlos. La compra lo realiza en mercado de Echeandia. Su meta es mejorar las condiciones de vida y comparse un carro. Su desafío es el mal tiempo, plagas y enfermedades. En su tiempo libre le gusta salir de viaje y hacer deporte.
texts.en:
Felix is 24 years old and single. He lives alone in the community of Camaron, part of Echeandia Canton in Bolívar Province.

He cultivates bananas and raises pigs. He is requesting a loan to maintain his crop and to purchase pigs to fatten and sell. He makes his purchases in Echeandia.

His goal is to improve his living conditions and to purchase a car. His challenges are bad weather, pests and diseases. 

In his spare time he enjoys traveling and playing sports.

loans.use: to purchase pigs.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en: Mohammad is a 22-year-old university student majoring in class teaching. He is in his fourth year. He lives in Irbid, Jordan, with his family that consists of five members. Mohammad is seeking to continue his studies till he gets his master's. He has been facing problems in paying his semester fees because of the financial crisis his family has been facing. For that, he has applied for this loan.

loans.use: To pay for his upcoming semester fees

loans.name: Zakia

texts.en: Zakia is a 46-year-old married woman. She has four children. She runs a business with her husband buying and selling cattle. She looks after the cattle and is responsible for feeding them, while her husband sells them to different markets in the city. Their business is providing them with enough income to support their family. However, she needs to earn much more to meet their everyday expenses including food, health care, and clothing. In order to increase her earnings, Zakia has requested a loan of 50,000 PKR to buy cattle for resale purposes. She is hopeful that expanding the business will help to improve her family’s living standards. She is in her fifth loan cycle and has good credit history.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Saleh

texts.en: Saleh is 52 years old, married and the father of six children. He lives with his family in Sana'a, the capital of Yemen. His oldest child is 24 years old and the youngest is 8. Saleh studied until secondary school, but couldn't complete his education because he got married when very young. He lives with his family in very poor conditions. He doesn't surrender to this but strives strongly to improve life for his family. He is a talented and responsible man, and is trying to buy a minibus to use to transport people from one station to another inside the city. His goal is to earn enough money to care for his family. Saleh believes this business will be very profitable for him, and he can earn a lot of money. Unfortunately; the money he has saved is not enough to open his small business. That is why he is requesting a loan for 750,000 YER from AMB in order to buy a minibus. In the future, he looks forward to buying another bus and a taxi so his children can work in this field as well.

loans.use: to buy a minibus.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a selection of fruits and vegetables. Yesika's dream is to help her 11-year-old son to get ahead, and to have a shop where she can sell her products.

loans.name: Sembrando Esperanza Group

texts.es: Elena tiene 41 años de edad es soltera con 03 hijos dependientes. Ella dedicada a la venta de frutas hace varios y a la vez vende carrizo y flores. El crédito lo invertira en la compra de frutas al por mayor para expenderlos por kilos y obtener una buena ganancia. Ella cumple la función de presidenta en el grupo “SEMBRANDO ESPERANZA”. El grupo agradece a los inversionistas KIVA por el crédito brindado. Elena es la tercera del lado izquierdo viste casaca beige y de la misma manera se encuentra adjuntada la foto de Maria en la parte superior izquierda que no pudo estar presente en la reunión por motivos laborales.
texts.en:
Elena is 41 years old, single and has 3 children that depend on her. She sells fruit, reeds and flowers. She will use the loan to buy fruit in bulk so she can sell it by kilos, and get a good profit from it. 

She is the president of the group “Sembrando Esperanza”. They are grateful to Kiva lenders for the given loan. Elena is the third person from left to right, and is wearing a beige sweater. At the upper left of the picture, there’s the photo of Maria who couldn’t be present at the meeting because of work.

loans.use: to buy fruit in bulk.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for her upcoming semester fees

loans.name: Herine

texts.en:
Herine is married and she has one child. She describes herself to be focused. For the past 3 years, Herine has operated a retail business selling drinks. Her business is located in a vibrant location and her primary customers are of all types. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of capital. 

Herine will use this KES 80,000 loan to buy more stock of drinks. This is Herine's fifth loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully. Herine will use the anticipated profits to expand the business. She hopes to buy land in the future.

loans.use: to buy more stock of drinks

loans.name: Yonny Alberto

texts.es:
El  señor Yonny desde muy joven se dedico a las funciones del campo tales como agricultura y ganadería, actividades que le enseño su padre para que saliera adelante en su vida.

Hoy en día su actividad principal es la agricultura y la ganadería y tiene como objetivo mejorar su capital comprando 2 cabezas de ganado que le permitan abastecerse y generar mejores ingresos, y esta es la razón por la cual solicita un préstamo.

Es padre responsable y amoroso con sus hijos, vive en una finca con ellos y su esposa quien ha sido su más grande compañía.

Sueña con poder otorgarles a sus hijos una educación de calidad para que más adelante se puedan defender solos y sean independientes.

Todos los días asiste su negocio y procura por hacer las cosas muy bien.
texts.en:
From a very young age, Yonny has worked in the country in jobs such as agriculture and cattle farming. His father taught him this work so that he could move forward in his life. Today, he mainly works in agriculture and cattle raising. His goal is to improve his capital, buying 2 heads of cattle. This allows him to supply his business and to generate better earnings, and this is the reason he is asking for a loan.

He is a responsible and loving father to his children; he lives on a farm with them and his wife, who has been his best company. He dreams of being able to grant his children a quality education so that, in the future, they can support themselves and be independent. Every day he attends to his business and tries to make everything run well.

loans.use: to buy 2 cows in order to supply his business and to improve his family earnings.

loans.name: Glenda Arely

texts.es:
Glenda, tiene un negocio en el que oferta tamales, pan y ropa, vive en una casa alquilada en compañía de su compañero de vida y un hijo de 4 años; ella realiza esta actividad desde hace 3 años, compra tamales y pan para salir a revender, mientras que la venta de ropa lo aprendió por iniciativa propia, su horario de trabajo es de 1:00 p.m. a 6:00 p.m., ya tiene muchos clientes fidelizados a sus productos, este negocio le permite apoyar en los gastos familiares y estar muy al pendiente de los cuidados de su familia.
El financiamiento lo utilizara para comprar nuevos estilos de ropa, tamales y pan, surtirá mejor el negocio para atraer nuevos clientes, contara con el capital para realizar las compras al contado diarias de pan y tamales por una larga temporada, espera mejor la situación económica y resarcir su deuda.
Sus proyectos son comprar su casa propia, mantener la estabilidad económica, dar mejor vida a su familia y hacer la apertura de una nueva fuentes de ingreso como lo es un atienda de productos de la canasta básica.
texts.en:
Glenda has a business that offers tamales, bread and clothing. She lives in a rented house with her life partner and 4 year old son. She has been buying and reselling tamales and bread for 3 years, whilst she learned to sell clothes on her own initiative. 

Her hours are from 1:00 pm to 6:00 pm. She already has many loyal customers for her products. This business allows her to help with the family expenses and be very attentive to the care of her family.

She will use the funding to buy new styles of clothing, tamales and bread, to stock the business better in order to attract new customers, to have the capital for the daily cash purchases of bread and tamales for a long time, hoping for a better economic situation and to repay her debt.

Her projects are to buy her own home, maintain economic stability, give a better life to her family and open up a new source of income such as a shop selling basic food products.

loans.use: to buy new styles of clothing, tamales and bread, to stock the business better in order to attract new customers

loans.name: Adelaida Griselda

texts.es: Adelaida de 38 años de edad es madre soltera y habita en vivienda propia junto a sus 2 hijas de 22 y 13 años de edad. Ella es una mujer tenaz que desde hace 5 años se dedica a la venta de artículos de plástico como: guacales, vasos, platos, tazas, etc. dicha actividad la realiza en el mercado municipal de forma ambulante. Adelaida se encuentra construyendo su vivienda, como se puede observar en la fotografía, pero carece de puertas, ventanas y balcones,  es por ello que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para comprar: puertas, ventanas, balcones y pagar mano de obra para colocar puertas, ventanas y balcones en su vivienda.
texts.en:
Adelaida is a 38-year-old single mother and lives at her own house along with her 2 daughters, ages 22 and 13. She is a tenacious woman who for the past 5 years has sold plastic articles, like: containers, glasses, plates, cups, etc. She sells them at the municipal market as a street vendor. 

Adelaida is building her house, as it can be appreciated in the picture, but doesn’t have doors, windows or security bars. Because of this, she is requesting a loan from FUSAI to buy: doors, windows and security bars, and to hire labor to place them at the house.

loans.use: to buy doors, windows, security bars and pay for labor.

loans.name: Rabee'

texts.en: Rabee' is a 27-year-old self-dependent young man living in Irbid, Jordan, with his family that consists of seven members. He is a university student majoring in finance. He is in his third year. Rabee' also works as a taxi driver in the evenings to earn money that will help him pay for his study fees. Now he doesn't have enough money to pay for his upcoming semester fees completely. For that, he needs your help in giving him this loan.

loans.use: to pay semester and registration fees

loans.name: Sewar

texts.en: Sewar is a 23-year-old first year university student majoring in Therapeutic Feeding. She lives with her family, which consists of six members, in Irbid, Jordan. Sewar is seeking to find a job in her field where she can improve her knowledge and experience. Sewar has applied for this loan because, due to the financial crisis her family is currently facing, she doesn't have enough money to pay for her upcoming semester fees.

loans.use: to pay for her upcoming semester fees

loans.name: Santos Orbelina

texts.es:
Santos de 37 años de edad, estudió hasta sexto grado, está casada y su esposo trabaja en la agricultura, tiene 3 hijas, las dos mayores trabajan en la elaboración de petates y una está estudiando.

Ella siempre se ha dedicado al tejido de petates, actividad económica que aprendió hace más de 25 años pues desde muy pequeña aprendió con su madre ya que en la zona donde vive es la fuente de empleo que existe y todas las personas aprenden este oficio, sus dos hijas mayores le ayudan a trabajar estas artesanías, todos los días trabajan pues como familia buscan generar ingresos para que su calidad de vida mejore.

El préstamo lo necesita para comprar un terreno ya que se le ha  dado la oportunidad de adquirirlo y aumentar su patrimonio pero hasta el momento no cuenta con el capital suficiente para efectuar la compra y así en un futuro su esposo tendrá un espacio más amplio para cultivar. 

Santos  desea que sus hijas puedan estudiar y a que ella no tuvo la oportunidad de superarse con los estudios.
texts.en:
Santos is 37 years old and studied through sixth grade.  She is married and her husband works at farming.  Santos has three daughters; the two older ones work by weaving mats and one is in school.

She has always worked at weaving mats, a financial activity learned from her mother more than 25 years ago, when she was a small girl.  In the area where Santos lives, this is the means of employment and everyone learns this work.  Santos' older girls help her to make these handcrafted items.  They work everyday since as a family they seek to earn income to improve their quality of life.

Santos needs the loan to buy a plot of land, since she has the opportunity to do so and to increase the size of the property she inherited. Until now, she hasn't had enough money to make the purchase.  By dong this, her husband will have a larger area to cultivate in the future.  Santos hopes her daughters can go to school since she didn't have the chance to improve herself by getting an education.

loans.use: to buy a piece of land since she has the opportunity to do so and increase her inherited property

loans.name: Maria De Los Santos

texts.es:
Maria desde hace 7 años se dedica a la producción agrícola y diariamente se levanta para trabajar y atender sus tierras en las cuales tiene cultivos principalmente de plátano.

Es una actividad aprendida de manera empírica y poco a poco ha ido perfeccionando sus técnicas y habilidades en este campo.

Hoy en día se siente orgullosa de lo que ha podido construir con su esfuerzo y se siente muy agradecida con la vida por las oportunidades que le brinda.

Ella pide un préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de abonos, riegos y pesticidas, de este modo mantener sus tierras en optimas condiciones para los cultivos.

Su mayor sueño es tener una casa propia y allí poder disfrutar de su vejez al lado de su esposo.
texts.en:
Since the age of 7, María has worked in agricultural production. Every day she gets up early to work and attend to her land, where she mainly grows bananas. She learned this work by watching, and little by little she has been perfecting her techniques and skills in this area. Today she feels proud of what she has been able to build with her effort, and is thankful for her life and the opportunities it brings. 

She is asking for a loan to invest in the purchase of fertilizer, irrigation, and pesticides. With this, she will be able to maintain her fields in optimal condition for the crops. Her dream is to have her own home where she can enjoy her old age alongside her husband.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, seeds, and irrigation to improve her banana crop.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Hello, world! Meet Elizabeth, a 45-year-old farmer from Kapseret. Kapseret is a remote area in Eldoret, Kenya, an area known for producing the best marathon runners, who have broken world records. 

This mother of two is not interested in any farming activity other than dairy, which she started doing one year ago and has never looked back. She loves it! Her main source of income is milk. Elizabeth is very appreciative of the fact that milk prices in the region are high. This enables her to enjoy a good profit margin and expand her operations. She has named her favorite dairy cow "Murgut". Milking and feeding her cow is her hobby. 

Elizabeth is seeking a loan to purchase an additional dairy cow in order to boost milk production to increase sales volume. She believes the key to increased milk production is proper health. A dairy cow needs roughage and protein in her diet to be healthy. Elizabeth will use the additional income she will make to further her children’s education.

loans.use: To buy an additional dairy cow

loans.name: Pablo

texts.es:
Pablo de 69 años de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, está casado y su esposa es ama de casa y también trabaja en la elaboración de petates a base del tule, tienen 7 hijos y todos trabajan, 3 de ellos en agricultura y 4 en elaboración de petates.
Desde muy joven, Pablo aprendió el trabajo del campo sembrando granos básicos, trabajando con ganado y elaboración de petates, ya que fue lo que su padre le enseño: trabaja todos los días fuertemente y a pesar de su edad aún no siente cansancio, camina 5 minutos para llegar al terreno donde  cultiva, sus hijos y su esposa le ayudan bastante en la ejecución de las actividades que realiza. 

El crédito lo necesita para cancelar los servicios de un notario que está realizando el proceso de escriturar y registrar unos terrenos que posee desde hace 40 años, y que por el momento  no tiene ningún documento registrado que lo ampare como dueño.
 Él desea que sus hijos trabajen para que construyan una casa, que puedan tener buen  desarrollo familiar y que cuando él ya no pueda trabajar sus hijos puedan ayudarle en lo necesario.
texts.en:
Pablo is 69 years old, did not have the opportunity to study, and is married.  His wife is a housewife, and also works making sleeping mats out of reeds.  They have 7 children and all are working: 3 of them in agriculture, and 4 making sleeping mats.

When he was very young, Pablo learned the work of the field by sowing basic grains, working with livestock, and making sleeping mats, since it was what his father taught him.  He works hard every day and despite his age does not feel tired.  He walks 5 minutes to arrive at the land he farms; his children and wife help him considerably in performing his work.

The loan he needs is to pay for the services of a notary who is carrying out the process of formalizing and registering the land that he has possessed for 40 years.  At the moment he does not have any registration document that protects his ownership.

He wishes that his children work to build a house, that they will be able to have good family growth, and that when he is no longer able to work his children can help him with what he needs.

loans.use: to pay for the services of a notary who is carrying out the process of formalizing and registering land that he has possessed for 40 years.

loans.name: God's Love Group

texts.en:
There are three members in this group, who are in their seventh loan cycle. They have been living in the same neighborhood for several years. Their main activity is small retail commerce (material, African wax prints, cooked rice and beans).

Yvonne is the featured borrower for the group. She is a model borrower due to her commitment. She is 35 years old, married, and has two children.

She is active in the trade of materials and African wax prints, which she buys at the market for resale in her home-based shop. She intends to use the new loan to buy materials and African wax prints from the market to sell to customers. 

She will use the profits to handle daily expenses and to increase her savings.

loans.use: To buy materials and African wax prints

loans.name: Bashir

texts.en:
Bashir is married man with three children. Two of his children are in school. He has been operating a motorcycle (boda boda) business since 2001 at a stage in Kampala town. He started this business to increase his income. He has been able to make good sales and send his children to school.

Bashir wants to renovate his rental rooms back home. He is a repeat client who first took out a loan of one million. He is very grateful for the financial support and suggests that the bank should reduce the interest rates. He faces the problems of limited income, constant traffic jams when is he driving passengers, and family expenditures that put pressure on his little income.

Bashir's dream is to acquire land and build a house for his family as well as expand his business. He describes himself as a hardworking person.

loans.use: To renovate rental units

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Kiva lenders! Meet Ruth, a 26-year-young, energetic and hardworking mother of three lovely children. Ruth resides in Eldoret, known as the “city of champions” because of producing world class athletes who have broken major world records. This area experiences one of the best weather patterns that favor crop and animal farming. 

Ruth has been farming for the past seven years and the income from it has enabled her to take care of her family and her parents, making sure that they have their basic needs. Due to the high unemployment rate in Kenya, Ruth could not find a job to support her family, but she didn’t surrender to that. She started farming, and through mixed farming, she has been able to earn a decent income. 

Ruth is seeking a loan of KES 32,050 to buy a quality dairy cow. Ruth wants to take advantage of the increased market in milk products. Having an entrepreneurial mind, she cannot let this opportunity pass by. Profits generated from selling milk and its products will be used to repay the loan and to assist her family and the community. Ruth intends to use the income generated to improve her living conditions and to impact society positively. Ruth is very visionary and she intends to start a big dairy shop where she will be selling milk products such as yoghurt and cream. Ruth is hoping for your kindness.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Evelyn Xiomara

texts.es:
Evelyn de 40 años de edad, terminó sus estudios de bachillerato con éxito, posteriormente decidió dedicarse al trabajo, fue ganando experiencia y posteriormente decidió contraer matrimonio, está felizmente casada, su esposo trabaja en una empresa que vende repuestos para automóviles. Actualmente están viviendo donde sus suegros de forma temporal, pues uno de ellos enfermó y decidieron estar cerca para apoyarlos y cuidarlos.


Evelyn ha abierto una pequeña ferretería, negocio que comenzó porque un cuñado de ella que se dedica al sacerdocio, la incentivó a abrir un negocio propio, y como ella ya tenía experiencia como empleada en una ferretería se motivó a hacerlo, ya tiene 3 años de poseerla y poco a poco con ayuda de Dios sus ganancias han aumentado. 


El préstamo solicitado es para comprar material de construcción, como bloques, hierro, cemento, entre otros para su ferretería.
De esta manera daría más abasto con la demanda de la clientela que visita constantemente el negocio y así dar un salto en cuanto a diversificación de productos y crecimiento en ingresos.

Ella sueña con hacer que su ferretería sea muy grande y que tenga toda cantidad de producto para que cualquier cliente que llegue, se pueda ir satisfecho con su compra.
También desea que sus hijos crezcan sanos y darles buena educación para que lleguen a ser personas de bien y que formen buenos hogares.
texts.en:
Evelyn, age 40, successfully finished her high school education and then decided to dedicate completely to work. She started gaining experience and later decided to get married. She is happy living along with her husband, who works at a company selling spare parts for cars. They are temporarily living with their in-laws, since one of them became ill and decided to be near them for care and support. 

Evelyn has opened a small hardware store. She started this business because her brother-in-law, a clergyman, encouraged her to open her own business. Since she had experience as a hardware store employee, she was prompted to open a store. She has owned this business for 3 years and with God's help, her profits have gradually increased.

The requested loan is to purchase construction materials, such as blocks, iron, cement, etc. This way, she’d be able to satisfy the requests of her regular customers, diversify her products and obtain more profits. 

Evelyn dreams of having a large hardware store, containing every type of product. That way any customer who comes in can leave satisfied with their purchase.

She also wishes that her children grow up healthy and that she provides them with a good education so that they can become decent people and start good families.

loans.use: to buy construction materials, like blocks, iron, and cement, among others, for her hardware store.

loans.name: Santa Lucia Group

texts.en:
Magdalena is a 27 year old K’iche Maya from Santa Lucia la Reforma, a small town in southwestern Guatemala. She is single with two children and never had access to a formal education. In order to provide for her children, she began a small tortilla business. Magdalena joined the Friendship Bridge Trust Bank “Santa Lucia” to help finance her business with a microloan.

With a new loan, Magdalena wants to continue with her plan to expand her business. She wants to buy and install a grinder for her cornmeal. The new grinder is very important to her business since it will mean that she does not have to use an outside milling service which takes time and money away from her business. Magdalena is certain that with the new loan investment her business will be more productive.

Magdalena is grateful for the various subjects like health and education that the Trust Bank officer provides. Friendship Bridge believes that the combination of small loans and education, called “Microcredit Plus” is a combination that yields very positive results. Magdalena and the women in the “Santa Lucia” Trust Bank meet each month with a Friendship Bridge Loan Officer who shares timely and useful information with the women on a variety of subjects like health, hygiene and nutrition as well as self-esteem and violence against women. The women learn about effective business management practices as well, and gain essential knowledge about business planning, budgeting, accounting, customer service, marketing and pricing.

Magdalena and the eight other women of the “Santa Lucia” Trust Bank feel that with the necessary captial to finance their business, they can become independent and better their lives as well as the lives of their children. The entire “Santa Lucia” Trust Bank thanks KIVA investors for believing in them and investing in their businesses!

loans.use: to buy and install a grinder for her cornmeal.

loans.name: Pamela Lizet

texts.es: Pamela tiene 20 años de edad es soltera. Ella se encuentra en el sexto ciclo de la especialidad de estomatología le falta 02 años para terminar su carrera. Ella trabaja  para una empresa de transporte en el área de cotización. El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de materiales instrumentos para continuar con sus estudios. Su mayor deseo es terminar su carrera profesional y poder ejercer en forma independientes. Ella agradece a los inversionistas KIVA por el crédito brindado.
texts.en:
Pamela is 20 years old and single. She is in her sixth cycle of the specialty of stomatology. She still has 2 years left to finish her career. She works for a transport company, in the payments department. 

The loan will be used to buy materials and instruments to continue with her studies. Her biggest wish is to finish her professional career and exercise her profession independently. She is thankful to Kiva lenders for the given loan.

loans.use: to buy materials and instruments.

loans.name: Florecer Group

texts.en:
San Francisco el Alto is a city in Totonicapan in southwest Guatemala. On market days in this town, you can buy and sell everything from small hair accessories, to large quantities of clothing, to animals – goats, pigs, beasts of burden, chickens, turkeys, etc. It is in this marketplace that the women of the Friendship Bridge Trust Bank “Florecer” (Flourish) sell their products. There are 15 women in the group with an average age of 40 years.

A member of the group is Julia who is 38 years old and married with three children.  All three are in school this year. Julia buys and sells clothing throughout the market nearest her. She sells four days a week. Julia is asking for a new loan in order to buy more merchandise since the Guatemalan Independence Day festivities are approaching which usually means more sales. She plans to buy shorts, shirts, scarves, flags, pants, skirts and blouses to cover all market needs. This will allow her to generate more income. 

This is Julia’s third loan cycle which means that she and her group have shown a great deal of responsibility with their monthly payments. For this reason they are confident in applying for a new loan cycle. They have learned a great deal from the “Microcredit Plus” program of Friendship Bridge which has taught them good business management, budgeting, marketing and customer service, proving that the combination of small loans and education provides positive results. The women of “Florecer” have truly flourished because of the KIVA investors!!!

loans.use: to buy shorts, shirts, scarves, flags, pants, skirts and blouses to cover all market needs and allow her to generate more income.

loans.name: Rula

texts.en: Rula is a 20-year-old single lady living with her family, which consists of eight members. She is an ambitious young lady who is seeking to work in her field of study after graduation. Rula is a third year university student majoring in Arabic Language. She needs your help in giving her this loan because she currently doesn't have enough money to pay for her upcoming semester fees completely.

loans.use: to pay for her upcoming semester fees

loans.name: Yeni Lisseth

texts.es:
Yeni de es una joven de 22 años de edad, estudio hasta séptimo grado pues en su cantón la escuela solo forma alumnos hasta ese nivel ya para continuar con los demás años hay que viajar bastante lejos a otra escuela y la situación económica de su familia le limitó poder continuar, está acompañada y su pareja trabaja en la agricultura sembrando granos básicos para el consumo familiar, tiene tres hijos de los cuales solo dos van a la escuela.

Ella se dedica a los oficios del hogar, como lo es la atención de sus hijos y de su pareja que trabaja fuertemente para ofrecerles una mejor calidad de vida.

Yeni necesita el préstamo para cancelar la reparación de una motocicleta, pues la caja de las velocidades se dañó y está en un taller para que le efectúen los ajustes necesarios.

Ella planea trabar fuerte con su pareja para superarse, mejorar su vivienda y para que sus hijos sean personas preparadas académicamente.
texts.en:
Yeni is young woman, who is 22 years old. She studied through seventh grade, since the school in her area only had students until this level and since, to continue with the remaining years, she would have had to travel very far to another school. Her family’s financial situation prevented her from continuing school. She is married, and her spouse works in agriculture, growing basic grains for the family’s consumption. She has three children, of whom only two go to school.

She focuses on the household work, such as caring for her children and for her spouse, who works very hard to offer their family a better quality of life.

Yeni needs a loan to pay for motorcycle repairs, since the gear box was damaged and since the motorcycle is in a workshop so that the necessary adjustments can be completed.

She plans to work hard with her spouse to better themselves, to improve their house, and so that their children can be educated.

loans.use: to pay for motorcycle repairs, since the gear box was damaged and since the motorcycle is in a workshop so that the necessary adjustments can be completed.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en: Ahmad is a third year university student majoring in Mining Engineering. Being an ambitious young man, he is planning to work in his field of study as soon as he gets his Bachelors' degree. Ahmad is staying in university housing to be near his university. He has applied for this loan because he is currently facing financial problems that are not helping him in paying his housing rental fees.

loans.use: to pay for his university housing rental fees

loans.name: El Roble Group

texts.en:
The Friendship Bridge Trust Bank “El Roble” (The Oak Tree) has finished its first loan cycle through KIVA and is now soliciting a second loan cycle through KIVA. Because they successfully concluded their first loan cycle, the eight women of “El Roble” are confident they can ask for new working capital.

The group is located in Quetzaltenango, Guatemala. This is the story of Teresa, an entrepreneurial woman with high aspirations. Teresa is involved with the fabrication of piñatas and other festival items. After eight years in business, she was able to expand and sell her merchandise to wholesalers. Her business is doing so well that she has hired two young women to help her, which enables them to continue with their studies. This is Teresa’s third loan cycle with Friendship Bridge. The loan is needed to buy wire, different colored papers, glue, and other materials that are needed for piñata production. 

Once again, the women of the Trust Bank “El Roble” are very grateful for the confidence shown by the KIVA investors that has given them the opportunity to maintain and/or augment their businesses. The loans have given them the ability to have a better quality of life for themselves and their families. It is important to note that the “Microloan Plus” program that the Friendship Bridge Trust Bank officer brings to the members of “El Roble” each month includes business management, budgeting, accounting, customer service and other topics that help empower the women. This combination of small loans and education provides positive results. Thank you KIVA investors for helping to make this program possible!!!

loans.use: to buy wire, different colored papers, glue, and other materials that are needed for piñata production.

loans.name: Ukotzijal Ixim Group

texts.en:
The Friendship Bridge trust bank Ukotzijal Ixim ("Corn Flower") is located in San Francisco el Alto in the highlands of Guatemala. The trust bank is composed of eleven women who want to better themselves. The majority of the women produce clothing. They are also involved in animal husbandry – pigs, chickens and turkeys.

One of the garment makers is Josefa, a 40-year-old married woman, whose husband is a tailor. They have five children between the ages of 18 and 9 years old. Eight years ago, Josefa and her husband began a family business. The business generates income to cover the basic necessities for the family. She is currently asking for a new loan in order to buy fabrics of different textures and colors to produce more special orders for schoolchildren for the upcoming Guatemalan Independence Day festivals.

Josefa is very grateful to the Kiva investors and to Friendship Bridge for their confidence in giving her and the members of her group loans that improve their businesses and thus improve the income of each family. The Friendship Bridge Microcredit Plus program that provides education in a variety of very important subjects, such as business management, budgeting, and marketing, as well as health, hygiene and self-empowerment, shows very positive results. Thank you Kiva investors!

loans.use: To buy fabrics of different textures and colors to produce more special orders for schoolchildren for the upcoming Guatemalan Independence Day festivals

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cement, sand, and gravel and to pay the workers she needs to cement the floors and polish the walls of her house.

loans.name: Braulio Antonio

texts.en:
Braulio is a Kubo Financiero’s client and this is his story:

Braulio is 23 years old, is married and father of a little girl. The three of them live in Braulio’s parent’s house where they cooperate to help with the house expenditures.

He makes a living by doing mechanical repairs in a shop he has owned for two years now during the day and driving a taxing during the afternoons. Braulio asks for this loan for two reasons: to pay the fee necessary to get his girl into school and to repair his taxi unit.

With the hard work he puts into his two jobs, Braulio aspires to carry out his daughter and looks forward to furnishing his house.

loans.use: to enroll his daughter at school and repair his taxi unit.

loans.name: Esterlina

texts.en: Esterlina is 51 years old. She is known in the Mobod area for her sari-sari store. She is actively participating in the various programs and services that the co-op offers. She hopes to live comfortably, with a decent house, for which she applied for a loan to purchase plywood, nails, and sticks. She hopes to maintain her membership in good-standing, with a good repayment record. It matters that she has been given a priority, as a microfinance member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC). This is what she is thankful for, when all her financing needs of her retailing business are supported by PMPC.

loans.use: to purchase plywood, nails, and sticks for her house.

loans.name: Señor Del Rimac Group

texts.es: El grupo “SEÑOR DEL RIMAC” está conformado por socias dedicadas al comercio minoristas. Gladys tiene 40 años de edad es soltera con 02 hijos dependientes. Ella teje chompas chalecos ropones colchas a base de lana actividad que aprendió de su madre. y en fechas de inicio de clases elabora chompas escolares. El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de lanas hilos botones palitos y revistas de tejido. En sus tiempos libres presta servicios de domestica. El grupo agradece a los inversionistas KIVA por el crédito brindado. Gladys es la primera del lado izquierdo.
texts.en: The group “SEÑOR DEL RIMAC” is made up of members dedicated to retail. Gladys is 40 years old and single with 2 dependent children. She knits sweaters, vests, dresses, and blankets from wool, an activity that she learned from her mother. At the beginning of the school year, she makes school sweaters. She will invest the loan in buying wool, thread, buttons, needles, and knitting magazines. In her free time, Gladys works as a maid. The group is thankful to the Kiva investors for the loans they have provided. Gladys is the first woman on the left.

loans.use: to buy wool, thread, buttons, needles, and knitting magazines.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.es: Samuel de 60 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a su compañera de vida, su hija y sus dos nietos. Él es un hombre trabajador que cada día se esfuerza por salir adelante con el apoyo de su familia, por lo que se gana la vida prestando sus servicios domésticos en un centro escolar, además posee una pequeña panadería en la que su compañera de vida y su hija se encargan de la elaboración del pan. Samuel desea terminar de construir un  muro que tiene a medio construir por falta de financiamiento por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para comprar: cemento, arena, grava, bloques de cemento y hierro para terminar de construir un muro en su vivienda.
texts.en: Samuel is 60 years old and lives in his own house with his wife, his daughter, and his two grandchildren. He is a hard-working man, who works everyday to go forward with the support of his family. He earns money by offering cleaning services in a learning center; he also has a small bakery in which his wife and daughter are responsible for making bread. Samuel wants to finish building a wall that is half-built because of a lack of money. As a result, he requests a loan from FUSAI to buy cement, sand, gravel, cement blocks, and iron to finish building a wall in his house.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, gravel, cement blocks, and iron to finish building a wall in his house.

loans.name: Gulirom

texts.ru: Гулиром родилась и выросла в сельской местности. После окончания средней школы она не имела возможности поступить в университет. Гулиром после замужества несколько лет сидела дома без работы и воспитала своих 2 детей. Постепенно ее муж накопил денег, и они вместе начали бизнес скотоводством. Вот уже в течение 5 лет Гулиром занимается этим бизнесом. Она данное время имеет 5 коров. Каждый день она доит 15 литр молока и продает местным жителям. Гулиром хочет увеличить оборотный капитал и таким образом развевать бизнес. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 4000 сомони для покупки коров. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Gulirom was born and raised in a rural area. After finishing high school she did not have the opportunity to go to university. She spent a few years after she got married staying at home without work and raising her two children. Her husband slowly saved money and they started a livestock business together. Now it has already been five years since Gulirom started raising livestock. She currently has five cows. She gets 15 liters of milk every day and sells it to the local residents. Gulirom wants to increase her working capital and expand her business. She is applying for a loan of 4,000 somoni to buy cows. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: To buy cows and increase her working capital

loans.name: Rosienel

texts.en: Rosienel is 40 years old, married and lives in Oroquieta City, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. In order to earn a living, she takes in and raises pigs from their neighborhood. The piglets' owners share in the profit upon sale, to be divided 60/40 or 70/30 depending in their agreement. With a desire to earn more, she decided to raise pigs on her own as well. Through Pauglam MPC she obtained the capital to purchase her original piglets & feed. Now, she requests a loan of 12,000 PHP to buy additional feed. She really hopes & prays that her business would grow and benefit her family, in addition to adding to the income of her husband. Someday, she wants to build a concrete pig cage to easily keep more sanitary conditions.

loans.use: to buy additional bags of feed.

loans.name: Berly

texts.en: Berly is juggling a business and supervising the renovation of their home. Berly hopes to live comfortably with a house of good roofing supported by her loan of Php 49,900. She hopes to maintain her membership in good standing with good repayment record. Berly has been given a priority as a Microfinance member of PMPC. This is what she is thankful for when all her financing needs for her retailing business where supported by PMPC.

loans.use: to renovate her house.

loans.name: Empenita

texts.en:
Empenita is married with five children. Empenita is 62 years old and lives in Pan-ay Clarin, Philippines.

Empenita is a farmer and grows corn crops to earn a living. She has been doing this for ten years. She has requested a loan to buy fertilizers and insecticides.

Empenita has been a member of PMPC for five years. In the future, Empenita hopes to put up other business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and insecticides.

loans.name: Conchita

texts.en:
Conchita is married with six children. Conchita is 50 years old and lives in Segatic Diot, Clarin, Philippines.

Conchita sells assorted goods to earn a living and has had this business for eight years. Each month, she earns 8,000 PHP doing this type of work. She has requested a loan for 50,000 to restock her store with basic commodities.

Conchita has been a member of PMPC for two years. In the future, Conchita hope to put up other profitable business.

loans.use: to restock store with basic commodities.

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.es:
Julio es un campesino humilde y trabajador de 51 años de edad, que desde pequeño aprendió todas las labores del campo, gracias a las enseñanzas de su padre.
Actualmente posee cultivos de yuca, ñame y plátano, cuyas cosechas son recolectadas y vendidas en el mercado del pueblo donde reside, esto le genera los recursos para llevar el sustento diario a su hogar y solventar las necesidades básicas de su esposa y 6 hijos.

Se motiva a solicitar el crédito con el fin de invertirlo en la compra de insumos agrícolas al por mayor (abonos, pesticidas, fertilizantes), esto le permitirá seguir cuidado de sus cultivos y mejorar la productividad de la próxima cosecha, lo que beneficiará los ingresos que percibe por cada venta.

Julio manifiesta que su mayor anhelo es seguir luchando para generar una estabilidad económica y brindar a su familia mejores condiciones de vida y bienestar.
texts.en:
Julio is a humble and hard-working farmer aged 51, who learned all about working the fields when he was a child, thanks to his father's teaching.
Currently he grows cassava, yam and plantain; the crops are harvested and sold in the market of the town where he lives. This generates the income to bring home the daily food and to meet the basic needs of his wife and 6 children.

He is applying for the loan in order to invest in the purchase at wholesale of agricultural supplies (manure, pesticides, fertilizers). This will allow him to continue caring for his crops and to improve the productivity of the next harvest, which will benefit the earnings which he receives for each sale.

Julio says that his greatest desire is to continue fighting to generate economic stability and provide his family with better living and well-being conditions.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, seeds, irrigation and items for the preparation of the soil and to improve the quality of life of his 6 children.

loans.name: María Yaneth

texts.es:
María de 20 años de edad, logró estudiar hasta bachillerato, actualmente está acompañada y su pareja trabaja como cajero en una institución financiera, por el momento no tiene hijos y vive con su suegra y cuatro cuñados.

Ella es secretaria en un despacho jurídico, trabajo que consiguió gracias a la modalidad de bachillerato en secretariado que estudió, ya tiene dos años de estar realizando esta actividad, trabaja 5 días a la semana en horarios de 8:00 AM a 4:00 PM y su lugar de trabajo está a 10 minutos de su casa por lo cual se va a pie.

El préstamo lo necesita para terminar de construir su casa, comprará bloques, cemento y hierro.

Ella planea seguir trabajado para  hacer su casa mas bonita, y que algún día que tenga hijos tengan un lugar agradable donde vivir.
texts.en:
Maria is 20 years old and has completed studying to earn a diploma. She is now married, and her partner works as a teller in a financial institution. At the moment, she does not have children, and she lives with her mother-in-law and four siblings-in-law.

She is a secretary in a legal office, work that she found thanks to the type of secretarial course she completed. She has been doing this work for 2 years. She works 5 days a week from 8:00am to 4:00pm, and her office is 10 minutes from her house, so she can walk there.

The loan is needed to finish building her house. She will buy blocks, cement, and iron.

She plans to continue working so that she can have a more beautiful house, and so that someday her children will have a nice place to live.

loans.use: to finish building her house by buying blocks, cement, and iron.

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en: Marivic has signed her membership with PMPC and received the needed capital to start up a sari-sari (convenience store) business. She is thankful for the capital extended to a small time loaner like her. Marivic is able to turn the tide in her favor and has made good sales these days. She wants to take advantage of this good fortune. Recently, Marivic took out a loan to restock a variety of dry goods. In the future, she hopes to build a decent home for the family.

loans.use: to restock a variety of dry goods

loans.name: Maribel

texts.en: Maribel is 33 years old and lives in Segatic Diot, Clarin, Philippines. She is married and has 2 children. Maribel has a business selling snacks in the community, earning about PHP 10,000 each month. Maribel has requested a loan to buy needed ingredients for her business. Maribel has been a member of PMPC for 1 year. In the future, Maribel would like to put up other profitable businesses.

loans.use: to buy needed ingredients for her snack vending business

loans.name: Maria Melchora

texts.es:
María Melchora tiene 40 años, es casada, vive en casa propia con su conyuge y menor hijo de 08 años de edad, el cual estudia en colegio de la zona, ella es persona con buenas referencias personales y laborales, vive en una comunidad dedicada al comercio, agricultura y ganaderia, ubicada en el distrito de Cayaltí, en la provincia de Chiclayo, región de Lambayeque, costa norte de Perú.

María Melchora se dedica a la venta de abarrotes en general tiene una pequeña bodega, desde hace más de 10 años, necesita préstamo para invertir en compra de mercaderia (arroz, azúcar, cafe, entre otros) para poder surtir su tienda con una mayor diversidad y cantidad de productos; y asi poder atender todos los gustos y pedidos de su publico sonsumidor, lo que le permitirá aumentar sus ingresos, mejorar sus ganancias y por ende su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
María Melchora is 40 years old, married and lives at her own house along with her life partner and her 8-year-old son, who attends to a local school. 

She is a person with good personal and work references, lives in a community dedicated to commerce, agriculture and stockbreeding. It is located in the district of Cayaltí, at the Chiclayo province, in the Lamayeque region,  northern coast of Peru. 

María Melchora sells groceries. She has had a small grocery store for the past 10 years. She needs this loan to buy supplies (rice, sugar and coffee, among others) and restock her store with a wider diversity and greater quantity of products. 

This way she will keep all of her customers satisfied, thus generating more incomes, improving her profits and her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy merchandise and supply her grocery store with more diversity and quantity of products.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en: Teresita is juggling a business and supervising the renovation of her home. Teresita hopes to live comfortably with a house of good roofing supported by her loan of PHP 49,900. She hopes to maintain her membership in good standing with a good repayment record. Teresita has given a priority as a microfinance member of PMPC. This is what she is thankful for when all her financing needs for her retail business were supported by PMPC.

loans.use: to renovate her house

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen has a stall in the market, selling ukay-ukay (used clothes). Helen buys clothes in volume to access big discounts, and retails to her customers. She has been five years in the business. Helen has two children, and her husband is a farmer. She shares that most of her earnings from the business go to their daily food expenditures. 

Her goal is to get higher sales and income, as well as be able to save some of it for the future of her children. Helen wants to export more clothes for kids, but she doesn’t have enough capital to make it a reality. Despite this, Helen is requesting a loan of PHP 50,000 to buy a volume of clothes to sell. She hopes to make more sales and increase her profit.

loans.use: to buy a volume of clothes to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies, poultry, and pigs to strengthen her business and to be able to grow more corn.

loans.name: Luisa Melba

texts.es: Melba es una señorita  de 25 años, es madre soltera, su hija tiene un año de edad, Melba vive con su hermano, su cuñada y tres sobrinos, son 5 años que Melba se dedica a la crianza de pollos, comenta que vive en un lugar donde no tiene acceso al agua potable y tiene que coger de un renaciente de agua, el crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de pollos para mejorar su negocio, la aspiración de Melba es mejorar sus ingresos y de esta manera darle un buen futuro  a su hija mediante el estudio y la educación que alcance.
texts.en: Melba is a 25-year-old woman and is a single mother. Her daughter is one year old. Melba lives with her brother, her sister-in-law, and her three nephews. Melba has been raising chickens for 5 years. She says that she lives in a place where there is no access to drinking water, and she has to carry it from a water source. The loan will be invested in the purchase of chickens to improve her business. Melba’s hope is to improve her income and, in this way, to give her daughter a better future through education.

loans.use: to buy chickens.

loans.name: Mila

texts.en: Mila is married and has 5 children. She is 58 years old and lives in Segatic Diot, Clarin, Philippines. Mila is a farmer who grows banana crops to earn a living. She has been doing this for 10 years. Mila has requested a loan to buy fertilizers and insecticides for her banana plantation. Mila has been a member of PMPC for 2 years. In the future, she hopes to save more and put up other businesses.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and insecticides for her banana plantation

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en: Thelma is married and has 4 children. She is 42 years old and lives in Pan-ay Clarin, Philippines. For the past 8 years, Thelma has operated a business selling a variety of products. She earns PHP 7,000 each month doing this type of work. Thelma has requested a loan of PHP 10,000 to restock her store with basic commodities. Thelma has been a member of PMPC for 9 years. In the future, she hopes to save more in case of emergencies.

loans.use: to restock her store with basic commodities

loans.name: Gloria Ester

texts.es:
Gloria tiene 50 años de edad, culminó sus estudios de bachillerato, está casada y su esposo trabaja es sastre, tiene cuatro hijos, una de ellas ya está casada y es enfermera, dos estudian en la universidad y el otro hijo de 14 años está estudiando 9° grado

Gloria realiza trabajos agrícolas en el cual le ayudan sus hijos, además tiene venta de platillos típicos. Para llegar al lugar donde cultiva se va a pie y tarda 20 minutos.

Ella necesita el crédito para comprar abono, veneno y foliares para aplicarle a su cultivo, este crédito será de gran ayuda pues su esposo trabaja y ella ayuda en lo que puede con los ingresos para el estudio de sus hijos.

Su sueño es trabajar arduamente para generar más ingresos económicos a su hogar, terminar de darle la educación a sus hijos para que se preparen.
texts.en:
Gloria is 50 years old. She finished her high school studies. She is married and her husband words as a tailor. Gloria has four children. One of them is married and works as a nurse. Two study at a university. Her other son is 14 years old and studying in 9th grade.

Gloria does agricultural work in which she helps her children. In addition, she sells typical dishes. To get to their crops, Gloria walks 20 minutes.

Gloria needs the loan to buy manure, pesticides, and fertilizers to apply them to her crops. This loan will be a great help since her husband works, and Gloria helps however she can with the income for her children's studies.

Gloria's dream is to work hard to generate more income for her home and to be able to continue giving her children an education so they will be prepared.

loans.use: to buy manure, pesticides, and fertilizers to apply to her crops.

loans.name: Sweet Angeli

texts.en:
Sweet Angeli is married with two children. She is 24 years old and lives in Duanguican, Tudela, Philippines.

Sweet Angeli is a farmer and grows corn crops to earn a living. She has been doing this for four years. She has requested a loan to buy additional fertilizers.

Sweet Angeli has been a member of PMPC for 10 months. In the future, she hopes to save for future consumption.

loans.use: to buy additional fertilizers

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en: Leonora finds pleasure in doing her gardening activities. Not only that she is doing her hobby, she earns an income as well. At the age of 62 and married, she busies herself to sufficiently provide for the family. She grabbed the opportunity to become a full pledge member of PMPC. She credits to the cooperative her capital in supporting her gardening activities. Recently, she applied for a loan to pay for the redemption of her pawned coconut land to have another source to pay her loan. In the future, Leonora wishes to become the supplier of flowers in the neighboring towns.

loans.use: to pay for redemption of her pawned coconut land.

loans.name: Vanessa

texts.en:
Vanessa is 32 years old, married, and has two children who are in grade school. Her husband is an auto electrician, while she is doing her food processing business. Vanessa is making tocino, longganisa (sausage), and some candies. Vanessa has been running the business for five years now. 

She wants to extend the products to their near villages so that she will get a bigger income, but she can’t do this because of lack of capital. For this reason, Vanessa is asking for a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy raw meats, and ingredients for making frozen foods and candies. 

Vanessa hopes to support all her children’s needs with her earnings from her business.

loans.use: to buy raw meats, and ingredients for making frozen foods and candies.

loans.name: Shahnoza

texts.ru: Шахноза родилась в 1983 году. Она замужем и воспитывает 3 детей. Ее дети несовершеннолетние. Шахноза хочет начать свой бизнес, так как доход ее мужа не хватает для обеспечения семьи со всеми необходимыми средствами. Шахноза планирует начать бизнес скотоводством.  С такой целью она участвовала в курсе «Добейся Успеха» организованного Ассоциация Деловых Женщин и получила сертификат. Она будет покупать скот, откармливать несколько месяцев и продавать на местном рынке. С бизнесом она будет справляться сама. Она ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en: Shahnoza was born in 1983. She is married and has three young children. Shahnoza wants to start a business because her husband's income is not enough to take care of her family's needs. She is planning to start a livestock business, so she took part in the "Achieving Success" course organized by the Association of Business Women and received a certificate. She will buy cattle, fatten them for a few months, and then sell them at the local market. She will take care of the business herself. She awaits your kindness and hopes for your charity.

loans.use: To buy cattle and start a new livestock business

loans.name: Magelou

texts.en:
Magelou is 37 years old and lives in Paglaum Dumalinao ZDS. She is married with two children.

Magelou operates a sari-sari store selling basic commodities. She has had this business for four years. She requested a loan to buy goods and dry goods for her store.

Magelou has been a member of PMPC for three years. In the future, Magelou hopes to build a big store in her town.

loans.use: To buy goods for her store.

loans.name: Wilson Osmel

texts.es:
Wilson es un joven de 21 años de edad, estudió hasta sexto grado, está acompañado y su pareja es ama de casa, aún no tiene hijos, vive con sus padres y dos hermanos, de él solo depende su pareja.
Él se dedica al trabajo de motorista, posee un pickup con el cual trabaja brindando el servicio de viajes a personas que hacen  salidas turísticas, ya tiene 3 años en esta actividad  pues considera que es rentable, además en el tiempo que no tiene contratos para viajes, trabaja como ayudante de albañil, de forma que realiza varios oficios para no depender únicamente de una actividad.
Este crédito lo necesita para comprar  llantas nuevas para su pickup, y así tenerlo en buenas condiciones ya que es su principal fuente de trabajo.
Él espera seguir trabajando fuerte con el pickup pues el préstamo le ayudará porque podrá hacer el cambio de llantas, además sueña construir su propia vivienda.
texts.en:
Wilson is a young man of 21 years of age. He studied until sixth grade. He is married and his wife is a homemaker. He still does not have children. He lives with his parents and two brothers. His wife depends only on him. 

He works as a driver. He has a pickup with which he works providing trip services to people who go on tourist outings. He has worked in this business for three years, and he considers it worthwhile. When he does not have trip contracts, he works as a construction helper, and in that way he carries out various trades in order to not depend solely on one business. 

He needs this loan to buy new tires for his pickup in order to have it in good condition since it is his main source of work. He hopes to continue working hard with the pickup since the loan will help him because he will be able to make the tire change, and in addition he dreams of building his own home.

loans.use: to buy new tires for his pickup in order to have it in good condition since it is his main source of work.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
GoneVaca (the "Company”) is a social media website for sharing travel adventures.  The creator of the Company is Sarah. The idea for a travel- sharing website came from Sarah’s love of traveling and storytelling. Growing up her family loved adventure, so their travels mostly included a pop-up camper and long road trips. With her parents and grandparents, Sarah traveled across the United States during summer school breaks. There are pictures of her standing on a boat in Niagara Falls, building sandcastles on Virginia Beach, and eating ice cream in a small town off the coast of Washington State. As an adult, Sarah still loves to travel and she wants to share her adventures with others via the internet. So that’s how the idea of GoneVaca.com came about.

GoneVaca.com is not only a website to upload pictures, videos, and vacation stories; it is a great resource for travelers. Members can post reviews, give travel advice, and give travel tips about their vacations. Then members can chat with other members about vacation destinations. As a social media site and not a business review site, GoneVaca.com will be centered on the members' personal travel experience. As a traveler, Sarah loves the concept of being able to contact and chat with other travelers before booking a trip.
 
Starting a social media website has been a challenge. GoneVaca.com is not selling a product; it gives people a way to connect about traveling. So finding the right developers to bring the dream to life was a challenge. But with the Kiva funding, Sarah found the right website developers and will use the money to make GoneVaca.com a reality. Sarah hope that GoneVaca.com will give people a way to tell their travel stories, find great travel information, and make traveling friends.

Thank you so much for supporting GoneVaca.com.

loans.use: to develop a web and mobile application

loans.name: Arvin

texts.en:
Arvin is single. He lives in Comunal, Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte.

Arvin is a rice retailer to earn a living and has had this business for three years. Each month, he earns 12,000 PHP doing this type of business. He has requested a loan of PHP 30,000 for additional capital.

Arvin is a new member of PMPC. In the future, Arvin hopes to expand his business.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of rice to sell and build a store

loans.name: Reynida

texts.en:
Reynida, 55, is married and has four children. She runs a small general store in her village.

Reynida has been with the ASKI program for more than three years. She requests 30,000 PHP to buy sugar, rice, flour, salt, soft drinks, and snacks to restock her shop. She plans to continue operating a profitable store so that she can make improvements in her family's living standards.

loans.use: to buy sugar, rice, flour, salt, soft drinks, and snacks.

loans.name: Kristine

texts.en:
This is Kristine. She has faithfully paid back her previous loan, which she used for her business. She has been operating her own business for three years, and she earns well from this. She had to work hard, with the determination of having a better income, to provide their children with a better education. Having a bigger responsibility requires more effort to provide for their needs, especially for her children.

To improve sales, Kristine would like to apply for a new loan to purchase additional merchandise to increase her product inventory. At an amount of PHP 51,000, she could already purchase more quantity of electric fans, rice cookers, flat irons, bags and other products needed in her business. She sincerely lets you know her heartfelt thanks and appreciation for this assistance in advance.

In the future, she dreams of growing her business and her customers. She also desires to have her own house in a subdivision, and that her children will be able to complete their education. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week. This is where she finds strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for merchandise and products such as electric fans, rice cookers, flat irons, bags, etc.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is thankful for the financial assistance extended to her. She was able to buy more quantities of products like meats, rice, vegetables, condiments and seasonings. Her earnings were a big help for her personal, household, and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 20,000 PHP loan for her to purchase raw ingredients and supplies needed in her business. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and other business expenses. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Teresita hopes to own and manage a restaurant someday. She only wants for her family to be always provided with everything through the help of her business. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship members* to share stories of her work and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for raw ingredients like rice, pork, chicken, vegetables, and other products

loans.name: Judalyn

texts.en:
Judalyn is a very hardworking entrepreneur from Cavite, Philippines. She is 28 years old and has children. She is married to Jowell, who helps to provide for the needs of the family. She operates a rug-making business, and her income from the business is helping with their everyday needs and expenditures. In addition to this, she also sells dried fish as her additional source of income.

She mainly offers rugs, from the round, palm-sized ones to the much larger doormats and other crafts that most rug-makers come up with every day. As rugs are a major part of Filipino housekeeping and cleaning, rugs are one of the most common products that can be bought, sometimes even from a peddler while you are riding in a speeding jeepney down the highway. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every week.

Judalyn is taking out a PHP 10,000 loan to buy supplies and other materials needed in her business. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more raw materials like fabric, thread and other items which are necessary to increase her inventory.

In the future, she dreams of success in her rug-making business. She only hopes for her family to be always happy. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for raw materials needed in her business.

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene has sold fried chicken and other cooked meals in her community for almost two years to earn an income. Her husband, Roger, helps her to provide for their everyday needs. Arlene is shown in the photo while preparing and cleaning her pre-ordered chicken meat which she will cook.

She is 35 years old and blessed with two children. 

In the Philippines, the working community and most  families  eat home-cooked meals during evenings because all of the family members are at home to take part in the meal. This is both a family tradition and a matter of convenience and frugal living. It is considered a waste of money and time to spend cooking gas and food for one to two people when buying cooked food cost less than raw food. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of 500 PHP in sales every day.

Arlene would like 10,000 PHP  to buy chicken, pork and seasonings that are needed. Being a kind and friendly parent, she is hoping to further improve the business through this financial assistance.

Arlene wishes to build and expand her business to secure her family's future. She meets weekly with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business; she draws strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God that she studies.

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To purchase rice, pork, chicken, vegetables and products needed in her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for more vegetables needed in her business.

loans.name: Edgar Jose

texts.es:
Edgar es un agricultor de nacimiento criado y formado con los hermosos valores del campo. Vive en el municipio de Tierra Alta, Córdoba en unión libre con su esposa y es padre de 3 hijos.

Edgar no conforme con los ingresos que obtenía como agricultor decidió montar una tienda para complementar sus actividades, con la gran ventaja de ser de los pocos negocios de este tipo en su vereda.

Edgar solicita un crédito para la compra de surtido para su tienda, básicamente grano y abarrotes, snacks y dulces los cuales complementarían muy bien los ya conocidos productos que distribuye y que incluso vende lo que cultiva en su tierra, también requiere la adecuación y mejoramiento de su tienda.

De esta forma podrá impactar positivamente su economía y tendrá una mejor presentación de su tienda.
texts.en:
Edgar is a farmer since birth, born and raised with the noble values of the field. He lives in the municipality of Tierra Alta, Córdoba in free union with his wife and he is the father of three children. 

Edgar, unsatisfied with the income he was obtaining as a farmer, decided to put together a store to complement his business, with the great advantage of being one of few businesses of this kind on his street.

Edgar requests a loan to buy supplies for his store, basically grain and groceries, snacks and sweets, which will complement very well the already known products that he distributes which include selling what he farms on his land. He also requires remodeling and improvement of his store. 

In this way he will be able to positively impact his economy and he will have a better appearance of his store.

loans.use: to buy supplies for his store such as grain and groceries, and in that way he will be able to establish himself and improve the appearance of his business.

loans.name: Gerevazio

texts.en:
Gerevazio is a thirty nine year old, divorced, hard-working man living in Kamwenge, Uganda. He owns a metal workshop, a business he started to improve his standard of living. He also earns additional income from farming. He hopes to become very rich and successful; however, his main challenge is the increased price of workshop materials. 

He is requesting a loan to buy more workshop materials.

loans.use: to buy more workshop materials.

loans.name: Edith

texts.en: Edith is 32 years old and married with six children, living in Kasese, Uganda. For  three years, Edith has been operating a restaurant to earn income and support her children. She also practices farming, where she gets additional income. She began the business to look after herself and pay school dues. Edith is a hard-working person, hoping to expand her business into a big restaurant and buy land.Edith is faced with a challenge of competition and limited capital. She needs a loan to buy food, drinks, and other requirements for her restaurant.

loans.use: to buy food, drinks and other requirements for her restaurant.

loans.name: Shammeem

texts.en: Shammeem, a 54-year-old lady, has been selling vegetables in her locality, with her husband’s assistance, for many years. She uses the income to support her entire family. She is in her 7th loan cycle. Now, she has requested 50,000 PKR. She intends to use this loan amount to buy vegetables, including onions, tomatoes, potatoes, etc., to create a means of increasing revenues so she may able to generate a healthier source of income. She is thankful to Kashf for the loan and is hopeful that it will help her in providing a better living for her family

loans.use: to buy vegetables, including onions, tomatoes, potatoes, etc.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en: Maria is requesting a loan of $800.00 to improve her business. She is selling gasoline because she earns a good income from this business. She will use the loan to buy additional gasoline. She started to sell gasoline in 2014 with her own working capital of $150.00. She lives near the main road so many people come to buy her gasoline. She is happy with the loan offered by Tuba Rai Metin to her because with the loan from Tuba Rai Metin she will improve her business in the future.

loans.use: To buy gasoline.

loans.name: Angelina

texts.en:
Angelina lives in Oecusse and now is requesting a loan of $800 to improve her business in the future. 

She will use the loan to buy some additional supplies to keep in her kiosk such as coffee, salt, candies, mirror, scissors,  noodles, water, cooking oil,  soft drinks and hard drinks and other things to sell. 

Angelina opened her kiosk in 2012 with her own working capital of $300. 

She is happy with the loan that was offered from Tuba Rai Metin do she could have more working capital to buy more goods.

loans.use: To buy coffee, salt, candies, mirror, scissors,  noodles, water, cooking oil, soft drinks and hard drinks and other things to sell.

loans.name: Berta

texts.en:
Berta lives in Oecusse, She is a businesswoman, so she always finds ways to improve her business. 

Berta has a kiosk that she opened one year ago. She started to do business with her own working capital of $300. 

She is also happy because Tuba Rai Metin (TRM) gave her a loan to have more working capital to buy more goods. So she will use the loan to buy some goods to keep in her kiosk, such as cigarettes, candies,  detergent , shampoo, biscuits, cooking oils, and other things to sell including soft drinks to increase her income in the future.

loans.use: To buy cigarettes, candies,  detergent , shampoo, biscuits, cooking oils and other things to sell, including soft drinks.

loans.name: Braulio De Jesus

texts.es: Braulio de 52 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a su compañera de vida y sus 2 hijos una joven de 17 años y un varón de 11 años de edad. Él es un hombre trabajador que presta sus servicios de seguridad en una empresa, actividad que realiza desde hace 4 años y es gracias a ella que mantiene la economía familiar. Braulio desea encementar el piso y afinar las paredes de su vivienda, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para comprar: cemento, arena y grava para encementar el piso y repellar las paredes de su vivienda.
texts.en: Braulio, 52 years old, lives in his own home together with his life partner and their two children, a young girl of 17 years and a boy of 11 years of age. He is a hardworking man who lends his security services to a business, a job that he has carried out for the last four years and it is thanks to it that he maintains the family economy. Braulio wishes to cement the floor and refine the walls of his home, for which he requests a loan from FUSAI to buy: cement, sand, and gravel to cement the floor and plaster the walls of his home.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, and gravel to cement the floor and plaster the walls of his home.

loans.name: Tursun

texts.en:
As a married parent of 4 children, Tursun works hard to support her family. She has a fabric sales business in Tajikistan, and she has had this business for 32 years.

Tursun has been sustaining her business activities through her past 36 loans from Imon International organization. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money. In the future, Tursun hopes to improve her business in order to provide for the education of her children. She is going to increase her working capital and maximize profit. She is asking for a loan of 7500 Somoni to buy fabrics. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: To buy fabrics by increasing her working capital

loans.name: Mbissine's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe de 20 femmes fait parti du banc villageois qui a été crée le 20 septembre  2010. Il regroupe des membres qui vivent dans le même village et ceux des alentours.
Awa, la représentante du groupe est âgée de 29 ans. Elle est en position assise sur la photo et a levé la main pour se montrer. Elle est mariée et a 4 enfants  dont une fille.
Elle envisage travailler avec son mari qui  fait du commerce. elle va utiliser l'argent pour renforcer le commerce que tient son mari  pour qu’ils puissent acheter des habits destinés à la revente.
Avec les bénéfices ils gèrent ensemble les besoins en nourriture de la famille, les frais scolaires de ses 3 enfants qui vont à l’école.
texts.en:
This group of 20 women is part of the ’banc villageois’ that was created on September 20, 2010. It is composed of members living in and around the same village. Awa, the group’s representative, is 29 years old. She is sitting with a hand raised in the photo to indicate herself. She is married and has four children, including one girl. 

She envisions working with her husband, who works in commerce. She is going to use her money to bolster the business her husband has, so that they may purchase clothing to resell. With the profits, they jointly manage the food and education needs of the family for their three children going to school.

loans.use: to purchase clothing

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena is 42 years old and from Massipi; she is married with six kids. She is engaged in selling different products such as candies, noodles, soy sauce and soap.
