To have additional products to display in her store, she is requesting a loan amounting Php 12,000 to buy canned goods, snack food, spices and beverages for her business.

In the future, Rowena hopes that she can provide all the needs of her family to have a better future.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snack food, spices and beverages for her business

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel is 30 years old and married with two children, one child attends school. She works very hard to provide for them. 

She has run a general store for 5 years and requested a 30,000 PHP loan through ASKI  to purchase more groceries to sell. She sells a variety of items such as sugar, soap, snack foods and other groceries.

In the future Maricel would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Rosanna

texts.en: Mrs. Rosanna is a 41-year-old woman from Maningcol Ozamiz City Philippines. She is married with two kids. Having started her sari-sari business with a mere PHP 2,000 in capital, she is coping well with the challenges of her business. Her husband is very supportive in taking care of the business. The small business is doing so well that she has confidently decided to expand. She has joined Paglaum MPC for the chance to avail herself of loans. She is now requesting a loan to restock her store with basic commodities. She is determined to maintain a good credit standing whatever happens, so she can always go to the cooperative in the future. She started saving now for the education of her children.

loans.use: to restock her store with basic commodities

loans.name: Jenifah

texts.en: Jenifah is a married woman. She has 7 children. She describes herself to be honest and trustworthy. She operates a retail business where she sells cereals. She has been involved in this business for 5 years. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the lack of enough capital. She will use the Kes 10,000 loan to buy more stock of cereals. Her business goal is to have a large store within 5 years. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more stock of cereals

loans.name: Sibia

texts.en: Sibia is a married woman. She has 7 children. She describes herself to be ambitious. She operates a retail business where she sells cereals. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located in a good area, and her primary customers are individuals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be price fluctuations. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more stock of cereals. Her business goal is to expand business within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will own a big business. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more stock of cereals

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy more stock of meat

loans.name: Felismina

texts.en:
Felismina requests $600.00 USD to improve her business. She sells vegetables because she can earn a good income.

She will use the loan to buy manure, vegetable seeds, and other seeds. She started her business in 2012 with $ 25.00 of her own money. 

She is happy with the loan opportunity from Tuba Rai Metin  because  she will be able to improve her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy manure, vegetable seeds and other materials.

loans.name: God's Hand Group

texts.en:
God's Hand is a group of five hardworking members, who all live in the same district and have different income-generating activities in different places.

They are into the sale of paint, door locks, charcoal, underwear, products for mothers, provisions and general goods. 

The group representative is called Joseph, and he is the only male in the group photo. He is a 59-year-old married father of two. The group is on its sixth loan cycle, and he is requesting this sum to buy and sell paints, door locks and other hardware to customers. His wife helps him with the daily ongoings and his children's school fees. He has more than twenty years of experience in his business, and starts his day at 7.30 am, finishing at 6 pm. 

In the future he would like to be a distributor of these products, be financially autonomous and spread to other markets.

They will hold each other responsible for the repayment of the loan.

loans.use: To buy and sell paints, door locks and other hardware.

loans.name: Etleva

texts.en:
Etleva is a 26-year-old married mother of a nine-month-old and her profession is that of a hairdresser. She’s been doing it for almost four years. Currently, she has rented space, where she runs her little hairdressing business on her own. Her husband runs an auto shop and also does car tinting. They are a young couple who say they have goals that they want to accomplish.
 
Etleva is requesting a loan in the amount of 100,000 Albanian Lek to buy supplies for her hair salon. She remains hopeful that she will receive some consideration from lenders. This will be her first loan.

Etleva lives in the city of Lezha, situated in northern Albania.

loans.use: to buy supplies and other items needed for her hair salon.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en: Francisca, a business woman, started her business two years ago with her own working capital of $250.00. She had a lot of difficulties because she did not have enough working capital to buy needed items according to what people need. After two years she learned about Tuba Rai Metin, and she came to get information. She is very interested in it, and she is requesting a loan of $800.00. She will use the loan to buy more needed items to keep in her kiosk, such as slippers, candies, sugar, coffee, detergent, salt, biscuits, noodles, rice, and other things to sell. She has been busy with her business, and she is happy to do that. She is happy with the loan that was offered from Tuba Rai Metin for her to have more working capital to buy more goods.

loans.use: To buy slippers, candies, sugar, coffee, detergent, salt, biscuits, noodles, rice, and other things to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for her son’s university tuition.

loans.name: Manny

texts.en:
Manny is 44 years old and a father of two. He is raising his family in a rural community and makes a living as a farmer. 

His goal is to improve their standard of living and give his family a better life.  He plans to expand his vegetable plantation in order to increase his production. Having inadequate capital, he would like 15,000.00 PHP to buy certified seed, fertilizer, and herbicides.

He is a hard working father and hopes to further improve his farming business as well as their standard of living.

loans.use: to buy certified seed, fertilizer, and herbicides for vegetable production.

loans.name: Danita

texts.en:
This is Danita. Her previous loan  helped her business because she was able to purchase inventory items. The loan was also useful in meeting her everyday expenses and household expenses.  She and her husband work hard to provide for their everyday needs.

She would like to apply for another 25,000 PHP loan. It will be used to buy clothing, footwear, undergarments, cosmetics, detergents, coffee and other personal care products. The more items she has on display and available on hand, the better. More inventory will result in better profit. Her profit from this business will definitely help their daily needs and expenditures. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Danita wishes to expand her business.. She meets weekly with her co-fellowship members* to share stories of her life and business; she draws strength and inspiration from the Word of God that she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners who gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay micro finance loans.

loans.use: to buy clothing, footwear, and personal care products to increase her product inventory.

loans.name: Zaperith

texts.en: Zaperith is 44 years old and has six school-aged children. She engages in buying and reselling used clothes within the local community. Despite the hardship of living, she and her husband want to improve their status of living and educate their children so that they will be employed someday. Due to the high cost of school fees, she needs to increase her income and support the education of her children. To further improve the business, she would like to avail a loan of PHP12,000.00 to buy more stocks of used clothes to resell. She believes that this financial assistance will be a great help for her to improve the business.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of used clothes to resell

location.town: Brgy. Ganao, Dupax del Sur, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Concepcion

texts.en: Concepcion, 39, is married to a welder and blessed with two children. She has owned and managed a transportation business in their village for almost 12 years and earns a net income of PHP 200 daily. Her net income is usually spent on purchasing additional fish and pork meat to sell in their village, so that she can generate additional income. Due to insufficient funds in her business, she would like to avail a loan amounting to PHP 8,000 to pay for the repairs and maintenance of her motorcycle. She's hoping that her business will continue to improve and become more profitable.

loans.use: To pay for the repairs and maintenance of her motorcycle.

loans.name: Mariel

texts.en: Due to a lack of job opportunities, Mariel has been engaged in the hog-raising business to help his parents in generating income. He is 27 years old and single. He aims to earn and save more income to support the schooling of his younger brother and save for his future. He plans to strengthen his hog-raising business but he has limited capital. For this reason, he would like to avail a loan of PHP 25,000.00 to buy hog feeds and vitamins for his hogs. Through hard work and strong determination, Mariel believes that someday, he will further improve his business.

loans.use: to buy hog feeds and vitamins for his hogs

location.town: Brgy. Balzain, Dupax del Sur, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Delphine

texts.en: Delphine is 32 years old. She is married with 5 children aged between 18 and 5 years; four of them go to school. She is a tailor and has been running a business for the past 18 years. With the loan, she would like to buy more clothes for sale. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for her children and for the welfare of her family.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for sale.

loans.name: Dima

texts.en: Dima is a 24-year-old single lady living with her family that consists of three family members. She is a Masters' student, majoring in Finance, and she is in her second year. Dima is an ambitious lady who is seeking to get her PhD in the future. She is currently facing financial problems that are preventing her from being able to pay for her upcoming semester fees. Because of that, she has applied for this loan.

loans.use: to pay for her upcoming semester fees.

loans.name: Nemer

texts.en: Nemer is a 22-year-old single young man living with his family that consists of four family members. He is a university student, majoring in Math, and he is in his fourth year. Nemer also works in the evenings, doing carpentry. He is seeking to work in his field of study after getting his Bachelors degree, in order to earn a better income and improve himself. Now Nemer is applying for a loan to pay for his upcoming semester fees because he doesn't have enough money to do so.

loans.use: to pay for his upcoming semester fees.

loans.name: Majed

texts.en:
Majed is a 28-year-old married man, living with his family in a rented house in Haja city, Yemen. He studied till the Elementary level of education.

Because of the miserable conditions of his family, Majed couldn't complete his study. In order to provide his family with a better life, Majed decided to work in an iron workshop. Over time, Majed accumulated a good amount of money and started his own business through opening his own iron workshop.

He has started this business more than seven years ago. He earns good profits from his business. The workshop is the sole income source for his family, and the profits are not enough to cover all the expenses of the family. The power is cut most days and nights. This affects Majed's business negatively, because he doesn't have a power generator inside his workshop to enable him to continue in his business when the power cut. Majed doesn't have enough money to buy one. For this reason, he applied for a Youth loan of 200,000 YER from AMB in order to purchase a power generator for his iron workshop.

Majed looks forward to purchasing a piece of land and building his own house on it. He hopes to open another iron workshop to help him in improve the living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to purchase a power generator for his iron workshop.

loans.name: Doreen

texts.en: Doreen is  twenty-eight years old and married with three children, living in Kasese, Uganda. For four years, Doreen has been selling local chickens to support her family. Doreen has a dream of buying land and building her own house. Doreen is a hard-working woman faced with the challenges of competition and long distances to find chickens to buy. Doreen wants money to buy chickens to sell.

loans.use: to buy chickens to sell.

loans.name: Julpa

texts.en:
Julpa is a married woman with four children, She works hard to support her family. 

She has a business to sell decorations and requests 40,000 PHP through ASKI to purchase pots, flowers, and ornamental plants to sell to her customers. She successfully repaid her previous loan and  requests a new loan to further build her business. She has sustained her business activities through  6 previous loans from ASKI. 

She hopes that her hard work will help her to attain her dream which is to save enough money.

loans.use: to purchase  pots, flowers, and ornamental plants to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Edwin

texts.en:
Edwin a married man with three children. He has grows corn and been a produce dealer since 2004. Edwin has applied for a loan of 45,000 PHP to buy corn seed and fertilizer. 

His business challenges include weather changes and fluctuating prices. He is optimistic and believes that thes challenges will finally be put behind him if he gets the financial assistance from ASKI.

His plans for the future is to educate his children and acquire more land for agriculture.

loans.use: to buy corn seed and fertilizer.

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.en: Mercedes is 42 years old, married and has three children. Her eldest child graduated from college already, while the rest are still studying. She gets her income through farming. Mercedes and her husband are farmers planting and harvesting rice to sell. She wants to continue ensuring good nutrition for her crops, and she needs additional capital of PHP 15,000 to buy fertilizers, insecticides and pesticides used in farming. This will help the crops grow abundantly and attain a better harvest someday. She will save additional revenue for education purposes for the rest of her children.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, insecticides and pesticides used in farming

loans.name: Mycel

texts.en: Mycel is 38 years old and blessed with one child. She is engaged in the hog-raising business to generate income. She aims to improve her business and increase her income to sustain their daily necessities and save some for future emergencies. Having insufficient capital, she would like to access financial assistance from KIVA lenders amounting to PHP 21,000.00 to buy hog feeds, vitamins and additional pigs to raise. She is hoping that she will avail the loan request to be able for her to improve the business.

loans.use: to buy hog feeds, vitamins and additional pigs to raise

location.town: Brgy. Munguia,Dupax del Norte, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Wore's Group

texts.fr:
Le banc villageois a été créé le 28 mai 2009.Ce groupe est composé de 5 femmes qui habitent le même quartier et sont toutes des commerçantes. Woré est la représentante du groupe, elle a 29 ans, mariée et sans enfant. Elle fait du commerce de tissus et produits halieutiques réputés de bonne qualité. Elle vend à son domicile et fait aussi du porte à porte.Elle est la seule dans son quartier à faire cette activité. Avec son prêt elle compte acheter du basin riche et du diezner pour vendre à ses clients surtout avec la fête de la tabaski qui arrive.
Ses bénéfices lui permettront de se prendre en charge et sa maman en cas de besoin et d'épargner aussi dans le banc villageois.
texts.en:
The ’banc villageois’ was created on May 28, 2009. This group of five women living in the same district are all merchants. Woré is the group’s representative. She is 29 years old, married, and without any children. She does commerce in fabrics and seafood products with a reputation for good quality. She sells from her home and also door to door. She is the only one in her district in this business. 

With her loan, she intends to purchase some ‘riche’ damask and some “diezner” damask fabrics to sell to her customer, particularly for the upcoming Tabaski holiday. Her profits will enable her to support herself and her mom in case of need, as well as to save money at the ’banc villageois’.

loans.use: to purchase damask fabrics

loans.name: Aira

texts.en: Aira is 21 years old and married with two children. For the past two years she has run her small store where she sells a variety of items. Aira became a member of ASKI in 2013 to gain access to capital for her business. She is applying for a 8,000 PHP loan to buy a new display fridge, a chest freezer, snacks, frozen goods, canned food and sacks of onions and potatoes. Aira hopes to use her profits to pay for the renovation of her house and help pay for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy a new display fridge, a chest freezer, snacks, frozen goods, canned food and sacks of onions and potatoes

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia is a business woman who is pleased  with her business.  She requests $ 800.00 USD to improve her business. She will use the loan to buy  additional supplies to keep in her kiosk such as shampoo, candy, sugar, coffee, rice,  detergent, and soft drinks . 

Lucia began her business in 2013 with her own working capital of $1.500.00. She is happy with the loan offered from Tuba Rai Metin because she will have more working capital to buy more goods. The loan from Tuba Rai Metin  will increase her income in the future.

loans.use: to buy shampoo, candy,  sugar,  coffee, rice,  detergent, and soft drinks.

loans.name: Isabella

texts.en:
Hello there! The above picture presents to you Isabella, who lives in Eldoret area of Kenya, also known as the Home of Champions because of producing so many elite runners who have broken so many world records. Eldoret is the mother of six children and has been doing farming for the past two years. Through dairy farming and poultry keeping, she has been able to produce milk and eggs. 

Isabella is a very dedicated farmer who has a never-say-die attitude and enjoys every bit of farming because, through farming, she is able to take care of her family’s needs and wants. Although she experiences challenges in farming, her attitude keeps her going. Enjoying what she does, she has even nicknamed her cow “lektina”. 

Isabella is seeking a 21,700 KES loan to be able to buy a dairy cow and increase the number from the three that she currently has. With the loan, she would be able to increase her milk productivity and also increase her income levels, hence reducing the poverty level that is currently facing her. Isabella’s biggest dream is to get out of this poverty level, and this loan will be a stepping stone toward improving the living standards of her family and increasing her income level.

loans.use: to buy an additional dairy cow.

loans.name: Jean Damascene

texts.en:
Jean Damascene, 50 years old, is a married father of seven children aged between 32 and 19 years, two of whom go to school. He has been selling clothes for 30 years. 

With this loan, Jean Damascene would like to buy more clothes for resale. The profits from the business will be used to renovate and for the welfare for his family.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to sell

loans.name: Ismael

texts.es: Ismael de 35 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a su compañera de vida y sus 2 hijos de 16 y 7 años de edad. Él es un hombre emprendedor que se esfuerza cada día por sacar adelante a su familia, y es por ello que desde hace 9 años se gana la vida como pescador. Ismael desea cambiar el techo de su vivienda y construir un pequeño corredor lateral, ya que actualmente el techo se encuentra deteriorado y la parte que se observa en la fotografía la utiliza para la cocina, donde hará el corredor lateral, por lo que solicita  un crédito a FUSAI para comprar: lámina galvanizada, ladrillo, cemento, arena y hierro para cambiar el techo de su vivienda y construir un corredor lateral.
texts.en: Ismael is 35 years old and lives in his own home together with his life partner and their two children ages 16 and 7. He is an entrepreneurial man who works hard every day to raise his family. He has made a living as a fisherman for the past nine years. Ismael wants to change the roof of his home and build a small side corridor since currently the roof is deteriorated. The part that you can see in the photo is used as the kitchen but will become the side corridor. He is requesting a loan from FUSAI to buy: galvanized sheet metal, brick, cement, sand and iron to change the roof of his house and build a side corridor.

loans.use: Purchase galvanized sheet metal, brick, cement, sand and iron to change the roof of his house and build a side corridor.

loans.name: Khardiata's Group

texts.fr: Le banc villageois a été créé depuis le 29 mai 2009. Ce groupe est composé de 4 femmes habitant le même quartier et qui font toutes du commerce. Khardiata est la représentante du groupe, elle est âgée de 51 ans, mariée avec 4 enfants dont 3 filles. Elle fait du commerce de tissu ,de parfum et d’essence aromatique dans son domicile. Elle a une expérience de 10 ans ce qui fait sa célébrité dans son quartier. Avec son prêt elle compte acheter du basin, des chaussures et des rideaux pour les revendre auprès de la clientèle. Ses bénéfices lui permettent de payer la scolarité de ses enfants et de participer à la prise en charge de la famille.
texts.en:
The ’banc villageois’ was created on May 29, 2009. This group is composed of four women living in the same district. They all work in commerce. Khardiata is the group’s representative. She is 51 years old and married, and she has four children, including three girls. Khardiata does commerce in fabrics, perfumes, and aromatics at her home. She has over ten years of experience, which has brought her fame in her district.  

With her loan, she intends to purchase some damask fabrics, shoes, and curtains to resell to her customers. Her profits will enable her to pay for her children’s schooling and to help support the family.

loans.use: to purchase 10 bales of damask fabrics, 40 pairs of shoes, and 10 rolls of curtains

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en: Julieta, 37, is married and blessed with four children. She has owned and managed a vegetable production business in their village for almost six years and earns a net income of PHP 300 when she sells vegetables in their village. Due to insufficient funds in her business, she would like to avail a loan amounting to PHP 5,000 to purchase seedlings and fertilizers for her vegetable production. She's hoping that her business will continue to grow and become more productive.

loans.use: To purchase seeedlings and fertilizers for her vegetable production.

loans.name: Zainab

texts.en:
Zainab is a recurring client of Yehu Microfinance and is requesting another loan. She says thanks for the previous loan as she was able to expand her business and increase her monthly profits.

With the loan that she is requesting, she wants to purchase stock of firewood for sale in the area, as she is the main supplier of firewood. She dreams of establishing another business in the future and she appreciates the support from Kiva and Yehu at large.

loans.use: to purchase firewood stock for sale in the area

loans.name: Melany

texts.en: Melany is 34 years old and married. She engages in buying and reselling fruits and vegetables to help her husband to gain income. Due to financial hardship, she would like to make her business profitable to earn sufficient income and meet their daily necessities. She plans to acquire various fruits and vegetables to resell but she doesn't have enough capital. For this reason, she would like to avail a loan of PHP 15,000.00 to buy more onions, tomatoes, beans, bananas, cabbages, squash and eggplant to resell. Being patient and industrious, she is hoping that she will become financially stable in the future.

loans.use: to buy more onions, tomatoes, beans, bananas, cabbages, squash and eggplant to resell

location.town: Brgy. Ganao, Dupax del Sur, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Wadhah

texts.en:
Wadhah is a 28-year-old married man and the father of four children. His oldest child is 12 years old and the youngest one is two years old. Wadhah lives with his family in a rented house in the capital city of Sana'a, Yemen. He studied until the Secondary school level. Unfortunately, he couldn't complete his studies. 

Over time, Wadhah accumulated a good amount of money and purchased a bus to work as a driver, transporting people from one station to another, in order to earn enough money to look after his family. He has been doing this business for more than three years. Unfortunately, the bus became very old and needs weekly repairs and maintenance. The repair and maintenance costs him a lot of money because the bus lacks new spare parts. Unfortunately, he doesn't have enough money. For this reason, Wadhah applied for a loan of 150,000 YER from AMB in order to buy new spare parts for his bus in order to make it work in good condition. These new spare parts will help him to save a lot of money.

Wadhah's vision is to purchase another bus to rent it with a monthly salary. He believes that the bus will help him very much in improving the living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to buy new spare parts for his bus in order to make it work in good condition.

loans.name: Carlos Alfredo

texts.es: Carlos de 36 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a su esposa y sus 2 hijas de 6 y 3 años de edad. Él es un hombre emprendedor que se desempeña como pescador desde hace 15 años, lo que le ha permitido sacar adelante a su familia. Carlos desea encementar el piso de su casa, repellar las paredes y cambiar el techo de la misma por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para comprar: cemento, arena, grava, lámina galvanizada y pagar mano de obra para encementar el piso, repellar las paredes y cambiar el techo de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Carlos, 36 years of age, lives in his own house with his wife and 2 daughters, 6 and 3 years old. He is an enterprising man who has worked as a fisherman for 15 years, which has allowed him to move his family forward.

Carlos would like to cement the floor of his house, plaster the walls, and replace the roof, which is why he is applying to FUSAI for a loan to buy: cement, sand, gravel, and iron sheets, and to pay for labor to cement the floor, plaster the walls, and replace the roof of his house.

loans.use: to buy:  cement, sand, gravel, and iron sheets, and to pay for labor to cement the floor, plaster the walls, and replace the roof of his house.

loans.name: Jackline

texts.en: Jackline is twenty-seven-years old and married with one child, living in Kasese, Uganda. Jackline has been in the tailoring business for three years. She started the business to generate income for her family. Jackline has a dream of educating her family and expanding the business, in spite of limited capital.  Jackline needs a loan to buy clothes for mending and later selling.

loans.use: to buy clothes for mending and later selling

loans.name: Maurice

texts.en: Maurice is a male Kiva borrower and has 4 children. He describes himself as ambitious. He operates a retail business where he sells metallic boxes, and has been involved in this business for 2 years. His business is located in a competitive location and his primary customers are the general public. He describes his biggest business challenge as financial constraints. He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more stock of metallic boxes. His business goal is to have a big business within 5 years. He hopes that in the future, he will have better living standards and more profits. This is his first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more stock of metallic boxes

loans.name: Baraa'

texts.en: Baraa' is a 24-year-old single lady who lives with her family, which consists of six family members, in Mafraq, Jordan. She is a university student, majoring in Geology, and she is in her third year. Baraa' is planning to look for a job in her field of study after graduation. She currently doesn't have enough money to pay for her upcoming semester fees. For that reason, she has applied for this loan.

loans.use: to pay for her upcoming semester fees.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en: Ahmad is a 19-year-old ambitious young man living with his family, which has five members. Ahmad is a university student, majoring in Civil Engineering, and he is in his first year. Ahmad is seeking to work in his field of study after graduating. He is requesting a loan to pay for his upcoming semester fees as he doesn't have enough money to do so.

loans.use: to pay for his upcoming semester fees.

loans.name: Mutasem

texts.en: Mutasem is a 22-year-old university student, majoring in Accounting and Business Law, and he is in his first year. He also works in the evenings as a driver to earn money that will help him pay for his semester fees. He is currently facing financial problems that are keeping him from making his upcoming semester fees payment. For that reason, he is asking for your help by applying for this loan.

loans.use: to pay for his upcoming semester fees.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for her upcoming semester fees.

loans.name: William

texts.en: William is a married man. He has five children. He describes himself to be hardworking. He operates a retail business where he sells metal boxes. He has been involved in this business for three years. His business is located in a busy area. He describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of funds. He will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy more stock of metal boxes. His business goal is to be a wholesaler within five years. He will use the anticipated profits to buy more inventory.

loans.use: buy more stock of metal boxes for resale.

loans.name: Katherine Abigail

texts.es: Katherine de 21 años de edad es madre soltera y habita en vivienda propia junto a su hijo de 2 años de edad. Ella es una mujer emprendedora que desde hace 5 años ha logrado mantener una pequeña tienda de productos de primera necesidad, gracias a ello ha logrado mantener la economía de su hogar. Katherine desea repellar las paredes de su vivienda por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para comprar: cemento y arena para repellar las paredes de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Katherine, 21 years of age, is a single mother and lives in her own house with her 2-year old son. She is an enterprising woman who, for 5 years, has succeeded in having a small convenience store. Thanks to this, she has been able to support her household.

Katherine would like to plaster the walls of her house, which is why she is applying to FUSAI for a loan to buy: cement and sand to plaster the walls of her house.

loans.use: to buy:  cement and sand to plaster the walls of her house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy bricks, sand, cement and pay for the labor to lay brick in the floor of her home.

loans.name: Benson

texts.en: Benson is a married man. He has three children. He describes himself to be committed. He operates a transportation business, where he transports customers using his bicycle. He has been involved in this business for four years. His business is located in a busy area and his primary customers are of all types. He will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy more bicycles. This is his first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more bicycles.

loans.name: Vincent

texts.en: Vincent is 26 years old. He is married with 2 children aged between 4 months and 2 years, who do not yet go to school. He sells at his shop and has been running a business for the past 10 years. With the loan, he would like to buy more items such as sugar, rice, and cooking oil for sale. The profits from the business will be used to buy food consumptions and renovate his house.

loans.use: to buy more items such as rice, cooking oil, and sugar  for sale.

loans.name: Leah

texts.en:
Wonderful Lenders! Leah is a very honest, hardworking and dedicated farmer who is 37 years of age and hails from the Eldoret area of Kenya, an area known to have the best weather patterns that favor crops and animal farming. Leah has so much experience in farming, and having done farming for the past nine years, she is considered one of the best farmers in her village. 

Leah’s primary source of income is selling milk and eggs and crop farming. Leah is a very dedicated dairy farmer, and she has nicknamed her cow “Lelmet” (name of a person). Leah has space on her farm that is unused, and she wants to use the space to keep more dairy cows. That is why she is kindly seeking a loan to buy a dairy cow. With the loan, Leah is going to improve her living conditions and also improve the conditions of her four children by providing them with a solid education, because education is the “key to success”. 

Eldoret area has a ready market for milk and a large population. Hence, Leah will not have a problem selling the milk and increasing her income level. Leah is very disciplined with finances and she is sure that, through accumulated profits, she will open a large dairy store and be able to pay the loan on time.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes is 32 years old and married with one child, living in Kasese, Uganda. Agnes sells bottled drinking water to earn a living. She has been in that business for six years and it has been her source of income. She has managed to pay school fees for her child from that business. She dreams of expanding her business, though she is faced with a challenge of limited capital. Agnes is a hard-working woman who needs a loan to finish paying for her land.

loans.use: to finish paying for her land

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy handicrafts and go to resell them, since his clients always demand 50% of the product value, and the rest after he sells them.

loans.name: Julius

texts.en: Julius is a married man with three children. He describes himself as God fearing. He operates a tailoring business in which he makes clothes. He has been involved in this business for 18 years. His primary customers are individuals. He will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy more stock of tailoring materials. This is his first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more stock of tailoring materials

loans.name: Eliza

texts.en: Due to financial hardship, Eliza aims to improve her business to increase her income and support the education of her two children. She engages in buying and reselling fruits and vegetables within the local community to generate income. She wants to acquire more stock of fruits and vegetables to sell but she has inadequate capital. For this reason, she would like to take out a loan of 15,000 PHP to buy more tomatoes, squash, beans, eggplants, onions and leafy vegetables to resell. She believes that the loan will enable her to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy more tomatoes, squash, beans, eggplants, onions and leafy vegetables to resell

location.town: Brgy. Ganao, Dupax del Sur, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Elvina

texts.en:
Elvina, 48 years old, is married and blessed with three children. She has been engaged in selling bags for six years. Her passion is to make different styles of bags. To meet the demands of her customers she is asking for a new loan of 10,000 PHP to buy additional materials such as paste and plastic for her business, so that she can make more bags. 

Elvina hopes that someday her products will be well known not only in the community but also in the town.

loans.use: to buy additional materials such as paste and plastic for her business

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is a married man, and a farmer who deals in raising cattle. He started farming in 1993, with six cows.  He has many cattle of the local breed. He also grows plantains and maize, but on a medium scale. He sells his agricultural products to the local community, especially to the fishermen from a nearby fishing site and cattle traders.

The reason why he started farming was for personal development, and for that reason he has managed to acquire several plots of land from the neighboring trading center. He now needs a loan to buy dairy cows. He hopes to expand his business to the level of supplying the whole town with milk, as well as take good care of his family.

loans.use: to buy cattle.

loans.name: Bekim

texts.en: Bekim is 35 years old and has five children, living all together in an Ashkali community in Kosovo. In order to earn a living and support his family, Bekim collects iron to resell at a profit. He has to work all day long in order to collect enough to make money, and he works very hard. He uses a cultivator in order to make his collections, and his in need of a repair. Bekim would like to take a loan in order to repair his machine in order to work more effectively, and also to make some general repairs in his house. This loan will allow him to improve the living conditions for him and his family and he is very thankful for this. He hopes that in the future, he will be able to have his own business. He thanks all of the lenders for their support.

loans.use: to repair his iron cultivating machine in order to work more effectively, and also to make some general repairs in his house.

loans.name: Elmije

texts.en: Elmije, age 33, is the mother of five children between the ages of two and 13 years old. In order to earn a living, she has been operating a handicraft business from her home while her husband works as a guard. Elmije makes traditional clothing for weddings and is very well known in her area for her work. She is usually busiest in the summers when there are many weddings and celebrations. She is very happy with her business and has been able to renovate her home and purchase new furniture from the income. Now, she is in need of a loan to purchase material for her work. This loan will help her to continue to make money and satisfy her customers. She wants to thank all of the lenders for their support.

loans.use: to purchase material for her sewing business.

loans.name: Guadalupe

texts.es: Guadalupe de 44 años de edad es madre soltera y habita en vivienda propia junto a su hijo de 23 años de edad. Ella es una mujer emprendedora que ha logrado salir adelante junto a su hijo ahora mayor de edad gracias a su visión para los negocios, ya que ha logrado mantener su pequeña tienda de productos de primera necesidad desde hace 5 años, la cual está ubicada en su vivienda. Guadalupe desea afinar las paredes de su vivienda, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para comprar: cemento y arena para afinar las paredes de su vivienda.
texts.en: Guadalupe is a 44-year-old single mother who lives in her own home with her 23-year-old son. She is an entrepreneurial woman who has managed to get ahead, along with her son who is now an adult, thanks to her vision for business. She has managed to sustain her small food staple store for the past five years. The store is located in her home. Guadalupe wants to refine the walls of her home. She's requesting a loan from FUSAI to buy cement and sand to refine the walls of her home.

loans.use: Buy cement and sand to refine the walls of her home.

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie, 42, is a resident of Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Winsor, a driver, and has one child. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. She works hard to provide income to meet their daily personal and household needs and for her child’s education.

Rosalie operates a computer rental shop. In the Philippines, very few people have their own computers. People go to an Internet café for their business or school requirements and for business documents. She rents out computers by the hour and offers printing and typing services. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 500 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her improve her business, she is requesting an 8,000 PHP loan to purchase a scanner and a printer. Her earnings are a big help for meeting her family’s basic needs. Rosalie wants to give her child a good education and hopefully expand her shop. 

She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To purchase a scanner and a printer.

loans.name: Aimable

texts.en: Aimable is 55 years old. He is married, with seven children between the ages of 32 and 18 years. He has been running a shop for the past 30 years. With the loan, he would like to buy more items such as sugar, cooking oil and salt for sale. The profits from the business will be used to reinvest and to renovate his house.

loans.use: To buy more items such as cooking oil, sugar and salt to sell.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Hello Kiva lenders! Meet Esther, 52, a hardworking and honest farmer, who is based in Eldoret area in Kenya. She is a proud mother of three lovely children. For the past ten years, she has been making a small living through practicing mixed farming. Her primary source of income has been selling milk and eggs to the nearby market. She also engages in a personal business, or “side hustle” as she likes to call it, to earn additional income. 

Esther passionately loves dairy farming, but the biggest challenge she has been facing is accessing funds to increase her business. Through Juhudi Kilimo, an organization that supports enterprising farmers, she acquired her first loan, which she used to buy an additional cow. She paid the loan back fully. She also benefited from training and the impact of the first loan cannot be underestimated. 

Esther is seeking another loan from Juhudi Kilimo via Kiva lenders to buy a quality breed of dairy cow. The cow she plans to buy is not just an ordinary cow, but a quality breed of cow that will be producing between 15-20 liters of milk a day. A liter of milk costs 50 KES; this means she will be making 11 USD a day. From this loan, the life of Esther will permanently change and she will be able to secure the future of her school going children. She will also assure her aging parents of a secure future. Esther waits for your kindness.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Andrew

texts.en:
Andrew is a 34-year-old married man with five children, four of whom are attending school. The family lives in Kasese, Uganda. 

Andrew operates a retail shop and works six hours a day and seven days a week. He has been in this business for six years. He practices farming for additional income. Andrew is a hardworking person whose major challenges are inadequate capital and competition. He intends to use the money to buy salt, sugar, soap and other merchandise for sale at his store.

loans.use: to buy salt, sugar, soap and other merchandise for sale at his store.

loans.name: Kirizesitom

texts.en:
Kirizesitom is a business man who processes bark cloth, which is a kind of cloth used for traditional ceremonies. He supplements his family income with produce trading and agriculture, which he does seasonally.

He has processed bark cloth since 2002. He is based in it because of experience he had and because less capital was required in starting up. He is requesting the loan to buy more stock of bark cloth for sell. He sells his goods to crafts makers in the city.

Kirizesitom is hard-working and very ambitious. He hopes to expand his business and serve a large clientele. He faces the challenges of limited capital and of unprofessional customers who make orders and then change their minds when the goods are delivered.

loans.use: to buy bark cloth from farmers for processing.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a married man with 2 children, and describes himself to be God fearing.  For 26 years he has operated a quarry selling construction stones.  His primary customers are individuals.  He describes his greatest business challenge to be water coming in to the quarry during the rainy season.  

He will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy a water pump to drain water from the quarry.  His business goal is to build rental houses within 5 years.  He hopes to be successful in the future.  This is his first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy a water pump to drain water from the quarry.

loans.name: Hakim

texts.en:
Hakimu is 56 years old  married with six children living in Kasese, Uganda. Hakimu practices farming, growing crops such as maize, beans and cotton for sale. Hakimu started the business to get a daily source of income to support his family. He is hard working, despite weather changes that affect his products. Hakimu has a dream of buying more land to cultivate.

Hakimu wants money to buy farm supplies, such as fertilizer, and to pay for labor.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies, such as fertilizer, and to pay for labor.

loans.name: Wayne

texts.en:
Wayne has already proven himself as a savvy entrepreneur. Ten years ago, when he left his native Trinidad and Tobago to settle in Florida, he sold what was at the time one of the leading party rental companies in a country known for its festivities. After staying at home to raise his children for many years, Wayne is currently employed in the restaurant business and is ready to make a comeback in a big way. 
   
This time around, Wayne intends to use some of the knowledge and networks he has acquired in the United States by offering the highest-quality restaurant boards in the service industry. High on his menu list is purchasing larger boards that offer greater profit margins. This loan will help him do just that.  

Wayne recently registered his business and will use the loan to expand his merchandise and build his credit. Always looking ahead, when asked what his ultimate goal was, he replied, “to provide for my kids and myself, and also for my future generations.”

Help this single dad make his American dream come true!

loans.use: to purchase larger boards.

loans.name: Marcus

texts.en:
Marcus is an exceptional person who has found hope, and inspires those around him despite tragic circumstances. As a young man, Marcus was a successful musician, working as a bass player and band director in Japan. One unfortunate day, his fate changed in the blink of an eye as a careless driver ran a stop sign and hit his motorcycle, sending him flying up in the air until his body collided with a truck. The accident left Marcus paralyzed and near death. It also left him unemployed.  

Since then, Marcus has returned to the United States and has been piecing his life back together, finding gratitude and happiness in sharing his story and positive energy. His clothing line ‘Unity Wear’ has become the focus of his energies, and the platform by which he gives back. ‘Unity Wear’ is unique because it is a socially conscious clothing line. It strives to bring awareness about issues like human trafficking, and its mission is uniting people around a common cause and creating a movement of solidarity.    

Marcus will use this loan to purchase inventory and update his website. 
 
Marcus understands how much money can make or break a project. For this reason, he is allocating a portion of the profits of ‘Unity Wear’ to charities that contribute to the lives of women and children worldwide.

loans.use: to purchase inventory and update his website.

loans.name: Pablo Enrique

texts.es: Pablo es casado y tiene 3 hijos de 1, 4 y 6 años de edad, vive en la casa que le presta su madre, son 5 años que Pablo y su esposa se dedican a este negocio, pero hace 3 años cuando Fodemi les di el crédito pudieron mejorarlo y readecuar sus galpones, adicionalmente se dedican a la agricultura de algún huerto pequeño,  el esta ocasión  Pablo va a invertir el crédito en la  compra de pollos para ponerlos en un galpón que en la actualidad esta vacio, lo que Pablo aspira es seguir trabajando duro para que sus hijos sigan estudiando y mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en: Pablo is married and has three children who are 1, 4, and 6 years old. He lives in a house that his mother lends him. For the past 5 years, Pablo and his wife have been involved in this business. Three years ago, Fodemi granted them a loan so that they could improve and readjust their sheds. They are also involved in agriculture and have a small garden plot. This time, Pablo is going to invest the loan in the purchase of chickens to put in a shed that is currently empty. Pablo dreams of continuing to work hard so that his sons can stay in school and improve their quality of life.

loans.use: buy chickens.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is married with six children. He lives in a rural area with his family and deals in agriculture, specifically growing bananas. He supplements his income with cattle trade and produce, which he does seasonally.

John works six days a week, and each day, he works for eight hours. He has been in this business for 30 years and he started due to experience since he dropped out of school at a tender age.

He has acquired this loan in order to buy fertilizer for his banana plantation in order to be able to yield high quality bananas in large quantities.

He sells his goods to traders from the cities and hopes to be the leading supplier of bananas in his area, but he faces the problem of unpredictable weather changes. He describes himself as an honest person.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for his banana plantation.

loans.name: Steve

texts.en:
Steve is a self-described sneaker enthusiast. Having worked for over twenty years in the retail industry, Steve knows his sneakers, and according to him, he “eats, lives, and breathes” them. He’s so confident about his passion for sneakers that he recently launched an online sneaker store, Gemini8, which specializes in high-end shoes with flair and the hippest accessories to go with them. Brand names such as Vans, Kith, and Alife, known to shoe connoisseurs, supply Steve with the latest styles in footwear. This has given him enough visibility to be invited to large-scale fashion events.    

While Gemini8 is a young company, Steve is ready to commit and take his shoe business to the next level. With an upcoming fashion trade show that will bring together many of his favorite shoe brands, Steve needs this loan to purchase inventory and improve his website.  

Help this native New Yorker fulfill his dream of working in what he loves best. And if you love sneakers as much as Steve does, check out his website at www.gemini8.biz.

loans.use: to purchase inventory and improve his website.

loans.name: Abel Ernesto

texts.es: Abel de 29 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a su esposa y su hija de 2 años de edad. Él es un joven tenaz que se dedica a la pesca en lancha, actividad que realiza desde hace 6 años en las playas cercanas a su cantón. Abel buscando mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia ha decidido construir un servicio sanitario lavable, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para comprar: cemento, arena, ladrillo, taza lavable, grava y pagar mano de obra para construir un servicio sanitario lavable.
texts.en:
Abel is 29 years old and lives in his own home along with his wife and his 2-year-old daughter. He is a tenacious young man who makes his living by fishing, which he has done for the past six years on the beaches close to his neighborhood.

Abel is looking to improve the living conditions of his family and he has decided to construct a bathroom. For this, he is requesting a loan from FUSAI in order to buy cement, sand, bricks, a toilet, gravel and also to hire labor to construct a new sanitary bathroom.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, bricks, a toilet, and gravel and to pay for labor to construct a sanitary bathroom.

loans.name: Jose Candelario

texts.es: Jose de 64 años de edad vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, el se dedica desde hace varios años a la crianza de ganado de repasto, comercializa sus productos en los diferentes mercados que se encuentran cerca de su lugar de residencia, posee mucha clientela por los buenos precios, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, José esta solicitando un crédito para poder comprar ganado de repasto y así poder seguir con la crianza que le genera buenas ganancias y poderle dar a su familia lo que necesitan sin limitaciones algunas.
texts.en: Jose is 64 years old and lives in his own house with his family. For the past several years, he has made a living by raising cattle and selling his products in the different markets that are close to where he lives. He has many clients because of his good prices. From what he earns he is able to afford some of his household expenses. José is requesting a loan so he can buy cattle and continue raising them. This generates good profits and allows him to give his family what they need without some limitations.

loans.use: buy pasture cattle

loans.name: Maria Del Transito

texts.es: Maria de 48 años de edad vive en casa propia ella se dedica desde hace varios años a la venta de minutas vende de forma ambulante por las diferentes colonias que se encuentra cerca de su lugar de residencia, tiene mucha clientela por ser un producto muy vendible, Maria vive en casa propia con su esposo, tiene  dos hijos no viven con ella pero le ayudan económicamente, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de vasos, hielo, frutas, leche, jarabes de sabores, etc. todo por mayor para poder continuar con su trabajo ya que es su única fuente de ingresos y así tener junto con su esposo una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Maria is 48 years old and lives in her own home.  For many years, she has worked selling fruit flavored shaved ice throughout the different neighborhoods near her home.  She has many customers because her product is very marketable.  Maria lives in a house that she owns with her husband.  They have two children who do not live with her but help her financially.  

She is seeking a loan to purchase cups, ice, fruit, milk, flavored syrups, and more, in bulk so that she can continue with her work since it is her only source of income.  Therefore, her and her husband will be able to have a better quality of work.

loans.use: purchase cups, ice, fruit, milk, flavored syrups, and more in bulk.

loans.name: Carlos Alberto

texts.es: Carlos de 43 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa y sus tres hijos, el se dedica desde hace 8 años a la pesca artesanal, comercializa sus productos en el mercado municipal que se encuentra cerca de su casa ya tiene clientela fija que lo prefieren porque el producto es fresco y a buen precio, Carlos está solicitando un crédito para poder comprar trasmallos y redes para continuar con su pesca ya que esa es su única fuente de trabajo y poderle dar a su familia lo que necesitan sin limitación alguna.
texts.en:
Carlos is 43 years old and lives in a house that he owns with his wife and their three children.  For the past eight years, he has worked as a fisherman.  He sells his catch in the municipal market that is located near his home.  He has a loyal customer base who choose him because his fish is fresh and is at a fair price.

Carlos is seeking a loan to purchase trammel nets so that he can continue with his fishing since it is his only source of work, and so that he can provide his family with all that they need without any limitations.

loans.use: purchase  trammel nets.

loans.name: Jose Roberto

texts.es: Jose de 41 años de edad se dedica desde hace varios años a la albañilería es un buen trabajador, responsable y honesto, de su trabajo logra darle a su familia lo que necesitan, vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, Jose está solicitando un crédito para poder comprar los instrumentos que utiliza en su trabajo ya que los que tiene están bien deteriorados por esa razón solicita dicho crédito y así poder comprar  palas, piochas, sierras, pulidora, una carreta, etc. para continuar con su trabajo ya que esa es su única fuente de ingresos y darle a su familia una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en: Jose is 41 years old and he has worked for a number of years as a bricklayer. He is a good worker, responsible and honest. With his work he can provide his family with what they need. He lives in his own house with his family. Jose is requesting a loan to be able to buy the tools he uses in his work as the ones he now has are in poor condition. So he is requesting this loan to buy shovels, pickaxes, saws, a polisher, a cart, etc to continue with his work. It is his only source of income and it will give his family more economic stability.

loans.use: to buy shovels, pickaxes, saws, a polisher, a cart, etc.

loans.name: Claudia Edith

texts.es: Claudia de 25 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a su compañero de vida. Ella es una mujer admirable por su tenacidad para los negocios, ya que desde hace 4 años ha logrado mantener sus productos en el gusto de sus clientes, además sintiendo la necesidad de tener más ingresos para mantener la economía familiar, decidió  realizar ventas de fruta partida en su cantón. Claudia desea construir un muro de contención en su vivienda, además desea cambiar la puerta de la misma, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para comprar: cemento, arena, grava, bloques de cemento, una puerta y pagar mano de obra necesaria para construir un muro de contención y colocar una puerta en su vivienda.
texts.en:
Claudia is 25 years old and lives in a home that she owns with her spouse.  She is a remarkable woman because of her business acumen.  For the past four years, she has been able to provide her customers with the products that they desire.  Additionally, seeing the need to increase her income to take care of her family, she decided to begin selling cut fruit in her town.  

Claudia wants to build a retaining wall in her home, as well as replace a door in her home.  For this reason, she is seeking a loan from FUSAI to purchase cement, sand, gravel, cement blocks, a door, and pay for labor to build a retaining wall and install a door in her home.

loans.use: purchase cement, sand, gravel, cement blocks, a door and pay for labor to build a retaining wall and install a door in her home.

loans.name: Vasquez De Cantillanos Group

texts.es: Hernán, está casado, tiene 36 años de edad, tiene 3 hijos, vive con su familia, en una aldea del municipio de Taulabe. Se dedica a la producción de café, esta actividad la realiza desde hace 4 años en un terreno agrícola de la comunidad. El café que produce lo vende en la zona. Ha decidido solicitar un préstamo por 4,000 lempiras el cual invertirá en el mantenimiento de su cultivos en la compra de abono y limpieza del mismo para mejorar la producción.  Su meta es salir adelante con sus hijos. El grupo a que pertenece se llama Vásquez de Cantillanos, formado por tres personas que se dedican al cultivo de café y viven en la misma zona. El préstamo grupal es por 13,000 lempiras y compraran abono para dar mantenimiento al cultivo. En la foto esta Ana, Marcelina y Hernán a la derecha.
texts.en:
Hernán is married, is 36 years old, has three children and lives with his family in the city of Taulabe.  He works growing coffee, which he has been doing for the past four years on a community agricultural plot.  He sells the coffee that he grows in the region.  

He has decided to seek a loan for 4,000 Lempiras that he will use to care for his crops by purchasing fertilizer and cleaning the farm in order to improve production.  His goal is to get ahead with his children.  

The group that he belongs to is called "Vásquez de Cantillanos".  It is made up of three people who works growing coffee and live in the same region.  The group loan is for a total of 13,000 Lempiras, and they will use it to purchase fertilizer in order to care for their crops.  Ana, Marcelina and Hernán (on the right) can be seen in the photograph.

loans.use: purchase fertilizer and clean her coffee farm.

loans.name: Vilma Yaneth

texts.es: Vilma de 40 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus dos hijos, ella tiene un negocio de venta de zapatos ubicado en una zona muy transitada cerca de su lugar de residencia, tiene mucha clientela por la calidad de los zapatos y los buenos precios, Vilma está solicitando un crédito para poder comprar más estilos de zapatos por mayor y así poder atender mejor a sus clientes, obtener mejores ingresos y darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida sin limitación alguna.
texts.en: Vilma is 40 years old and lives in her own home with her husband and their two children. She has a business selling shoes located in a busy area near where she lives. She has many clients because of the quality of her shoes and good prices. Vilma is requesting a loan so she can buy more styles of shoes at wholesale and better serve her customers, obtain more income and give her family a better quality of life without limitation.

loans.use: buy more styles of shoes at wholesale.

loans.name: Villa Hermosa Group

texts.en:
Eight women form the Friendship Bridge Trust Bank “Villa Hermosa”, a town that is located in Quiche in the northwestern region of Guatemala.  The majority of the women in this area produce the typical and beautifully hand-woven goods that are sold in local and distant markets.  They also sell chickens, turkeys, fish and tortillas. 

Marta is a young woman of twenty-five years, married with two children aged six and four. She is a member of the Trust Bank “Villa Hermosa” and is beginning her third loan cycle. Marta sells nuts by the pound in Guatemala City and also on the border of El Salvador.  She has found the business profitable but needs more capital to grow.  Marta is asking for a new loan from Friendship Bridge in order to buy a large quantities of nuts: macadamias, cashews and almonds.  Marta wants to provide her children with a good education.  Therefore, she strives to earn extra income through her business so that she does not rely solely upon the income of her husband. 

The women of the “Villa Hermosa” Trust Bank are very grateful for the opportunity to have credit from Friendship Bridge that is financed by people around the world through Kiva.  Thank you Kiva investors for helping to fund “Microcredit Plus,” a Friendship Bridge program that provides education in the areas of health, hygiene and nutrition as well as self-esteem and violence against women. The women learn effective business management practices and gain essential knowledge about business planning, budgeting, accounting, customer service, marketing and pricing.

loans.use: To buy large quantities of nuts: macadamias, cashews, and almonds

loans.name: Carmelina

texts.es: Carmelina de 46 años de edad, tiene un puesto de venta de ropa para damas, caballeros y niños, ubicado en el mercado municipal desde hace varios años, posee mucha clientela por la calidad de la ropa y los buenos precios, Carmelina vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, ella está solicitando un crédito para comprar ropa por mayor como: blusas, camisas, vestidos, pantalones, faldas, ropa para niños, etc. y así seguir con sus ventas que le generan buenas ganancias y tener junto con su familia una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en: Carmelina is 46 years old and has a stall in which she sells clothing for women, men and children that is located in the city market.  She has owned this stall for many years, and she has many customers because of the quality of the clothing and her fair prices.  Carmelina lives in a house that she owns with her family.  She is seeking a loan to purchase clothing in bulk such as: blouses, shirts, dresses, pants, skirts, children's clothing, etc.  This will allow her to continue with her sales, which generate great earnings for her, and to have greater financial stability for her and her family.

loans.use: purchase clothing in bulk such as: blouses, shirts, dresses, pants, skirts, children's clothing, etc.

loans.name: Genesis Group

texts.en:
Quetzaltenango is known for its extensive industrial area. It is the second largest city in Guatemala. The official language is Spanish but they also speak the Maya languages of K’iche and Mam. The women of Quetzaltenango make very elaborate clothes such as the Maya huipiles (blouse) and cortes (skirt), skirts, tablecloths, napkins, bibs, and center pieces. Also, many of the people do trading.  It is in this place that the Friendship Bridge Trust Bank “Genesis” was formed with seven members who sell used clothing, beauty products, and crafts. One of the women has a store selling snacks. It is important to point out that most of the young indigenous women wear their beautiful typical clothing – huipiles and cortes. 

Astrid is a young 20-year-old woman who is single with a seven month old baby. She is secretary of the group. Because jobs were scarce, Astrid began her used clothing business three years ago. Her business was increasing so she needed more capital. That was why she joined the group and asked for her first loan in order to buy more clothing such as children’s (a bestseller), women’s and other items.  

This is the second loan cycle for Astrid.  She is anxious to receive training from Friendship Bridge’s “Microcredit Plus” program where, at the monthly meetings, the group learns about business administration, budgeting, customer service, as well as self-esteem, identity, leadership, preventive health, and reproductive health among other topics. The “Microcredit Plus” program of small loans and education has shown that it is an excellent combination with positive results. Thank you Kiva investors for helping to fund this very important program which empowers the Maya women!

loans.use: to buy more children’s, women’s and other clothing items.

loans.name: Eliberto

texts.es: El señor Eliberto tiene tres hijos dependientes, su principal fuente de ingreso proviene del comercio de frutas, compra la fruta de temporada de forma mensual, para luego comercializarla en los grandes mercados de Santa cruz, actualmente sus ingresos disminuyeron por algunos gastos familiares que se presentaron, por ello solicita un crédito para la compra de fruta para incrementar sus ventas y por consiguiente sus ingresos, de esta forma lograra mejorar su calidad de vida y proporcionarle a su familia mayor bienestar.
texts.en: Eliberto has three dependent children. His primary source of income comes from the fruit trade. He buys seasonal fruit on a monthly basis and later sells it in the major markets of Santa Cruz. Currently his income has declined because of some family expenses that have arisen. He is requesting a loan to purchase fruit to increase his sales and therefore his income, thus improving his quality of life and providing for the well-being of his family.

loans.use: purchase fruit

loans.name: Maria De Los Angeles

texts.es: María de 43 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a su compañero de vida. Ella es una mujer emprendedora que se gana la vida vendiendo diversidad de frutas que ella misma cultiva tales como: zapotes, aguacate, mango, etc. dicha activadad la realiza desde hace 10 años y lo vende por mayoreo en los mercados vecinos. Además su compañero de vida se desempeña como jornalero y siembra; maíz y frijol para el consumo. María desea construir una pared en su vivienda para cerrar un cuarto, además desea repellar las paredes y colocar techo al cuarto que construiría por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para comprar: cemento, arena, ladrillo, lamina madera para construir una pared y colocarle techo.
texts.en:
Maria is 43 years old and lives in her own home alongside her partner. She is an entrepreneurial woman who earns a living selling a variety of fruits that she grows herself like sapotas, avocado, mango etc. She has done this for 10 years and sells them wholesale in local markets. Her partner earns a living as a day labourer and sows corn and beans for consumption. 

Maria wishes to build a wall in her house to enclose a room, and also wants to plaster the walls and add a ceiling to the room she would build. She is asking for a loan from FUSAI to buy cement, sand, bricks and wood laminate to construct a wall and ceiling.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, bricks and wood laminate to construct a wall and ceiling.

loans.name: William

texts.en:
William is a married man. He has 2 children. He describes himself to be honest and trustworthy. 

William operates a quarry where he sells construction stones. He has been involved in this business for 25 years. His primary customers are individuals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be that during rain season water gets into the quarry. He will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy a water pump to drain water from the quarry. 

He hopes that in the future, he will be successful. 
This is his first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: buy a water pump to drain water from the quarry

loans.name: Bright

texts.en:
Bright is a twenty-five-year-old, hard working man who lives in Kamwenge, Uganda. He deals in the buying and selling of produce - mainly coffee, maize and beans. He does this through a business he started with the intention of improving his living standards. He also earns additional income from farming. His main business challenges are a lack of capital and price fluctuations but he hopes that his business will become self-sustainable in the future.

He is requesting a loan to buy more coffee, maize and beans for selling.

loans.use: to buy more coffee, maize and beans to sell

loans.name: Maria Nelis

texts.es: María de 56 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a su esposo y su hija de 32 años de edad y sus nietos de 12 y 7 años de edad. Ella es una mujer emprendedora que desde hace 6 años se gana la vida prestando sus servicios domésticos de forma domiciliar. María adquirió con FUSAI un crédito con el cual construyo la pila que se observa en la fotografía y arreglo parte del techo, pero no logro terminar, por lo que solicita un nuevo crédito a FUSAI para terminar de reparar el techo para lo cual necesita materiales como: polines, pines y duralita para terminar de reparar el techo de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Maria is 56 years old and lives in her own home along with her husband, her daughter who is 32 years old, and her grandchildren who are 12 and 7 years old. She is an entrepreneurial woman who has earned a living for the past 6 years offering domestic services in people’s homes. 

Maria obtained a loan from FUSAI with which she constructed the sink which can be seen in the photo, and fixed part of the roof but did not manage to complete this work.  She is asking for a new loan from FUSAI to finish repairing the roof of her home. For this she will need materials such as roofing supports, fasteners and Duralita.

loans.use: to buy roofing supports, fasteners and Duralita to finish repairing the roof of her house.

loans.name: Erika Maribel

texts.es: Erika es una señorita trabajadora con ganas de salir adelante,  tiene 22 años de edad,  trabaja de vendedora en una farmacia y también se dedica a vender productos de bisutería, cosméticos, perfumes y demás productos  de catalogo, Erika va a invertir el crédito en la compra cosméticos,  productos para ofrecerlos a sus clientas y amigas, lo que Erika aspira es  variar sus productos para mejorar las ventas y así superarse día a día.
texts.en: Erika is a hard working young woman with a desire to get ahead. She is 22 years old. She is employed as a clerk in a drugstore and she also works selling jewelry products, cosmetics, perfumes and more from a catalogue. Erika will invest this loan in the purchase of cosmetics, products that she will offer to her customers and friends. What Erika is seeking is to vary her products to increase her sales and thereby excel each day.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetics

loans.name: Monique

texts.en:
Monique is a hardworking wife and mother. She’s held a steady job for the past 15 years at a church in Brooklyn while raising a child, and knows first-hand the struggles of balancing work and family life.  

However, Monique is now ready to make a move that will improve her family’s quality of living by allowing her to work from home.  Her new company, ‘Advanced Web Security’, is an innovative home-based business that enables parents to actively engage in the safety and well-being of their children.  Monique achieves this by placing video cameras in schools, daycares and other facilities that can be accessed live through personal computers and Smartphones, providing parents with utmost peace of mind.  

‘Advanced Web Security’ is a promising venture that requires some additional investment.  Monique will use this loan to create a much-needed website, invest in a marketing strategy, and purchase monitors.   She also intends to use the loan to help her build her credit, so she can start planning long term for her business and her family.

loans.use: to create a website and purchase monitors

loans.name: Maria Celia

texts.es: Maria de 33 años de edad se dedica a la venta de zapatos y ropa, su negocio lo tiene ubicado en su lugar de residencia, tiene mucha clientela por los buenos precios, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos que se le presentan en su hogar, Maria vive en casa propia con familia, ella está solicitando un crédito para comprar más productos por mayor y seguir con sus ventas que le ayudan a solventar los gastos que se le presentan y poderle dar a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Maria is 33 years old. She works selling shoes and clothing. Her business is located at her home. She has a lot of customers because of her good prices. She manages to cover some of the expenses that arise in her home with what she obtains from her sales . Maria lives in her own home with her family. She is seeking a loan to purchase more wholesale products, and to continue her sales that help her cover the expenses that come up and that can allow her to give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase more wholesale shoes and clothing.

loans.name: Blanca Liseth

texts.es: Blanca de 38 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a su compañero de vida y sus 2 hijos de 16 y 8 años de edad. Ella es una mujer emprendedora que desde hace 2 años se dedica a la elaboración de prendas de vestir, lo que le ha permitido tener muy buenos ingresos. Blanca desea construir un muro de contención en su vivienda, ya que hay un muro cercano el cual teme pueda caer en cualquier momento y dañar su vivienda. Por lo anterior Blanca solicita un crédito a FUSAI para comprar: ladrillo, cemento, arena, grava y hierro para construir un muro de contención en su vivienda.
texts.en: Blanca is 38 years old. She lives in her own house with her life's companion and their two children, aged 16 and 8.  She is an enterprising woman who for two years has worked making clothing. This has allowed her to have good income.  Blanca wants to build a retaining wall for her house, because there is a wall close by that she is afraid will fall at any time and damage her home.  Because of this, Blanca is asking for a loan from FUSAI to buy bricks, cement, sand, gravel and iron to build the retaining wall.

loans.use: to buy bricks, cement, sand, gravel and iron to build a retaining wall for her house.

loans.name: Ruth Marisel

texts.es: Ruth de 36 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a su esposo y su hijo de 15 años de edad. Ella es una mujer emprendedora que se dedica a dar clases de alfabetización a personas mayores, con lo que también contribuye al desarrollo de su municipio. Ruth desea construir un cuarto en su vivienda y reparar el techo del mismo por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cemento, arena, grava, ladrillo, hierro y lamina para construir un cuarto y reparar el techo de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Ruth is 36 years old and lives in her own home along with her husband and her son who is 15 years old. She is an entrepreneurial woman who teaches literacy to older people, and in this way contributes to the development of her local area.

Ruth wishes to build a room in her house and repair the roof. She is therefore asking for a loan from FUSAI to invest in cement, sand, gravel, bricks, iron and laminate.

loans.use: to invest in cement, sand, gravel, bricks, iron and laminate to build a room in her house and repair the roof.

loans.name: Arleah

texts.en:
Arleah knows first-hand how difficult it is to launch and maintain a business. 
  
Drawing from her experience as a business owner and her administrative skills, Leah founded Watt's Management Enterprise (WME) to help businesses maximize their operations.  At WME, Leah hopes to take the weight off small and medium-sized business owners by taking care of their payroll, scheduling and other administrative loose ends.  Business is Leah’s passion and with WME, she’s committed to making things easier for fellow entrepreneurs.    

WME is a new home-based business endeavor and needs early stage capital to get it off the ground.  The loan Leah requires will go a long way to help her acquire certification, purchase office supplies, implement a marketing strategy, and most importantly, it will allow her to build her credit for future investments. 

Help make Leah and Watt's Management Enterprise another Kiva success story.

loans.use: to acquire certification, purchase office supplies and implement a marketing strategy

loans.name: Fatim's Group

texts.fr: le banc villageois a été créé le 26 décembre 2014. le groupe est composé de 4 femmes qui habitent le même quartier et qui font toutes le commerce.Fatim est la représentante du groupe,elle est âgée de 70 ans ,veuve et mère de 2 enfants( garçon et fille). Elle fait du commerce de produits halieutiques au quais de pèche de la ville. Avec son prêt elle compte acheter des caisses de poisson frais; des sacs de sel, de l'herbe sèche.
