Elle a une expérience de 45 ans dans ce domaine ,ce qui fait sa force. Ses bénéfices lui permettent de gérer les dépenses de la famille liés à la santé à l'éducation, l'alimentation et autres. Elle construit aussi sa maison.
texts.en: The village bank was created on the 26th of December 2014. The group is made up of four women who live in the same district and who all work in trade. Fatim is the leader of the group, she is 70 years old, a widow, and has two children (a boy and a girl). She sells fishing products in the fishing harbour of the town. With her loan she plans to buy crates of fresh fish; sacks of salt, and dry grass. She has 45 years experience in the business and this is her strength. Her profits enable her to manage the family expenses for education, food and others. She is also in the process of building her home.

loans.use: to buy 50 crates of fresh fish for 125000f; 15 sacks of salt for 20500f, dry grass for 125000f.

loans.name: Angilyn

texts.en:
Angilyn is 48 years old and married. She was gifted with only one child and they live happily in a rural community. 

She owns and manages a retail store within her community to generate income. She aimed to make her business more profitable to sustain their necessities and save for future emergencies. She aimed to acquire more stock of groceries to resell but she has inadequate capital. For this reason, she would like to avail herself of a PHP 50,000 loan to buy more stock of rice, soft drinks, canned goods, snack foods, assorted biscuits, candies, laundry soaps, beverages, seasonings, and more items to resell. 

She is hoping that she will further improve the business through this financial assistance.

loans.use: to buy more stock of rice, soft drinks, canned goods, snack foods, assorted biscuits, candies, laundry soaps, beverages, seasonings, and more items to resell

location.town: Brgy. Ganao, Dupax del Sur, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Roxana Cristina

texts.es: Roxana de 40 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a su esposo y sus 3 hijos de 16, 11 y 8 años de edad. Ella es una mujer trabajadora que presta sus servicios domésticos desde hace 6 años, dicha actividad la realiza en su domicilio. Roxana desea construir una pila en su vivienda ya que actualmente no tiene donde recoger agua, además desea comprar balcones a la ventana de su vivienda por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para comprar: cemento, arena, ladrillo, hierro, ventanas y balcones para construir una pila y colocar ventanas y balcones en su vivienda.
texts.en:
Roxana is 40 years old and lives in her own home along with her husband and their three children who are 16, 11 and 8 years old. She is a hardworking woman who has worked offering domestic services from her home for the past 6 years. 

Roxana wishes to build a sink in her house, as she currently has nowhere to collect water. In addition she wishes to buy balconies for the windows of her home. She is asking for a loan from FUSAI to buy cement, sand, brick, iron, windows and balconies in order to construct a sink and add windows and balconies to her house.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, brick, iron, windows and balconies in order to construct a sink and add windows and balconies to her house.

loans.name: Brandon

texts.en:
Brandon is one of two partners behind ‘GET I.T.  GOT I.T.’, a full service IT company based out of Miami, FL., specializing in security systems and networks. Brandon and his team of technicians operates online and rents out space in the city for occasional meetings with clients. 
 
When asked what his greatest success has been, Brandon replied, “staying in business for as long as we have.”  Brandon and his partner are proud of their company and confident in the quality of services that they offer.  What they’re missing is the capital to expand and reach out to potential clients.  He will invest this loan in a much-needed marketing strategy.

Help Brandon and his team expand their business and reputation by contributing to his loan.

loans.use: to implement a marketing strategy

loans.name: Kelly

texts.en:
Stripping, waxing, buffing floors and carpet cleaning are all services that Kelly’s new company offers. However, Kelly is no stranger to business.  Before launching her flooring company, Kelly was a party planner and a tax preparation specialist.  And while she enjoyed providing these services to her clients, Kelly wants to carve a more stable, year-round source of employment for herself.

Kelly needs this loan to invest in a website, as well as purchase vacuums, floor buffers, a carpet cleaner, and other cleaning products and equipment

Kelly’s business currently employs two workers, including a recent high school graduate.   She also intends to use the money to put her staff through specialized training, and is currently working on securing contracts with drug rehabilitation centers that will allow her to employ the people they service.  

Help Kelly make her flooring a reality!

loans.use: to pay for a website and purchase vacuums, floor buffers and a carpet cleaner

loans.name: Kristal

texts.en:
Some of us like to shop but for Kristal it is a passion, and more recently, a vision for the future. This wife and mother of one has decided to fulfill her dream of being her own boss and has founded Rich Labels, a full service clothing e-commerce site. Kristal’s company is in the start-up phase, and she is currently visiting wholesale companies in the Chicago area to stock her inventory.  

She explains that in the past, her biggest obstacle had always been accessing funds that would allow her to get everything up and running. “Micro loans have changed that,” she says. 

In fact, the loan she is requesting will be invaluable in launching her business, and will go into purchasing inventory and developing a comprehensive marketing and branding strategy. 
  
Let’s show Kristal how much positive change a micro loan brings!

loans.use: to purchase inventory and invest in marketing

loans.name: Samora

texts.en:
Samora has a lot to be proud of. This young entrepreneur started his delivery business a year and a half ago, and already counts companies such as Sears and Home Depot as his clients.    

Drawing on contacts he made working as a delivery driver throughout his late teens and early twenties, Samora has carved out a reliable clientele and currently contracts eight drivers in the tri-state area.  He believes in being a generous employer and reimburses his drivers for job-related repairs.    

Even though his business has taken off at a fast pace, Samora says his biggest accomplishment has been being able to take control of his finances to support his mother.  
 
Samora needs this loan to purchase office supplies.  Additionally, he explains that the biggest challenge he faces is building a healthy credit score, and this loan will be the first step in achieving this.

loans.use: to purchase office supplies

loans.name: Console

texts.en: Judith is 33-years-old. She is married with four children who are between the ages of 18 and 6 years, all of them go to school. She has a shop and has been working in business for the past 22 years. With the loan, she would like to buy more pens, soap, books, and sugar for sale. The profits from the business will be used for her family's welfare and pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: To buy more pens, soap, books, and sugar for sale.

loans.name: Clementine

texts.en: Clementine, age 3, is married with 4 children between the ages of 14 and 3 years old, three of them go to school. She has a shop and has been running a business for 13 years. With the loan requested, she would like to buy more sugar, salt, books, pens, soap and cooking oil. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: To buy more sugar, salt, books, pens, soap and cooking oil.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy more stock of beauty products

loans.name: Dismas

texts.en: Dismas is 45-years-old. He is married with 7 children between the ages of 27 and 12 years, five of them go to school. He sells clothes and has been selling for the past 22 years. With the loan, he would like to buy more clothes for sale. The profits from the business will be used to improve his standards of living.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: La joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 27 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riego, posee una pequeña tienda ubicada en su lugar de residencia desde hace 3 años, la joven es muy trabajadora, responsable y honesta,  tiene mucha clientela por la variedad de productos y los buenos precios, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar las necesidades que se le presentan en su hogar, vive en casa propia con su madre y su hermana, ella solicita un crédito para la compra de granos básicos, huevos, leche, refrescos, pan dulce, golosinas, etc.  y asi poder tener junto con su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
The young person whose face has been blurred is 27 years old and lives in a high risk zone. She has had a small shop in her house for 3 years. She is very hardworking, responsible and honest and has a lot of customers due to her variety of products and good prices. 

With the income she obtains from her sales she manages to cover the needs of her household. She lives in her own home with her mother and her sister. She is asking for a loan to buy staple grains, eggs, milk, soft drinks, sweet bread, sweets etc, and will thus be able to have, along with her family, a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy staple grains, eggs, milk, soft drinks, sweet bread, sweets etc.

loans.name: Annie

texts.en:
Jerk ribs, stewed oxtails, crab cakes and cranberry spinach salad are just some of the delectable menu options that Annie offers at her food and catering company, Not Jus Southern Catering.  Annie’s passion for service and food comes from an upbringing rooted in southern cooking and hospitality. She’s also keen on running her own business. Prior to founding Not Jus Southern, Annie earned a degree in Business Management while working in catering.  

Now Annie is ready to expand Not Jus Southern with a little help from the Kiva community!

This loan will allow Annie to invest in marketing and other essentials. In the future, Annie hopes to continue serving her customers and employing workers in the New York City and Long Island areas.  When asked what her vision was, Annie replied, "I want to show people, especially minority women, that it’s not impossible to get your own in this world.”   To learn more about her business, visit: www.notjussoutherncater.com

loans.use: to invest in marketing

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is a fish monger and has been in that business for one year. She is a married woman, age twenty-eight, with one child and lives in Kasese, Uganda. She has a dream of educating her child and buying land. Mary is hard working though faced with a challenge of limited capital. Mary wants money to buy fish for selling.

loans.use: to buy fish for selling.

loans.name: Abdulrahman

texts.en:
Abdulrahman is a 20-year-old, single man, living with his family in Haja city, Yemen. Abdulrahman studied till the secondary school education. Unfortunately, he couldn't complete his studies. His neighbors have good things to say about him. They describe him as a kind and hardworking man. In the beginning, he purchased a motorcycle to work as a driver to transport people from one place to another. He found this business was not profitable for him then, he sold it and opened a small grocery inside his area. As the main source of income for his family, Abdulrahman started selling food materials three years ago. He started this business with a small amount of capital. Thanks to his hard work, he has been able to develop and expand his merchandise. The profits from this business have allowed Abdulrahman to expand his sales volume. 

For the purpose of further developing his business, Abdulrahman turned to Al-Amal Micro Finance Bank. He is requesting a loan of 100,000 YER to buy more food materials for his grocery store in order to be able to meet all the demands of his customers.

Abdulrahman plans to invest the earnings from the loan to further increase his business. He also intends to expand his business more in order to provide his family with a better future.

loans.use: to buy more food materials for his grocery store

loans.name: Jean Marie Vianny

texts.en: Jean Marie Vianny is 51 years old. He is married with six children between 30 and 16 years old, one of whom goes to school. He has a mini-market and has been selling for the past 25 years. With the loan, he would like to buy more cakes, biscuits and sweet bananas for sale. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for his children and buy food for consumption.

loans.use: To buy more cakes, biscuits and sweet bananas to sell

loans.name: Felesi

texts.en:
Felesi is 28-years-old, married with two children and lives in Kasese, Uganda. Felesi operates a general merchandise shop (retail). She has been in that business for two years and owns a saloon as an additional income generating activity. Felesi has a dream of buying land, business expansion and educating her children. Felesi is hard working, although challenged by inflation and competition. 

Felesi wants the loan facility to buy sugar, soap, salt, maize flour and others to sell.

loans.use: to buy sugar, salt, soap, and others to sell.

loans.name: Harima

texts.en: Harima is 36-years-old. She is married with 4 children  between the ages of 12 and 6 years old, all of them go to school. She sells clothes and has been running a business for the past 16 years. With the loan, she would like to buy skirts, t-shirts, shirts for sale. The profits from the business will be used to improve the standards of her living.

loans.use: To buy skirts, t-shirts, shirts for sale.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en: Judith is 56 years old.  She is married with seven children between 32 and 11 years old, two of whom go to school. She has a shop and has been working in the business for 22 years. With the loan, she would like to buy more pens, soap, books, and sugar for sale. The profits from the business will be used to provide for her family's welfare and pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: To buy more pens, soap, books, and sugar to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to decorate her new nail salon and buy a special chair.

loans.name: Blanca Marilyn

texts.es: Blanca de 29 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a su compañero de vida y su hijo de 7 años de edad. Ella es una mujer trabajadora que se desempeña como empacadora en una empresa cercana, además su compañero de vida trabaja en otra empresa y es gracias a ello que le apoya con la economía familiar. Blanca desea construir una pequeña bodega en el patio de su vivienda, además desea comprar ventanas y balcones para la misma. Por lo anterior Blanca solicita un crédito a FUSAI para comprar: cemento arena, grava, ladrillo, ventanas y balcones para construir una pequeña bodega y colocar ventanas y balcones en su vivienda.
texts.en: Blanca is 29 years old. She lives in her own home together with her life companion and her son who is 7 years old. She is a hardworking woman who is employed as a packer at a nearby business. In addition, her life companion works at another business and thanks to these jobs they can maintain the family economy. Blanca wants to build a small cellar on her home patio. In addition, she wants to purchase windows and balconies for it too. Blanca is seeking a loan from FUSAI for the aforementioned items to purchase: cement, sand, gravel, bricks, windows and balconies to build a small cellar and to add windows and balconies to her home.

loans.use: to purchase cement, sand, gravel, bricks, windows and balconies to construct a small cellar to add windows and balconies to her home.

loans.name: Aprila Monica

texts.en: To generate additional income, Aprila Monica has been engaged in sewing clothes, curtains, pillowcases, bed sheets, table clothes and pot holders that she sells in the local community. She aims to improve and strengthen this business and generate sufficient income to sustain her daily necessities. Having insufficient capital, she would like to avail herself of a loan of PHP 7,000 to buy fabrics, hooks & eyes, threads, buttons and needles she needs in sewing. Through patience and hard work, she believes that she will be able to make her business more profitable.

loans.use: to buy fabrics, hooks & eyes, threads, buttons and needles

location.town: Brgy. Ganao, Dupax del Sur, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stock of ingredients for preparing food to sell

loans.name: Marina Elizabeth

texts.es: Marina de 29 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a su compañero de vida y sus 2 hijos de 8 y 13 años de edad. Ella es una mujer emprendedora que se gana la vida vendiendo productos de primera necesidad en una tienda ubicada en su domicilio, además aprovechando la buena cantidad de clientes con la que cuenta vende productos congelados. Marina desea cambiar las láminas del techo de su vivienda, ya que estas se encuentran deterioradas, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para comprar: láminas galvanizadas para cambiar el techo de su vivienda.
texts.en: Marina is 29 years old. She lives in her own home together with her life companion and her two children who are 8 and 13 years old. She is a businesswoman who makes a living selling basic necessity products from a store located at her home. In addition, she takes advantage of the good number of customers that she can count on to sell frozen food to. Marina wants to replace the metal sheets on the roof of her home because her current ones are deteriorating. Because of this she is seeking a loan from FUSAI to purchase: galvanized sheet metal to replace the roof on her home.

loans.use: to purchase galvanized sheet metal to replace the roof on her home.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more sugar and rice to sell

loans.name: Luis Alonso

texts.es: Luis de 57 años de edad vive en casa alquilada con su esposa y sus dos hijos, desde hace 6 años se dedica a la artesanía hecha con metal como marcos para fotos, cuadros, etc. con sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos que se le presentan en su hogar, Don Luis solicita un crédito para la compra de laminas, electrodos, pintura de varios colores, estaño, etc. todo por mayor para seguir con su trabajo ya que esa es su única fuente de ingresos y así poderle dar a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Luis is 57 years old. He lives in a rented home with his wife and his two children. For 6 years he has worked as a metalworks artist making frames for pictures, boxes, etc. With his sales he is able to pay for some of the expenses that arise from his household. Luis is seeking a loan to purchase wholesale sheet metal, electrodes, various colors of paint, tin, etc to continue with his work now that it is his only source of earnings. This way he will be able to give his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase wholesale sheet metal, electrodes, various colors of paint, tin, etc.

loans.name: Frida

texts.en:
Frida is 42 years old, married, and she and her spouse have been blessed with 5 children. She has a retail shop which she has been running for the past 8 years, and it has been profitable. Right now, her monthly income is KES 40,000.

She will be using this loan to buy more stock of goods to sell in her retail shop. These goods include sugar, maize flour, and cooking oil, as well as detergents. She anticipates making more profits, which she will use to buy more stock of goods.

This is her first loan term with VisionFund Kenya, and her future hope is to have a successful and stable business.

loans.use: To buy more stock of goods to sell.

loans.name: Sonia

texts.en:
Sonia is 51 years old, married and has six children. Some got married and live separately from them. She is in the vegetable-vending business at the market. She also extends credits on her merchandise, but she collects them within a week so she can reinvest in her business. 

Sonia is now asking for a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy more vegetables like eggplant, tomatoes, beans and bananas to sell. She hopes to continue developing her sales and to save funds for emergency purposes.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables like eggplant, tomatoes, beans and bananas to sell

loans.name: Rosana

texts.en:
Rosana is 36 years old, married and has two children. She is managing a store for income. She sells grocery items to the people in her village. 

Rosana is now asking for a loan of PHP 6,000 to buy sardines, milk, noodles and sugar to sell. This will help increase sales capacity. She promises to pay back her loan in full and to continue offering good products and services.

loans.use: to buy sardines, milk, noodles and sugar to sell

loans.name: May-Ann

texts.en:
May-Ann is a 24-year-old married woman with a child. She manages a store in order to gain income for her family. She patiently sells grocery items from her small store in their village. She hopes to keep selling more merchandise to acquire more customers to shop in her store. 

May-Ann is now asking for a loan of PHP 6,000 to buy canned goods, noodles, breads, and biscuits to sell. She hopes to keep achieving good sales and to save funds for education and revolving capital in the business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, noodles, breads, and biscuits to sell

loans.name: Petronilla

texts.en: Petronilla is 45 years old. She is married with six children between 29 and 14 years old, four of whom go to school. She has a shop and has been working in the business for the past 20 years. With the loan, she would like to buy more items such as sugar, salt and biscuits for sale. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for her children and reinvest in the same business.

loans.use: To buy more sugar, salt and cooking oil to sell

loans.name: Rizvonjon

texts.ru: Ризвончон родилась в 1995 году. Она студентка 2 курса Медицинского колледжа. Ризвончон учится успешно и старается получить хорошее образование и в будущем служить своему народу. Она замужем. Ризвончон данное время нуждается финансовой поддержке, так как она должна оплатить за учебный договор. Ее муж не имеет денег, чтобы помочь ей. Ризвончон запрашивает займ для оплаты учебного договора. Она ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en: Rizvonjon was born in the 1995. She is in her second year of studies at the Medical College. Rizvonjon is a high-achieving student. She puts in an effort to receive a good education and serve her country in the future. Rizvonjon is married. At present she needs financial support since she needs to pay tuition. Her husband lacks the funds to help her. Rizvonjon is applying for a loan to pay her tuition. She is counting on your kindness and hoping for your compassion.

loans.use: to pay for tuition.

loans.name: Leticia

texts.en:
Thirty years old and a mother of three, Leticia has a direct-selling business in which she sells cosmetics, perfumes, soap and fabric conditioners to the people in her village. She hopes to offer more merchandise to increase her income, and so is requesting a loan of P6,000 to buy more products such as soap, cosmetics and perfumes. 

Leticia will direct her additional revenue toward her children's education expenses.

loans.use: to buy more products such as soap, cosmetics and perfumes

loans.name: Speciose

texts.en: Speciose is 33 years old. She is married with three children between 12 and 6 years old, all of whom go to school.  She has a shop and has been running the business for the past 14 years. With the loan, she would like to buy more cooking oil, soaps, salt, sugar and biscuits for sale. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for her children and buy food for consumption.

loans.use: To buy more cooking oil, soaps, salt, sugar and biscuits for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Hello world! Meet Elena.

Elena, 54, is a very dedicated mother who believes in hard work. She is happily married and blessed with five lovely children whom she often refers to as “my pride.” She is based in Kapsowar, a small remote rural town in Kenya that has bad terrain and is characterized by drought and bad weather conditions. 

For the past twenty years, Elena has been actively involved in mixed farming. Her primary source of income is from milk and crop farming. Elena passionately loves dairy farming and has nicknamed one of her cows “Kapseret.” Milking Kapseret is her hobby and feeding her cows makes her very proud. Dairy farming is very fulfilling for Elena. 

Although this humble mom makes a living through selling milk, she faces the challenge of irrigating her farm and providing water to her animals. Kapsowar is a remote area without piped water or electricity. Since Elena is from a marginalized community, she is forced to walk long distances to search for water. She typically walks for two hours. 

Therefore, Elena is requesting a loan to buy a water tank. Most of the rain water in his area goes to waste and Elena wants to harvest the water and store it in a water tank. The loan will save Elena's time and allow her to irrigate her farm during dry seasons and increase her productivity. The increase in productivity will translate into more income, which will provide Elena with financial security. Elena will also use the stored water for home consumption. 

Elena’s dream is to increase her farming activities and provide her children with a proper education. Education is the only way that her children, who are from a marginalized community, can succeed.

loans.use: to buy a water tank

loans.name: Mwanamgeni

texts.en:
Mwanangeni operates an open air food selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of business. 

With the Kshs 50,000 loan she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat. She decided to join Kiva partner Yehu in order to access loans to boost her business

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat.

loans.name: Şengül

texts.en:
Sengul is married and a mother of three. Although her husband is retired, he still works at his second job. To contribute her family budget, Sengul sells pastries that she bakes at home. This summer she began selling jewelry at the seashore. She is requesting a loan to purchase more pastry ingredients for baking and more jewelry to sell.

Translated from Turkish by Maya Staff 
Şengül Hanım evli üç çocuk annesi.  Eşi emekli fakat ek iş yapıyor.  Şengül Hanım da eşine katkı sağlamak ve çocuklarını okutabilmek için evde börek,poğaça ve pasta yapıp satıyor.  Sürekli müşterisi Poyraz kafe.  Buraya her sabah su böreği ve poğaça yapıyor.  Bu yaz tezgahda açamaya başladı.  Tezgahında takılar satıyor.  Aldığı ikinci kredi ile de biraz hamur işi malzemeleri  alacak,geri kalan kredisi ile de tezgahına takılar alacak.

loans.use: to buy more pastry ingredients for baking

loans.name: Rubielen

texts.en: Rubielen lives with her family at Tuguegarao. She is 27 years old, married and has a child. She is baking homemade cakes and pastries for income. Aside from that, she and her husband are involved in a networking business selling health products. They work hard together in order to sustain the family’s needs. She is now asking for a loan of PHP 20,000 to invest in her food-selling business. She will buy flour, milk, sugar and cheese. She hopes to keep selling delicious cakes and pastries so that someday, she will establish a larger stall for her business.

loans.use: to buy flour, milk, sugar and cheese to make cakes and pastries

loans.name: Jesca

texts.en:
Hello wonderful Kiva lenders! Meet Jesca, a wife,  mother and  small holder farmer who is based in Kapseret,  a remote village in Eldoret. This  area is known as “the city of champions” because for every 10 people you meet, two are athletes. It's home to the best world record holders in long distance running. This mother of three has been practicing mixed farming for the past eight years; her primary sources of income have been milk and some vegetables she plants.

Jesca enjoys the returns she gets, but is challenged to maintain a good standard of living. She has identified free space on her farm and wants to fully utilize this space by acquiring a good quality dairy cow. Dairy farming in Kenya is a very profitable venture, and milk prices in the recent past have been going up, so Jesca, being a visionary and entrepreneurial woman, wants to take full advantage of this. She has chosen the breed of cow that she will keep, and she knows that she will not only get milk from the cow but also manure, and this will boost the fertility of her farm. Selling her milk will never be a problem because there is a ready market, and she will also be selling to big dairy processing firms. 

Jesca said she chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan request because they offer agriculture-based loans, and their interest rate is low and on a reducing scale. She underwent training through Juhudi Kilimo, and from this training she learned that saving is a continuous process in many micro-finance institutions. Jesca hopes that through the accumulated profit she will be able to start adding value to her milk by starting services such as packaging and the production of other dairy products. This loan will change her life and will secure the future of her school-going children. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Irma

texts.en:
Irma is a 42-year-old married woman. She lives with her husband, two children and a pensioner mother-in-law. She graduated from a pedagogical college and works as an English teacher at the local public school. Unfortunately, a teacher’s salary is not enough to make ends meet for a family. 

In the region there is a high unemployment rate, but self-employment helps inhabitants to make a living. Therefore, she decided to start a trading business with a loan.  Local credit providers usually demand experience and some stable income from the borrowers and Irma’s credit requests have been rejected several times, as she doesn't satisfy their requirements. However, she has received a credit in the framework of a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo.  It is called the Start-up Program and it gives rural poor people the chance to start or re-start businesses.  

With the loan of 1,100 USD, she will purchase a stock of nuts which she will resell at a higher price. This will increase the family income and will give Irma a chance to improve the living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to begin trade in nuts.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is a businesswoman who has been involved in business activities since 2012.  She started with her own working capital of $300.00. 

She has a kiosk in her house and she is now requesting a loan of $800.00 from Kiva partner Tuba Rai Metin in order to improve her business in the future. She will buy additional supplies with the loan such as candies, detergent, noodles, biscuits, wheat, perfume, aqua, cooking oils, milk, salt. and other things to sell including hard drinks. 

She is happy, because with the loan from Tuba Rai Metin, she will Increase her income and her management can be strong.

loans.use: to buy candies, detergent, noodles, biscuits, wheat, perfume, aqua, cooking oils, milk, salt. and other things to sell including hard drinks.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seedlings for her farm plantation.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
This is Nancy. Her previous loan was a big help for her business, as she was able to purchase products for her direct selling business. The loan is also useful for the maintenance of her farm business. Her income from the loan assisted with their everyday expenditures at home. She and her husband are working hard to provide for their everyday needs.

She would like to apply for another 20,000 PHP loan. It will be used to buy additional supplies and merchandise, such as clothing, footwear, undergarments, and cosmetics. The more items she has on display and available on hand the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from this business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs. She will also use a portion of the loan to improve her farm. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Nancy hopes that her business will grow more and maintain an increasing profit. She dreams of a prosperous life with her family. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week, and this is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional supplies and merchandise such as clothing, footwear, undergarments and cosmetics .

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a 32-year-old woman married to Geoffrey who adds additional income to support their family. They are blessed with one child.  Elizabeth has been operating a grocery stall business for a period of four years, earning an income of about KES 8,000 at the end of every month.

She was introduced to VisionFund Kenya by a Credit Officer and is now servicing her first loan of KES 10,000. She intends to use this amount to buy cabbages, tomatoes, green vegetables, onions, carrots and fruits to sell to her customers on a daily basis.

Elizabeth plans to use the anticipated income to pay school fees for her children, and she hopes to open a cereals shop near her homestead to serve her customers efficiently.

loans.use: To buy cabbages, tomatoes, green vegetables, onions, carrots and fruits to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Lam

texts.en: Lam is aged 48 years and lives in Boribo district of Kampong Chhnang province. She is a married mother who has seven children, three of whom are dependent on her. To make a living, she has been with her farming for twenty-five years. She is able to earn about 30,000 KHR per day. This is the first loan for her, and now she is applying for a loan to buy a solar panel to generate electricity for her household. She hopes that her livelihood is improving and her children will have plenty of food.

loans.use: To buy solar panel to generate electricity for her household.

loans.name: Kweeba Development Association Group

texts.en:
Betty, a member of Kweeba group, is age 40 and a widow with three children who all attend school. She also looks after two orphans by providing all their basic needs like food, tuition, and clothes among other things.

She operates a phone accessory shop in Kampala town. She has been in business for the last eight years. She mostly deals in mobile phones, batteries, and chargers. She decided to start this business to enable her to look after her family after the loss of the husband. She has hopes of becoming a famous business lady by expanding her business if she acquires the loan.

She faces the challenge of competition from surrounding shops, which have a variety of goods that she does not have.

loans.use: To buy phones, batteries and chargers

loans.name: Ana Yolanda

texts.es: Ana de 59  años de edad vive con su esposo en casa propia, ella posee un negocio que consiste en vender productos de bazar, ropa, lociones, cosméticos productos plásticos y otros, ya tiene más de 20 años de experiencia, el negocio lo tiene ubicado en su lugar de residencia y también sale a vender en la zona donde ella reside, Ana solicita un crédito para la compra de  mas productos varios para su negocio como: ropa, lociones, calzado, cosméticos entre otros, para tener junto con su esposo una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
Ana, age 59, lives with her husband in her own house.  She has a business that consists of selling household items, clothes, lotions, cosmetics, plastic products, and others.  She now has over 20 years of experience.  The business is located at her house.  She also goes out to sell in the area where she lives.

Ana is requesting a loan to buy more various products for her business.  She will buy things like clothes, lotions, shoes, and cosmetics, among others.  She will do this in order to, together with her husband, have improved financial stability.

loans.use: to buy clothes, lotions, shoes, and cosmetics, among others.

loans.name: Aida María

texts.es:
En Mejía localizada a unos pocos kilómetros de la ciudad de Portoviejo ciudad de gente dedicada en gran parte a la agricultura y al cultivo y venta de cocos se reúnen cada quince días el Grupo De crédito Mejía.
En este lugar vive la señora Aida, tiene 73 años, hace varios años quedo viuda y de esta relación tuvo 8 hijos mayores y comprometidos pero la mayoría viven muy cerca de ella. 
Doña Aida para salir adelante y ganarse el sustento diario se dedica a la cría de pollos para lo cual tiene una pequeña granja, compra los pollos en Portoviejo cuando están pequeñitos los tiene por dos o tres meses y luego los vende enteros o por libras a personas de la localidad y muchas veces entrega también en las tiendas. Ella también les da parte del crédito a sus hijos los mismos que se dedican a la agricultura, siembran tomate, pimiento, verduras y limones, ellos al vender su producción le dan parte de sus ganancias a su madre para su sustento diario. 
Es socia fundadora del Grupo De crédito y le gusta por la ayuda que le brindan los créditos. Este crédito es para comprar más pollos y fertilizantes para los cultivos. Sus sueños son tener buena salud.
texts.en:
Every fortnight, the members of Mejía communal bank meet in Mejía, which is located a few kilometers from the city of Portoviejo. Most of the people in this city work in agriculture, growing and selling coconuts.

This is where Aida, age 73, lives. She has been widowed for several years and has eight children from her relationship. Most of them live very close to her.

In order to get ahead and earn her daily sustenance, Aida raises chickens on a small chicken farm that she has.  She buys the chickens in Portoviejo when they are very little.  She has them for two or three months, and then she sells them whole or by the pound to people in the area.  She also often delivers to the stores.

She also gives part of the loan to her children, who also work in agriculture.  They grow tomatoes, peppers, vegetables, and limes.  When they sell their production they give part of their earnings to their mother for her daily sustenance.

She is a founding member of the communal bank.  She likes it because of the help that the loans provide.  This loan is to buy more chickens and fertilizers for her crops.

Her dream is to be in good health.

loans.use: to buy more chickens and fertilizers for her crops.

loans.name: Claris

texts.en:
Claris is 54 years old, married, and together with her spouse they have been blessed with 4 children. She does farming in Kisumu, and this has been profitable for the past 12 years that she has been in this business. 

She plans to use this loan amount to buy farm supplies such as fertilizer and seeds for use on her farm during this planting season. She anticipates making more income which she will use to pay school fees for her children.

This is her third loan term and she paid her previous loans successfully. In future she hopes to improve her farming methods and be successful in the farming business.

loans.use: To buy farm supplies for use on her farm.

loans.name: Marieta

texts.en:
Marieta is 34 years old. She lives with her parents in Spandaryan village, Shirak region. Her parents are provided with a retirement pension. The family owns arable land where they cultivate wheat and potatoes. Additionally, Marieta owns two cows and some calves. With the loan, Marieta will purchase forage for cows and calves and will be able to feed them during the coming season.

Marieta is a divorced woman who takes care of her two school age children with great care. She hopes that lenders will help her to sustain her farming business.

loans.use: to pay for forage for feeding the livestock.

loans.name: Nina

texts.en: Nina is a widow from Harij village in the Shirak region. She lives there alone as her two sons are migrant workers. Nina earns her living through an agricultural business. More specifically, she owns a plot of land where different kinds of vegetables and fruits are grown. Nina also keeps chickens, cows and calves. She realizes agricultural products in the local market and gets an income for her living.  Nina has requested a loan to purchase forage for feeding the livestock. This will enable her to feed the livestock and continue her farming business.

loans.use: to pay for forage for feeding the livestock

loans.name: Pikria

texts.en:
Pikria is 30 years old and a young divorced woman. She lives with her 3 school-aged children in Zestaponi district.  Pikria married at an early age and wasn’t able to get an education. She has no university degree, which is one of the main reason for her unemployment. She looks after her 3 children and stays home, but she has a great desire to be involved in a trading business. 

Pikria couldn’t request a loan from financial institutions until the Start Up program began, which is a joint product of Kiva and Credo. She requested a loan of 450 USD to begin trading with clothing and bedding. She plans to purchase the products at wholesale prices and then resell among her friends and villagers. This will give her a chance to earn income and not to depend on her parents. Pikria will provide a better future for her children.

loans.use: to start up trading clothes to generate income to improve the living conditions of her 3 children.

loans.name: Osphat

texts.en:
Osphat is a single man. He has 3 children. He describes himself as patient. He operates a retail business where he sells flour, soap, sugar and other items. He has been involved in this business for 3 years. His business is located in a strategic location. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insecurity. 

He will use the Kes 50,000 loan to buy more stock of sugar, rice, flour, soap and other items. His business goal is to own a wholesale shop within 5 years. He hopes that in the future, he will be financially stable. This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. His previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy more stock of sugar, rice, flour, soap and other items.

loans.name: Irma

texts.en:
Irma is 47 years old. She is married and lives in the small village of Zestaponi district with her husband and son. The family is involved in agricultural activities. In particular, they have a vineyard and a plot of land, where they grow nut trees. Irma sells the harvested products locally at a good price. 

In addition, they have a plot of agricultural land, which needs cultivation. Irma requested a loan for purchasing a tractor. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo enables her to get a loan of 850 Gel to purchase a tractor and to cultivate the land. She will also rent out the tractor to her villagers to get additional income. Irma awaits your support.

loans.use: to purchase a tractor for cultivating her agricultural land, and also to rent it out and get additional income.

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en:
Rosemary is a married woman. She has 5 children. She describes herself to be jovial. She operates a retail business where she sells flour, soap, sugar, bread and other items. She has been involved in this business for 4 years. Her business is located in an area with potential. 

She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more stock of bread, sugar, rice, flour, soap and other items. Her business goal is to succeed within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will prosper. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: buy more stock of bread, sugar, rice, flour, soap and other items.

loans.name: Oluftamo

texts.ru:
Олуфтамо мастерица своего дела, ей 43 года. Она предоставляет услуги швеи и занимается этим делом более 10 лет. Олуфтамо замужем и живет в городе Куляб с мужем, дочерью и тремя сыновьями. Ее дочери 17 лет, а сыновьям по 19, 12 и 9 лет. Все дети ходят в школу и занимаются учебой.
Олуфтамо своим талантом шитья зарабатывает на жизнь и гордится этим. Она сейчас хочет расширить свое швейное дело. На часть суммы кредита Олуфтамо купит модернизированную швейную машинку, а на остальную часть она хочет сделать ремонт в одной части дома. Олуфтамо очень важен этот кредит, она надеется на вашу поддержку.
texts.en:
Oluftamo is a very skilled 43-year-old-seamstress.  She has been working in this field for more than 10 years.  She is married and lives in the city of Kulob with her husband, daughter, and three sons.  Her daughter is 17 years old, and her sons are 19, 12 and 9.  All her children are still in school and involved in their studies.

Oluftamo is proud of the fact that, thanks to her talent for sewing, she is able to make a living.  She would like to increase her sewing activity.  She will use part of her loan to buy a modern sewing machine, and will use the rest of the money to perform some repairs in her house.  She really needs this loan and hopes to receive your support.

loans.use: to buy a modern sewing machine and to perform some repairs at home.

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice is a married woman. She has 4 children. She describes herself as honest. She operates a retail business where she sells fruits and vegetables. She has been involved in this business for 6 years. Her business is located in a competitive location and her primary customers are of all types.

Eunice identifies her biggest business challenge as lack of capital. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stock of fruits and vegetables. Her business goal is to own a big business within 5 years. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more stock of fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Liza

texts.en:
Liza is thankful that she was previously granted a 30,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products to sell in her variety store business. Through her earnings, she is able to send her child to school and support her family's daily needs.

She would like to apply for another 30,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. The greater the variety of items displayed, the more attractive her store will be, and this will mean more sales and income. Her profits from the store will definitely help sustain her family’s basic needs and pay for her child’s education expense. She is positive that the financial assistance will further improve her business.

Liza dreams of the continued success of her business and is motivated by the desire to give her family a better life. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week as well as to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages, and other products to add to her inventory

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en: Beatrice is 38 years old. She is married with 5 children aged between 19 and 4 years; all of them go to school. She sells various items in her shop and has been selling for 15 years. With the loan, she would like to buy more items such as books, plates and spoons. The profits from the business will be used to expand her business and pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to buy more items such as books, plates and spoons for sale.

loans.name: Hurmat

texts.ru: Хурмат родилась в 1983 году. Она обращается за кредитом в первые, так как она решила организовать свой бизнес. Она уже давно хотела начать бизнес. Ее муж трудовой мигрант в Российской Федерации и она сама справляется со всеми домашними проблемами. Хурмат несколько месяцев назад начала бизнес купле продажей хлеба на возле ее дома. Она уверена, что в дальнейшем ее новый бизнес будет развеваться, так как все люди ежедневно покупают хлеб. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 5000 сомони для покупки хлеба, чтобы развевать новый бизнес. Она ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en: Hurmat was born in 1983.  She is taking a loan to develop her new business.  She has been wanting to start a business for a long time.  Her husband is currently in Russia working as a migrant worker and Hurmat takes care of things at home by herself.  A few months ago, she started a business buying and selling bread near her house.  She is certain that her new business will do well in the future, as people buy bread daily.  She is taking a loan of 5,000 somoni to buy bread and grow her new business.  She is awaiting your kindness and compassion.

loans.use: to buy bread and develop her new business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase seedlings and fertilizer

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy seedlings and fertilizers.

loans.name: Geoffrey

texts.en: Geoffrey is a married man. He operates a retail business where he sells eggs, flour, soap, sugar, bread and other items. He has been involved in this business for four years. His business is located in an area with potential. He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more stock of bread, sugar, rice, flour, soap and other items. His business goal is to be prosperous within five years. This is his first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: buy more stock of bread, sugar, rice, flour, soap and other items

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine, 36, is married to James and together they have been blessed with four children. Her spouse works and also supports the family. She has been a farmer for the past eight years and it has been profitable.

She plans to use this loan amount to buy seeds and fertilizer for planting on her farm. She will also use part of it to pay some of the farm laborers. She will use the generated profits to buy more farm inputs. 

This is her third loan term and she paid her previous loans successfully. In the future, Josephine hopes to grow her farming business and have a stable business.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Justin

texts.en:
Justin is a 52-year-old hardworking man married to Beatrice who adds additional income to support their family's welfare. They are blessed with three children. Justin has been operating a retail shop dealing with movie tapes and DVDs for 10 years earning an income of KES 10,000 at the end of every month.

Justin is now servicing his fourth loan of KES 15,000 with VisionFund Kenya and intends to use this amount to purchase more stock of movie DVDs and music discs to add to his current stock, which is running out.

Justin plans to use the anticipated income to pay school fees for his children and hopes to open a recording studio in the near future.

loans.use: To add additional movie DVDs and music discs to his current stock.

loans.name: Hong

texts.en: Hong is a citizen from the Kampong Thom province’s Kampong Svay district. She is a 49-year-old mother of three children. To support her family's living, she does rice farming on one hectare, which is the main source of her income. To supplement her income, she also sells snacks. Now, she can earn up to 20,000 KHR per day from the business that she has had for 25 years. This is the first loan for her with VisionFund. She is applying for a loan to pay school fees for her children. She hopes that her children will have good jobs.

loans.use: To pay the school fees for her children.

location.town: Kampong Thom Province, Kampong Svay District

loans.name: Betcy

texts.en: Betcy is a married woman. She has four children. She describes herself to be focused. She operates a retail business where she sells cooking fat, flour, soap, sugar, bread and other items. She has been involved in this business for 11 years. Her business is located in a rural area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be a lack of funds. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more stock of bread, sugar, rice, flour, soap and other items. Her business goal is to excel within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will be a better businesswoman. She will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees.

loans.use: to buy more stock of bread, sugar, rice, flour, soap and other items

loans.name: Masika

texts.en:
Masika thanks Yehu and Kiva for the support of the previous loans which has helped her to get profit and sustain her family in all of their needs.
Here again, she comes to you requesting a loan of 20,000 KES to buy wheat flour, milk, sugar, and charcoal to use in her business of selling food.

loans.use: buy wheat flour, milk, sugar, and charcoal to use in her business of selling food.

loans.name: Ekaterine

texts.en: Ekaterine is a 38-year-old married woman. She lives with her husband, two children and a daughter-in-law in the small village of Senaki district. Ekaterine is involved in the husbandry business. She has cows and produces cheese to sell. Her husband brings wood from the forest and sells if for winter times at a good price. The family has only a seasonal income. Ekaterine decided to start trading clothes and requested a loan. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, enables her to get a loan of 3,000 Gel to purchase a stock of clothes. Ekaterine will resell the clothes at a good price and will get a stable income. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to begin selling  clothes

loans.name: Josphat

texts.en:
Josphat is a 58-year-old man married to Annastacia who adds additional income to support their family's welfare. They are blessed with six children.  Josphat has been a farmer practicing an agricultural and livestock business for four years earning an income of KES 10,000 at the end of every month.

Josphat is servicing his third loan of KES 30,000 with VisionFund Kenya and intends to use this amount to buy seedlings and animal feed.

Josphat plans to use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for his children and open a cereals store. He hopes to buy an additional bigger farm plantation.

loans.use: To buy seedlings and animal feed

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Meet Ruth, an ever-smiling, hardworking, and honest mother who is 44 years of age. She hails from the Eldoret area of Kenya, which is home to the main campus of Moi University, and also home to some of the best athletes in the world. She is the proud mother of five lovely school-going children that she values and treasures and will go an extra mile to make sure that they are comfortable. Ruth’s primary source of income has been milk selling, crop farming, and poultry farming; through these ventures, she has been able to earn a decent income. She is a very determined and dedicated farmer who has been practicing farming for five years, and through those years, she has never regretted venturing into farming. Ruth sells her vegetables, eggs, and milk to the nearby market. Milking and feeding her own cow is the most enjoyable part about farming. She is very thankful that dairy farming has been able to sustain farmers in her village. Profits from milk sales have enabled her to take care of her family and she has always yearned to have more dairy cows.  

She is seeking a loan to buy a good breed of dairy cow. She has already identified the breed of cow that she will buy. The cow will produce between 15-20 liters of milk per day. This breed of cow will be producing milk referred to as “the ideal drinking milk” because it will not lack an adequate amount of fat and will possess desirable quantities of protein. This cow will certainly boost milk production in her farm which will translate to more sales and better income for her and her family. Because of this high milk production potential, she will save more money to fully repay the loan. She believes that through careful selection and the application of the strict standard of excellence in keeping her dairy cow, she will have more income, which will improve her living standards.

loans.use: to buy a quality dairy cow.

loans.name: Hernán Eleodoro

texts.es:
En Mejía localizada a unos pocos kilómetros de la ciudad de Portoviejo ciudad de gente dedicada en gran parte a la agricultura y al cultivo y venta de cocos se reúnen cada quince días el Grupo De crédito Mejía.
En este lugar vive don Hernán, tiene 35 años de edad, está casado y de esta relación tienen cuatro hijos de  15, 12, 7  y 2 años, dos estudian en colegio y uno en escuela. Su esposa es ama de casa.
El señor Hernán es un hombre muy trabajador que para que no les falte nada a su familia trabaja incansablemente en su negocio, se dedica a la venta de frutas y legumbres, el muy de mañana sale al mercado de mayoristas a abastecerse de productos para luego recorrer la ciudad en un triciclo que es en lo que vende sus productos él tiene mucha clientela ya que casi todos los días realiza los mismos recorridos y sus clientes lo esperan para comprarle a él ya que  vende productos de calidad. Lleva más de 10 años con su negocio con el cual saca adelante a su familia.
Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar frutas y legumbres para su negocio. Lleva dos años en el Grupo De crédito y le gusta porque los créditos le ayudan mucho. Sus sueños son tener un carro para vender sus productos.
texts.en:
In Mejia, located a few kilometers from the City of Portoviejo, the members of the communal bank "Mejia" meet every 15 days.  This is a place where the people work mostly in farming, livestock production, and the production of coconuts.

This is where Hernan, 35, lives.  He is married, and has 4 children aged 15, 12, 7 and 2.  Two of his children are in secondary school, and one is in elementary school.  His wife is a housewife.

Hernan is a very hardworking man who works tirelessly in his business so that his family lacks for nothing.  He has a business selling fruits and vegetables.  He goes out to the wholesale markets very early in the morning to stock up with products to later sell around the city from his three-wheeled vehicle; this is how he sells his products.  He has a lot of customers because he makes the same trips almost every day, and his customers wait to buy from him, because he sells quality products.  He has 10 years of experience with this business;  this is how he provides for his family.

Hernan will use this loan to buy fruits and vegetables for his business.  He's been with his communal bank for 2 years, and he likes it because he finds the loans to be very helpful.  His dream is to have a car to use in selling his products.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Arevik

texts.en:
Arevik is a farmer living in Yeghegnadzor town. She lives there with her husband, son and father-in-law. Arevik's farm includes the biggest incubator in the town where Arevik and her family raise chickens and sell them. This is only one income in this family, and it is not enough to cover the basic needs of the family. 
Arevik has applied for this loan of 2,500 USD to be able to purchase eggs of chickens to raise in an incubator and then grow into hens. Besides agriculture, Arevik also keeps 10 colonies of bees and sells the gathered honey in local markets. The whole family hopes for lenders' support.

loans.use: to pay for eggs of chickens to raise in an incubator and then grow into hens.

loans.name: Lady Karolina

texts.es:
En Mejía localizada a unos pocos kilómetros de la ciudad de Portoviejo ciudad de gente dedicada en gran parte a la agricultura y al cultivo y venta de cocos se reúnen cada quince días el Grupo De crédito Mejía.
En este lugar vive la señora Lady, tiene 24 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen una hija de 4 años la cual está en inicial. Su esposo se dedica a la agricultura.
Doña Lady realiza el crédito para su esposo el mismo que  se dedica a la agricultura, el siembra pimiento, tomate, cilantro  y verduras en toda época del año ya que cuenta con terrenos adecuados con riego, tiene bombas que llevan el agua desde el rio que está cerca hasta sus cultivos, por lo general son tres cosechas de estos productos que realiza al año y es esta la forma que ellos  salen adelante, ella por su parte cría pollos en su casa para lo cual tiene un corral, mantiene sus pollos por un tiempo y que al venderlos le dejan muy buenos ingresos. 
Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar fertilizantes y alimento para los pollos. Este es su quinto ciclo en el Grupo de Crédito. Sus sueños es darle lo mejor a su hija.
texts.en:
In Mejía, a few kilometers away from the city of Portoviejo where most of the people cultivate and sell cacao, the loan group "Mejía" meets every 15 days. Lady lives in Mejía, she is 24 years old, and is married and has a daughter who is 4 years old and is in preschool. Lady's husband is a farmer.

Lady has taken this loan out for her husband's farm, where they are able to grow pepper, tomatoes, cilantro and other vegetables during every season of the year because his land is properly irrigated. He has pumps which bring the water from the river which is close to their land. Generally they get three harvests each year, and this business gets them ahead. Lady raises chickens in a pen at their home. She keeps her chickens for a time, and when she sells them she earns good money. 

They will use this loan to purchase fertilizer as well as feed for the chickens. This is Lady's fifth cycle with the loan group. Her dream is to give her daughter the best life possible.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and chicken feed.

loans.name: Nelly Margarita

texts.es:
En Mejía localizada a unos pocos kilómetros de la ciudad de Portoviejo ciudad de gente dedicada en gran parte a la agricultura y al cultivo y venta de cocos se reúnen cada quince días el Grupo De crédito Mejía.
En este lugar vive la señora Nelly, tiene 38 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene cuatro hijos de 23, 20, 19 y 7 años, el menor  estudia en  escuela, con ella viven el menor y la mayor de sus hijos.
Doña Nelly es una mujer que le toco trabajar muy duro para sacar adelante a sus hijos, ella trabaja de empleada domestica en una casa de la localidad  por la cual recibe un sueldo mensual, pero también para ganar algo extra prepara comida para entregar, ella se levanta muy de mañana a preparar los alimentos para que cuando sea la hora indicada su hija se encargue de ir a entregar a domicilios y lugares de trabajos de sus clientes,  lleva dos años con su negocio y gracias a sus ganancias ellos pueden salir adelante ya que con lo que gana por su labor no le alcanza para vivir.
Este crédito es para comprar víveres para preparar los alimentos. Lleva dos años en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos le ayudan a salir adelante. Sus sueños son darles lo mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en:
In Mejía a few km away from the city of Portoviejo, a community where the people work mainly in agriculture and growing and selling coconuts, the “ Mejía” communal bank meets every fortnight.

Nelly lives in this community. She is 38 years old and is in a common-law relationship from which she has four children aged 23. 20, 19 and 7 years old. The oldest and youngest live with her. The youngest goes to school. Nelly is a woman who has had to work very hard to raise her children. She works as a domestic worker in a local house from which she receives a monthly salary.

But to make some extra money she also makes food to deliver. She gets up very early to prepare the foods and when it is time her daughter takes them and delivers them to the homes and work places of her clients. She has been running this business for two years and thanks to her profits she has managed to get ahead as with what she gets from her salary isn't enough to live on. This loan will be used to buy food to prepare her meals. She has been a member of the communal bank for two years as the loans help her get ahead. Her dream is to provide the best for her children.

loans.use: to buy food.

loans.name: Rodolfo Rafael

texts.es: Rodolfo es un joven con muchas aspiraciones en la vida entre las principales esta el ser un profesional  para poder ayudar a su familia, su madre ha sido su apoyo económico y moral, para   Rodolfo ayudar en los gastos del hogar es muy importante por lo que con los trabajos que realiza como edecán por eventos brinda su granito de arena, por el momento no tiene un empleo fijo  espera una vez culminando sus estudios encontrar la oportunidad de trabajo, solicita el apoyo de crédito para poder pagar el curso de titulación y postgrado de la carrera de Diplomacia y Relaciones Internacionales.
texts.en: Rodolfo is a young man with many aspirations in life. One of the main ones is to become a professional in order to help his family. His mother has been his economic and moral support so for Rodolfo it is very important to help with the household expenses. The work that he undertakes as an assistant at events helps add his small contribution. At the moment he does not have any fixed employment. He is hoping to find employment once he has completed his studies. He is requesting the help of a loan to be able to pay his university tuition for his postgraduate studies in Diplomacy and International Relations.

loans.use: to pay for university courses.

loans.name: Farida

texts.en:
Farida is a married mother of two children, both of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and household consumables.  For over six years, Farida has operated an open air food selling business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of business. 

With the 10,000 KES, she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat. She decided to join Yehu to access loans in order to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat.

loans.name: Julius

texts.en:
Julius, 38, is a dairy farmer in Kisumu and has been in this business for the past three years. He is married to Wilkista, who sells fish. Together, they have been been blessed with four children.

Julius will use this loan to buy dairy meal for his dairy cattle. He will also buy medicine for his cattle. These investments will enable him to get more milk produce as well as more income, which he will use to buy another cow.

This is his first loan from VisionFund Kenya and, in future, he hopes to improve his farming business and be successful.

loans.use: To buy dairy meal and medicines.

loans.name: Guadalupe Del Carmen

texts.es: Guadalupe de 47 años de edad es madre soltera y habita en vivienda propia junto a su hijo y tres sobrinos. Ella es una mujer que ha logrado salir adelante al lado de su hijo gracias al esfuerzo que pone en su trabajo de elaboración de prendas de vestir, además cuida de sus sobrinos ya que los padres de ellos emigraron al extranjero para tratar de darles una mejor calidad de vida. Guadalupe desea reparar el techo de su vivienda, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para comprar: duralita y pines para cambiar el techo de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Guadalupe is 47 years old. She is a single mother and lives in her own house with her son and three nieces and nephews. She is a woman who has managed to support herself along with her son, thanks to the effort that she puts into her work sewing garments. In addition, she takes care of her nieces and nephews because their parents emigrated to another country to give them a better quality of life. 

Guadalupe would like to repair the roof of her residence, so she is requesting a loan from FUSAI to buy Duralita [reinforced corrugated concrete roofing sheets] and fasteners to replace the roof of her house.

loans.use: to buy Duralita [reinforced corrugated concrete roofing sheets] and fasteners to replace the roof of her house

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more chicks for her farm.

loans.name: Amelia

texts.en:
This is Amelia, aged 59, a resident of Manila in the Philippines. She is single and she works hard to provide for her everyday expenses. She manages her own household while operating the business.

Amelia operates a peanut butter making business. She buys raw peanuts and other ingredients needed to make her product, processes it, repacks it, and then sells them per piece to individuals, general store owners, and the local community. Peanut butter is packed in 250 and 500 gram plastic bottles. Aside from peanut butter, she also makes and sells Yema (a Filipino dish mainly made with condensed milk and egg yolk) for additional income. She earns a minimum of 500 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a 15,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy additional stocks of raw ingredients used in her business. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. Amelia hopes to have a growing network of customers and also dreams of success both in life and business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for raw materials needed in her business.

loans.name: Victor Leonel

texts.es:
Los deseos de superación marcan la actitud de Víctor, un hombre de 37 años, quien migró hace muchos años a Costa Rica en busca de una mejor vida. Sin embargo, tuvo que regresar al país hace más de diez años para alejarse de la discriminación que sufría. Cabe destacar, que la experiencia no solo trajo resultados negativos al contrario, lo ayudó a valerse por sí mismo y lo empujó a emprender en su propia pulpería para salir adelante junto con sus tres hijos como padre soltero. Ahora, este bachiller y comerciante, ya tiene diez años de arduo trabajo con un negocio propio.
Víctor se siente muy orgulloso de su pulpería, ya que ha crecido enormemente, a pesar de ser su única fuente de ingresos, pues cuenta con el apoyo de sus hijos. Él sueña con ver su negocio más grande y con un mayor número de clientes, por esta razón quiere seguir invirtiendo, solicitando un préstamo para la compra de jabones, arroz, frijoles, atún, detergente, gas, entre otros productos, que le permitirán generar más ingresos en la venta. Su meta es ampliar el local de su pulpería y seguir mejorando su hogar.
texts.en:
The attitude of Victor, a 37 year-old man, is shaped by his desire to succeed.  Some years ago, he migrated to Costa Rica seeking a better life. However, he had to return to his country more than 10 years ago to get away from the discrimination he suffered.  It should be noted that this experience was not entirely negative.  In fact, it helped him to fend for himself and led to him to start up his own grocery store business in order to get ahead with his 3 children, as he is a single father.  

Now Victor is a high school graduate and a merchant.  He already has 10 years of hard work invested in his business.  Victor is very proud of his business because it has grown a lot, even though it is his only source of income.  His children support him with the business. 

Victor dreams of having a bigger business with more customers.  This is why he wants to continue to invest in it.  He is requesting a loan to buy soap, rice, beans, tuna, detergent, propane gas, and other products.  This will enable him to generate more income from his sales.  His goal is to expand his grocery store and continue to make improvements to his house.

loans.use: to buy soap, rice, beans, tuna, detergent, propane gas, and other products for his store

loans.name: Sokly

texts.en:
Sokly is a 34-year-old married woman. She has three dependent children who are currently in school. She lives in a small village in Pursat Province, Cambodia. To make a living and support her family, she manages and operates a farming business, growing rice and selling the crops to local dealers. She has been in this career for 10 years.

Sokly wants to improve the general living conditions of her entire family by having a latrine, because there is no latrine in her house now. Therefore, she is borrowing a loan through Kiva to build a latrine. By doing so, she can help her family members gain access to sanitation, promote their health, and help to lessen environmental deterioration. 

She is thankful for this loan, granted through Hattha Kaksekar Limited at a much lower interest rate than other general loans.

loans.use: to build a latrine.

loans.name: Richard

texts.es:
Richard es soltero y vive en casa de su madre en la ciudad de La Paz. Trabaja como transporista público por mas de 10 horas al día.

Richard requiere el crédito para hacer arreglos en su vehiculo, pues su taxi necesita llantas nuevas y hay que cambiar el tapiz de los asientos entre otras cosas. También hará un mantenimiento general del vehículo. Richard es la unica fuente de ingresos en el hogar por lo que necesita su ayuda
texts.en:
Richard is single and lives in his mother's house in the city of La Paz. He works in public transportation for more than 10 hours each day.

Richard needs a loan to fix his vehicle. His taxi needs new tires and he has to recover the seats, amongst other things. He will also do a general maintenance of his taxi. Richard is the only source of income in his household so he needs your support.

loans.use: to buy new tires and recover the seats of his taxi. He also needs to do general maintenance on his taxi.

loans.name: Hernan

texts.es: El señor Hernán es una persona humilde y sencilla, es mayor de edad, de estado civil soltero, pero vive en concubinato, por diversas circunstancias de la vida solo llegó a  estudiar el nivel primario, viven en su casa propia junto a sus dos hijos pequeños en la provincia de Tiraque, se dedica a la agricultura, su principal actividad económica es la producción y venta de papa. Es una persona responsable y trabajadora, para ampliar y mejorar su producción se ve en la necesidad de solicitar un crédito para la compra de insumos agrícolas que necesita para sus cultivos, como semilla de papa para aumentar  su producción y a la vez sus ingresos económicos que vayan a contribuir y mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en: Hernan is a humble and unassuming person.  His is a single adult, but he lives with a partner.  For a variety of reasons, he was only able to attend elementary school.  He lives in his own house with his two small children in  Tiraque province. He is a farmer, and his main business is growing and selling potatoes.  He is a responsible and hardworking person who, in order to expand and improve his production, saw the need to apply for a loan so that he could buy agricultural supplies for his crops, such as potato seeds to expand his production.  This way, he can increase his earnings and improve his living conditions.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies

loans.name: Vicent

texts.en:
Vicent, a new client, resides in a town in Ntungamo District. His major activity is in the sale of spare parts for motorcycles. 

The busines has been  profitable because of the many motorcycles used for business in the trading centers. Vicent is, however, challenged by limited capital and is therefore applying for a loan. He will use the loan to buy a variety of spare parts in bulk to be able to meet his customers' needs. 

His prime goal is to yield a high income from his shop. But he is limited by capital and funds to achieve his dream of owning a wholesale shop that sells spare parts. 

With this loan, he believes his production will improve and his income will increase. He thanks UGAFODE Microfinance for this financial support.

loans.use: To buy a variety of spare parts in bulk.

loans.name: Becham Group

texts.en:
Dickson, who is in his early forties, is married with three children who are still at school. He has been running a grocery store for three years now. He works from 6:00 a.m. to 11:00 p.m. daily and is able to make a small monthly profit. 

This will be Dickson 's fifth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loans for building his store and kept on increasing drinks in the grocery store. He has paid back all his loans successfully. He used the profit to pay school fees and cover household expenses.  

He will use this loan to buy drinks such as beer, wine, whiskey, sodas, juice, and water. He dreams of building his own house. He is happy with the loan and appreciates whomever has supported him and his group to get a loan, and can now support his family. 

Dickson will share this loan with his loan group "Becham", which consists of three members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy drinks such as beer, wine, whiskey, sodas, juice, and water.

loans.name: Bahtiyor

texts.ru: Бахтиёр молодой и энергичный человек. Он успешно окончил среднюю школу и поступил в университет. Теперь он студент 1 курса Национального Университета Таджикистана. Он учится в факультете фармацевтики. Бахтиёр надеется на то, что и в университете тоже он будет успешным. В средней школе он учился успешно и любил математику, физику, химию и биологию. Для него очень интересно факультет, куда он поступил. Он хочет помочь больным людям в будущем. Он запрашивает займ для оплаты учебного договора первого курса. Он ждет вашу доброту и нуждается вашей поддержке.
texts.en: Bahtiyor is an energetic young man who has successfully finished secondary school and started attending college.  He's a freshman at Tajik State National University majoring in Pharmaceutical Studies, and enjoys his coursework very much.  He was a good student growing up, and always loved learning about math, physics, chemistry and biology.  He hopes he'll continue to do well at college, and be able to eventually work in healthcare and devote himself to helping sick people in need.  Bahtiyor is seeking a loan to pay tuition for his first year at college.  He needs your help, and is counting on your kindness.

loans.use: pay tuition for his first year at college

loans.name: Jacqueline

texts.es:
