En Mejía localizada a unos pocos kilómetros de la ciudad de Portoviejo ciudad de gente dedicada en gran parte a la agricultura y al cultivo y venta de cocos se reúnen cada quince días el Grupo De crédito Mejía.
En este lugar vive la señora Jacqueline, tiene 49 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen cuatro hijos mayores de edad, la menor vive con ella. Su esposo no trabaja por motivos de salud.
Doña Jacqueline es una gran mujer que le ha tocado trabajar para sacar adelante a su familia y esto mucho mas después de la enfermedad de su marido, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, sale a recorrer por toda la localidad ofreciendo sus productos, deja a crédito y cobra cada ocho días, gracias a sus ganancias salen adelante ya que ella es la única fuente de ingresos en su hogar, ya son 10 años con su negocio el cual lo financia gracias a los créditos.
Este crédito es para comprar ropa de todo tipo. Lleva dos años en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por la ayuda que le brindan los créditos. Sus sueños son salir adelante y que su marido se recupere.
texts.en:
Every fifteen days, the Mejía Credit Group meets in Mejía, located a few kilometers from the city of Portoviejo, a city of people who work mainly in farming and growing and selling coconuts.

Señora Jacqueline lives in this place. She is 49 years old and married; from this relationship, she has four adult children. The youngest lives with her. Her husband does not work for health reasons. 

Jacqueline is a wonderful woman who has had to work to take care of her family, and even more so because of her husband's illness. She works selling all kinds of clothing, going out throughout the whole town offering her products for sale. She leaves clothing on credit and collects every eight days. They get by thanks to her earnings, which are the only source of income in the household. She has had her business for ten years, and she finances it with loans.

This loan is to buy all kinds of clothing. She has been in the Credit Group for two years, and she likes it because of help she gets from the loans. Her dream is to get ahead, and for her husband to recover.

loans.use: to buy clothing

loans.name: Justa

texts.es: Justa es una viuda de 77 años y 6 hijos Juta vive sola en una casa de ladrillo y cemento donde paga un alquiler Justa vive en La Paz y esta jubilada Justa necesita un credito para un tratamiento medico, sufre de constante dolor y quiere mitigarlo Justa se vale por si misma pero quiere para esta ocasion la ayuda de Kiva ya que sus hijos tienen sus propios gastos
texts.en:
Justa is a widow of 77 years of age with six children. She lives alone in a rented house made of brick and mortar. She is retired, and lives in La Paz.

Justa needs a loan for medical treatment, she suffers from constant pain that she wants to alleviate. She is self-reliant but on this occasion she is requesting help from Kiva because her children have their own expenses.

loans.use: to seek medical treatment.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase different kinds of clothes and accessories to sell to the people in the streets.

loans.name: Vicenta Mariana

texts.es:
En Mejía localizada a unos pocos kilómetros de la ciudad de Portoviejo ciudad de gente dedicada en gran parte a la agricultura y al cultivo y venta de cocos se reúnen cada quince días el Grupo De crédito Mejía.
En este lugar vive la señora Vicenta, tiene 34 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre y de esta relación tienen 4 hijos de 17, 15, 13 años y el menor de apenas  6 meses de edad, los tres  mayores estudian en colegio. Su esposo es comerciante.
Doña Vicenta es una gran mujer que para ganar sus propios ingresos se dedica a la venta de hamburguesas, tostadas, y otras comidas rápidas, además de jugos y batidos de fruta, ella tiene un local en su casa en la cual los días de viernes a domingos  vende sus productos, en estos días son muchas las personas que llegan hasta su local. Lleva más de 3 años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien, con eso se gana lo suyo que lo invierte en la educación de sus hijos que para ella es lo más importante.
Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar pan, salchichas, carne, frutas y otros víveres para las comidas rápidas. Lleva dos años en el Grupo De crédito y le gusta por la ayuda que le brindan con los créditos. Sus sueños son darles lo mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Every fifteen days, the Mejía Credit Group meets in Mejía, located a few kilometers from the city of Portoviejo, a city of people who work mainly in farming and growing and selling coconuts.

Vicenta lives in this place. She is 34 years old and lives in a common-law marriage; they have four children from this relationship. The older children are 17, 15, and 13 years old and are in school; the youngest is barely six months old. Her husband is a merchant.

Vicenta is a wonderful woman who, to earn her own income, works selling hamburgers, tostadas, and other quick meals, along with juices and blended fruit drinks. She has a shop in her house where she sells her products from Friday to Sunday. On those days, there are many people who come to her shop. She has worked in this activity for more than three years and it is going very well for her. With her business, she earns her own money, which she invests in the education of her children, which to her is the most important thing.

She is going to use this loan to buy bread, sausages, meat, fruit, and other groceries for the quick meals. She has been in the Credit Group for two years and she likes it because of the help she gets from the loans. Her dream is to give her children the best.

loans.use: to buy bread, sausages, meat, fruit, and other groceries

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en: Patricia is a hard-working woman who tries her best to make both ends meet. Her previous loan helped her to renovate her house. In addition, she runs a business selling cereals. It is because of this that she is requesting for a loan of 50,000 KES to buy maize, beans, wheat and rice for selling to supplement her income.

loans.use: to buy maize, beans, wheat and rice for selling to supplement her income.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
This is Jocelyn, 48, a resident of Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Hernane, a driver, and the mother of five children. She, together with her husband, manages their own household while operating their business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Jocelyn operates a rug-making business. She mainly offers rugs, from those round, palm-sized ones to the much-larger doormats, braided quilts and bed sheets, and other crafts that most rug-makers come up every day. As rugs are a major part of Filipino housekeeping and cleaning, rugs are one of the most common products that can be bought, sometimes even from a peddler while you are riding in a speeding jeepney down the highway. Jocelyn also earns additional income from a charcoal business. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 600 PHP in sales every day.

To help her continue the operations of her business, she is requesting a 12,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities of raw materials like fabric, thread and other materials for her business. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.

Jocelyn dreams of being able to give all her children a good and high quality of education through all her hard work on her business. She has hopes of becoming a successful businesswoman someday. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week, and this is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for the raw materials needed in her rug-making business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stock of tea leaves.

loans.name: Asaph

texts.en:
Asaph, a married man with five children, is a repeat customer at UGAFODE, and depends entirely on agriculture to earn a living and for the livelihood of his family. From crops, animal husbandry and banana growing, he feeds the family and sells the surplus to get income. He also rears goats that appreciate in value, as well as when others give birth. 

He is currently planting tomatoes whose demand is high, and when he harvests this season, he is assured of a high income. He will get enough income to provide for his family. He thanks UGAFODE (UGAFODE Microfinance Limited) for helping the unbanked and marginalized to be served. In the photograph is Asaph at his farm.

loans.use: to buy dry grass for mulching the tomato garden.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a quality dairy cow

loans.name: Linet

texts.en:
Linet appreciates the help of the previous loan. She has operated a firewood selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces stiff competition from other firewood operators in her business.
 
With the KES 40,000 Linet wants to purchase bundles of firewood for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of firewood for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more computers

loans.name: Marta Azusena

texts.es:
Marta de 31 años de edad, esta casada y son padres de dos hijos de diez y seis años. Marta logro culminar sus estudios hasta cuarto grado, ya que proviene de una familia de escasos recursos económicos. Ella trabaja en un proyecto en su comunidad en la cual genera un pequeño pago a la semana. Ademas de eso, posee una pequeña tienda que se la administra una familiar, su esposo es agricultor y todas las mañanas ellos se encaminan a sus labores diarias, caminan aproximadamente un kilómetro.

El préstamo lo utilizaran para comprar mariscos y salir a vender a las afueras de su comunidad; trabajo que quiere emprender su esposo, ademas compraran diferentes productos para su tienda y invertir en algunos lácteos tales como: queso y crema.

Ella piensa generar ganancias que le permitan tener una mejor calidad de vida y mejorar la estructura de su humilde casa, de igual manera brindarle los estudios necesarios a sus pequeños hijos.
texts.en:
Marta is 31 years old and married with two children, 10 and 6 years old. She was able to complete school through fourth grade coming from a family of scarce financial resources. 

She works with a project in her community from which she generates a small weekly payment. Additionally she has a small store managed by a family member. Her husband works in agriculture. Every morning they all walk to their daily tasks, approximately a kilometer away. 

They will use the loan to buy seafood for selling on the outskirts of their community, a task which her husband wants to carry out. They will also buy a variety of items for the store and will invest in some dairy products, such as cheese and cream. 

She anticipates profit that will allow her to have a better quality of life and improve her humble home's structure, as well as to provide for her small children's schooling.

loans.use: to buy seafood as well as different items for her store and invest in some dairy products such as cheese and cream.

loans.name: Han

texts.en:
Han, 46 years old, is an active rice farmer in a small community in Svay Rieng Province. He has two unmarried children. To make a living and support his family, he manages and operates rice farmland, which is located near his house. So far, it has been more than thirty years for him being a farmer. 

Han wants to have household energy at a reduced monthly cost by purchasing a solar energy home system. Because there is inadequate money, he has requested a Kiva loan through partner HKL. After this initial investment, he hopes to have clean energy to power her household lights, TV, and radio. 

He is very happy and thankful because with this loan, HKL has provided him a special interest rate lower than its general loan rates. He awaits your kindness and relies on your generosity.

loans.use: to buy a solar energy home system.

loans.name: Jose Eduardo

texts.es: A sus 46 años de edad Eduardo tiene una hija de 2 años, Eduardo vive en la casa de un amigo,  se dedica a trabajar de chofer y como vive en el campo también cría pollos, comenta que le va bien es este negocio ya que les cuida adecuadamente,  el cerdito lo necesita para comprar pollos para criarlos en un pequeño lote  de terreno para mejorar sus ingresos y comenta que seguirá trabajando duro y en algún momento comprarse  una casas para mejorar la calidad de vida de su hija.
texts.en:
At 46, Eduardo has a two-year-old daughter. He lives in the home of a friend, works as a driver, and since he lives in the countryside he also raises chickens. He says this business is going well since he takes proper care of the chickens. 

He needs the loan to buy chickens to raise in a small plot of land, in order to improve his income. He will continue to work hard, he tells, and at some point buy a home to improve the quality of life of her daughter.

loans.use: to buy chickens.

loans.name: Eugenia

texts.es:
Eugenia tiene 61 años de edad, es viuda, no cuenta con ningun hijo en su poder pero cuenta con una hija de 44 años de edad que la acompaña en su hogar, Eugenia vive en casa propia de material rustico, es natural de la zona, cuenta con buenas referencias personales y laborales. Eugenia vive en la parte rural del distrito de Pucará, provincia de Jaén, región Cajamarca, sierra norte de Perú.

La actividad que realiza Eugenia es la venta de productos de bodega las ventas las realiza en su propio domicilio, cuenta con negocio propio por un lapso de 5 años de experiencia en este rubro, ademas se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza. El destino del crédito sera para ivertir en su negocio surtiendo con nuevos productos, con ello le generara mayores ingresos y así poder mejorar sus ganancias y por ende su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Eugenia is 61 years old and is a widow. She does not have a son but she does have a daughter who is 44 years old and lives with her. Eugenia lives in her own home built out of rustic materials. She is a native of this zone and has good personal and business references. Eugenia lives in the rural part of the district of Pucará in the Jaén province in the Cajamarca region of the northern mountains of Perú.

Eugenia's business is a bodega and she runs this business out of her home. She has her own business thanks to five years of experience in this trade. She also sells beauty products. 

The loan will be used to invest in her business, which she will stock with new products and thereby generate greater revenue. This will increase her earnings which will improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy stock for her store.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is a 29-year-old woman married to Joseph, who adds additional income to support the welfare of their family. They are blessed with three children.  Esher has been operating a grocery shop for a period of five years, earning an income of 10,000 KES (Kenyan shillings) at the end of every month.

Esther was introduced to VisionFund Kenya by a neighbor and is now servicing her first loan of 60,000 KES. She intends to use this amount to buy cabbages, potatoes, carrots, green vegetables and fruits to sell to her customers on a daily basis.

Esther plans to use the anticipated income to pay school fees for her children and hopes to improve the living standard of her family and enlarge her business.

loans.use: To buy cabbages, potatoes, carrots, onions, green vegetables and fruits.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is a married woman with two children, both of whom attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past five years, she has operated a water selling business. She sells at the market and from her home to her neighbours and passersby.  

With the loan of 10,000 KES, she wants to purchase gallons for storing fresh water for sale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase gallons for storing fresh water for sale.

loans.name: Mwanakombo

texts.en:
Mwanakombo is a married woman with four children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past five years, she has operated a soft drink fruit juice selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces the challenges of seasonality, the high cost of transporting raw materials from the market to her place of operation and limited capital too. 

With the 50,000 KSH she wants to purchase sacks of fruits, mangoes, and passion fruits for making fruit juice for sale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of fruits, mangoes, and passion fruits for making fruit juice for sale.

loans.name: Bibi

texts.en:
Bibi has operated a cereal shop business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. Her potential customers are neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. Bibi dreams of establishing a wholesale cereal shop business in the future. 

Here again, she comes to you requesting a loan of 20,000 KES. She wants to purchase stock of wheat, maize, beans and rice for sale. 

She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business and she appreciates the support of the previous loan.

loans.use: to purchase stocks of wheat, maize, beans and rice for sale.

loans.name: Frida

texts.en:
Frida lives in NOr Kesaria village in the Armavir region. Her husband is a migrant worker and their only daughter is married and lives separately with her family. 

Frida runs a farm. The farm includes livestock (4 cows, calves and one sow) as well as hectares of land where wheat, onions and sunflowers are grown. Raising crops takes a lot of strength and requires physical work which is hard for one woman, but Frida is a hard working woman with a dream of building a sustainable and profitable farm. 

She has applied for this loan of 2,500 USD to be able to purchase 3 cows and forage for feeding the livestock. She hopes for lenders' support and their goodwill.

loans.use: to pay for 3 cows and forage for feeding the livestock.

loans.name: Joshua

texts.en:
Hello! Dairy business is an important source of income to small-scale farmers in Kenya. Juhudi Kilimo is partnering with Kiva to provide financial and technical solutions to poor farmers such as Joshua, a father of five children in the Kisii area of Kenya. Joshua has been a mixed farmer for the past six years, and his primary sources of income have been milk, eggs and food crops. 

The Kisii region area has a cool climate, but sometimes experiences long dry spells, and this accounts for major crop failure leading to starvation. Joshua is seeking a loan to purchase a high quality dairy cow. Easy availability of feed and fodder all year round makes dairy farming an ideal choice of investment in this region.

Through the loan Joshua will be able to fully satisfy the demand of milk that is in his village and through increased income, he will be able to improve his living conditions.

This loan will be very important because it will not only improve Joshua’s life, but also he will be able to get manure, which will be used on his farm and improve productivity.

Through Juhudi Kilimo, Joshua has been trained on how to save money, and he plans to use the extra income to increase his business and is planning to buy another dairy cow. All that Joshua waits for is your kindness.

loans.use: To buy a quality dairy cow

loans.name: Oscar

texts.en:
Oscar is 58 years old, married, and has children. As a way of generating income, he has engaged in variety store business within his community in Manila, Philippines for years now. He, together with his wife, works hard to provide for the everyday needs of their family.

In the Philippines, a variety store is a retail store that sells inexpensive items, often with a single price for all items in the store. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, 5 PHP worth of cooking oil, or an egg. He earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by piece. He also has stocks of soft drinks and other beverages, which is shown in the picture. His regular customers are his neighbours and the local community. He earns a minimum of 800 PHP in sales every day.

Due to financial insufficiency, Oscar wants to make his business more profitable in order to earn a higher income. For this reason, he would like to secure a loan amounting to 17,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) to buy additional grocery items that are needed. He is hoping that he will further improve the business through this financial assistance.

Oscar hopes for his business to prosper and he dreams to give his family a better future. He meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his life and business every week and where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God he studies.

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed in his business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more clothes for her store to resell.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is a single man. He describes himself as determined and focused. He operates a retail business where he sells fruits and vegetables. His business is located in a fast-growing area. He describes his biggest business challenge as lack of capital. 

He will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy more stocks of fruits and vegetables. He hopes that in the future he can buy land and a car.

loans.use: buy more stock of fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Paular

texts.en:
Her name is Paular, 54 and a resident of Manila, Philippines, who is widowed. She takes care of her grandchildren, and her earnings from her fruit stand business helps her a lot to meet her family's daily basic, personal and household needs. 
 
Paular operates a fruit stand. She buys seasonal fruits that are native to the Philippines like bananas, which are grown mostly in the south region of Luzon. She also sells other Filipino fruit staples. Aside from this, she also sells groceries. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 1,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a 24,000 PHP loan, which she will use to buy more quantities of fruit to expand her product inventory. She is positive that the financial assistance will boost her business sales and income. 
 
Paular aims to grow her business in the coming years. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week, and this is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To purchase fruits for resale.

loans.name: Zena

texts.en:
Zena is a married mother of four children who attend school. She lives at a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

For the past three years, she has operated a clothes and shoes selling business, selling at the market to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of stiff competition in her business. She dreams of expanding and establishing a boutique business in the future. 

With the loan that she is requesting of 50,000 Kenyan shillings, she wants to purchase bales of clothes and shoes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes and shoes for resale.

loans.name: Rodrigo

texts.es: Rodrigo es soltero, tiene 24 años y no tiene hijos Rodrigo vive con sus padres en La Paz en una casa de ladrillo y cemento que le pertenece a su familia Rodrigo se gana la vida como guia turistico pero tambien esta estudiando música en la escuela de artes y requiere el dinero para pagar pensiones y comprar material educativo Rodrigo recibe ayuda de sus padres pero no es suficiente, por eso necesita su ayuda
texts.en:
Rodrigo is single, 24 years old, and does not have children. He lives with his parents in La Paz in a brick and cement house that belongs to his family.

Rodrigo makes a living as a tourist guide, but he is also studying music in the school of arts. He needs money to pay school fees and buy educational materials. Rodrigo receives help from his parents, but it isn't enough, so he needs Kiva lenders' help.

loans.use: to pay school fees and buy school materials

loans.name: Franklin Fernando

texts.es: Fernando es un joven muy responsable sobre todo en las cuotas de sus crédito, en la actualidad trabaja de chofer pero solo cuando el dueño del carro le llama y el resto de días se dedica al jornal y a la crianza de animales menores, es un año que empezó con la crianza de chanchos o hizo con el primer crédito que le otorgo Fodemi, el dinero del crédito lo va a utilizar en la compra de chanchos para tenerlos en una cuadrita que le presta su madre, lo que Fernando aspira es mejora su negocio.
texts.en:
Fernando is a very responsible young man, especially when it comes to his loan payments.

Currently, he works as a chauffeur--but only when the car's owner calls him--and the rest of the time, he works as a day laborer and raises small animals.

It has been a year since he started raising pigs, and he took out his first loan with Fodemi. He will use the money from the loan to purchase pigs, which he will keep on a bit of land that his mother is lending him. Fernando dreams of improving his business.

loans.use: to purchase pigs

loans.name: Polly

texts.en: Polly is an old borrower and an agriculturalist who depends on agriculture and tree planting to get income for the survival of his young family. He also runs a retail shop to supplement the stretched income. There is demand for trees, but the challenge is the limited land on which the trees stand, so he wants to expand the area on which he grows the trees. Therefore he will buy seedlings so that he can harvest more trees and attract more buyers. He is a married man with five children. He is hardworking and thanks UGAFODE for supporting young entrepreneurs.

loans.use: To buy tree seedlings

loans.name: Yesenia De Los Angeles

texts.es: Yesenia  tiene 35 años de edad,  es madre soltera y vive solamente con sus 2 hijos que asisten a la escuela, Yesenia se dedica a la crianza de chanchos desde que era muy joven ya que su madre le enseño como se da un correcto cuidado  a estos animales para que dejen algo de ganancia, Yesenia agradece a  Fodemi por ayudarle a crecer junto a su negocio, este crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de chanchos, Yesenia  aspira seguir adelante con la crianza de sus animales menores para de esta manera apoyarse en los gastos de educación, alimentación, vestido  y salud de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Yesenia is 35 years old. She is a single mother and lives with only her 2 children, who attend school.

Yesenia has raised pigs for a living since she was very young. Her mother taught her how to care for them properly so that they turn a little profit.

Yesenia is grateful to Fodemi for helping her and her business grow. She will invest this loan in the purchase of pigs.

Yesenia dreams of succeeding in her small animal business, so that she can cover the educational, food, clothing, and health costs of her children.

loans.use: to purchase pigs

loans.name: Cesar

texts.es:
Cesar tiene 51 años de edad, vive con su conyuge y sus dos hijos, dedicado a las labores agricolas cultivando café asi como cultivos de Pan llevar. Cesar vive en la parte rural del distrito de Cañaris, provincia de Ferreñafe, región Lambayeque, costa norte de Perú.

Cesar se dedica al cultivo de café, hace 15 años, él necesita préstamo para comprar abonos para su cultivo y para el mantenimiento de su finca, ya que manteniendo sus fincas obtendrá mayores rendimientos, lo que le generá mayores ingresos, mejores ganancias y por ende mejorará también su caldiad de vida.
texts.en:
Cesar is 51 years old. He lives with his spouse and their two children. He makes a living in agriculture--specifically, in growing coffee (as well as other food crops). Cesar lives in a rural part of the Canaris district in the province of Ferrenafe. It's located in the Lambayeque region on the northern coast of Peru.

Cesar has made a living growing coffee for 15 years. He needs the loan in order to buy fertilizers for his crops, and to maintenance his farm. If he can do so, he will get higher yields and generate more revenue, which leads to higher profits and increases his ability to better his quality of life.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for his crops and to maintenance his farm.

loans.name: Maria Belen

texts.es: Belen es una señora de 41 años, ella es madre soltera, tiene 3 hijos de 22, 25 y 19 años de edad, de los cuales solo el menor está estudiando,  son 9 años que Belen se dedica a su negocio de tienda que es el sustento de ella y sus hijos,  el crédito lo va a utilizar comprando productos de tienda para mejorar y variar mas sus productos, lo que Belen aspira es que su negocio mejore y así  dar la educación a  su hijo.
texts.en:
Belen is a 41-year-old woman. She is a single mother and has 3 children who are 22, 25, and 19 years old. Only the youngest is in school.

For 9 years, Belen has worked in her store, which is the source of income for her and her children.

She will use the loan to purchase products for her store to improve her merchandise and have greater variety. Belen hopes that her business will improve, allowing for her son's education.

loans.use: to purchase products for her store

loans.name: José Marcelino

texts.es:
José tiene 36 años de edad, logró estudiar hasta 6°grado de educación básica, no pudo culminar sus estudios por motivos de escasos recursos económicos, está acompañado pero su pareja viajó hace 8 meses al extranjero en busca de un mejor futuro ya que no pudo encontrar un buen trabajo en su país, tiene 4 hijos que se encuentran estudiando.

José  tiene 22 años de experiencia trabajando en la agricultura, actividad que aprendió gracias a sus padres que se lo enseñaron desde pequeño, dicho trabajo ha sido su medio de supervivencia y con el cual brinda las necesidades básicas a sus hijos.

El presente crédito lo necesita para comprar insumos agrícolas para aplicar a su milpa, ya que le primera siembra no le dio buenos resultados debido al mal clima. 

Él sueña con tener una buena cosecha que le permita suplir las necesidades alimenticias de su hogar, también le gustaría vender una parte de su cosecha, y apoyar a sus hijos en los estudios.
texts.en:
Jose is 36 years old. He studied until 6th grade in primary school, but he was not able to finish his studies due to his scarce economic resources. He is married, but his partner left to go abroad 8 months ago in search of a better future because she was unable to find a good job in their country. He has 4 children that are currently studying.

Jose has 22 years of experience working in agrictulture, an activity he was able to learn thanks to his parents, who taught him from a young age. This work has been his means of survival, and with it he is able to bring the basic necessities to his children.

He needs a loan in order to buy supplies to plant in his cornfield. His first harvest did not have great results due to bad weather.

His dream, along with having a better harvest, is to be able to supply all the dietary needs of his home. He would also like to buy some of his harvest, and support his children in their studies.

loans.use: to buy supplies to plant his cornfield.

loans.name: Mayra Lady

texts.es: A sus 26 años de edad Mayra está casada y tiene 2 hijas de 4 y 6 años mismas que asisten a la escuela, Mayra juntamente con su esposo  viven en una casa que les presta un familiar y  trabajan en una fábrica de flores, Ella también se dedica a la crianza de gallinas  para ayudarse en los gastos de su hogar,  por este motivo el crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de pollitas para venderlas cuando ya sean gallinas, lo que esta señora aspira es mejorar su negocio y por medio de este  más adelante comprarse una casa para tener una vida más tranquila juntamente con su familia y sobre todo que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Mayra is 26 years old, and is married with two children aged 4 and 6 who are currently in school. Mayra, together with her spouse, lives in a home that was given to them by family. They work in a flower factory, but she also makes her living raising hens in order to help cover the household expenses.

That is why she is currently asking for a loan--she is going to invest in purchasing chicks that she can sell when they become hens. She aspires to better her business, and be able to buy a home in order to have a more peaceful life with her family. Above all, she wants her children to become professional workers.

loans.use: to buy chickens

loans.name: Juan José

texts.es:
Juan de 41 años de edad, solamente logro a culminar sus estudios hasta el 4° grado, vive junto a su esposa y sus tres hijos ( 1 niña y 2 varones) la niña está estudiando 4°grado, los dos jovencitos no estudian debido a la situación económica de su familia. 

Juan tiene 14 años de ser mecánico, es el oficio que aprendió de joven y es con lo que hoy en día le da los ingresos para mantener a su familia.

El préstamo que esta soliictando a CREDICAMPO, es para comprar materia prima para su taller, entre ellos tenemos: Electrodos, hierro, estaño y tornillos. 

Juan un dia sueña ver su taller totalmente remodelado, con todas la herramientas necesarias para ejercer su trabajo, él lamenta que sus hijos no puedan seguir con sus estudios, pero su anhelo es que un día ellos puedan culminar o por lo menos terminar el bachillerato.
texts.en:
Juan is 41 years old. He was only able to study until 4th grade. He lives with his wife and their three children (1 girl and 2 boys). The girl is in 4th grade; the two little boys don't attend school due to the family's economic situation.

Juan has 14 years of experience as a mechanic. It is the trade he learned when he was young, and today it is how he makes money to maintain his family.

The loan he is requesting from Credicampo is to purchase raw materials for his workshop, such as electrodes, iron, tin, and screws

Juan dreams of one day seeing his workshop totally remodeled, with all the necessary tools of his trade. He regrets that his sons can't continue their schooling, and his great hope is that some day they will be able to finish their education or at least finish high school.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials for his workshop, such as electrodes, iron, tin, and screws

loans.name: Senaida Patricia

texts.es: Patricia es una señora de 40 años, es casada y tiene 5 hijos de 23, 22, 15, 13 y 10 años de edad  mismos que los 3 están estudiando, el esposo de Patricia se dedica a trabajar de chofer, ella tiene 3 años su negocio que es una tienda de los productos  de consumo masivo, el crédito que le va a otorgar Fodemi es para comprar mercadería para su tienda, lo que Patricia aspira es mejorar su  negocio, ofrecer más variedad de productos y para aumentar sus ventas  y por ende  mejora su economía para seguir dando el estudio a sus hijos hasta que lleguen a tener su título universitario.
texts.en:
Patricia is a 40 year old woman. She is married and has five children, aged 23, 22, 15, 13, and 10. 3 of them are currently studying. Patricia's spouse makes a living as a driver/chauffeur.

She has 3 years of experience at her business, which is a store that sells consumer goods. The loan that Fodemi is providing will be to buy merchandise for her store. Patricia aspires to better her business, to offer a greater variety of products, and to improve her sales in order to better her economic standing. She wants to be able to afford the continuation of her children's study until they obtain a university degree.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her shop.

loans.name: Divinite (1) Group

texts.en:
Flora is the mother of two young children in Brazzaville, the Republic of Congo. For over eight years, she has been supporting her family by hand-knitting and selling children’s clothing. In 2013, Flora learned about HOPE Congo and joined the community bank group Divinite (1). Leading a sub-group of 12 other micro-entrepreneurs in Brazzaville, Flora is currently on her fourth loan cycle. In order to expand her business, she would like to take out a loan of 300,000 CFA to purchase additional yarn in various colors.



In the future Flora dreams that she will be able to open her own small studio to work and sell in, bringing in enough money that she will be able put her children through good schools. She hopes that one day her children will also be able to learn her craft of making children’s clothing.

loans.use: to purchase additional yarn in various colors

loans.name: Edis De Jesús

texts.es:
Edis de 32 años de edad, por sus escasos recursos económicos solo estudió hasta 7°grado, luego de unos años se casó y su esposo se dedica al trabajo agrícola, tiene 3 hijos en este matrimonio de los cuales solo 1 estudia y los otros dos aún no. 

Edis tiene 12 años de experiencia en el comercio y lo aprendió gracias a sus tías que poseían una tienda, ahora le ha servido de mucho a Edis ya que actualmente tiene su propio negocio que le sirve para obtener ingresos y mantenerse.


Ella utilizará el crédito para comprar más productos como churros, gaseosas, arroz, azúcar y otros productos de la canasta básica y así tendrá surtida su tienda.

Su sueño es tener un  buen negocio establecido que le permita generar ingresos diariamente y así  satisfacer las necesidades de su hogar y para ayudarle a su hijo en el estudio.
texts.en:
Edis is 32 years old. Due to scarce economic resources, she was only able to study until grade 7. After a few years, she got married--her spouse makes a living in agriculture. She has 3 children from her current marriage, only one of which studies (the others do not).

Edis has 12 years of experience in sales, which she learned about thanks to her aunts who owned a store. This knowledge has served her well, because Edis now has her own business which serves to provide her income.

She will use the loan to buy more products, like churros, sodas, rice, sugar, and other basic household products in order to stock her store.

Her dream is to have a well established business that allows her to generate daily income and satisfy the needs of her household, as well as to help her child in his/her studies.

loans.use: to buy more products such as churros, sodas, rice, sugar, and other basic household products in order to stock her store.

loans.name: Jessica Estefania

texts.es: Estefanía tiene 22 años de edad, vive con sus padres y 4 hermanos que se encuentran estudiando,  ella se dedica a la venta de ropa ambulante o por catalogo desde que tenía 15 años, en la actualidad se encuentra en estado de embarazo y dice que justamente  en estos tiempos es cuando debe trabajar más para  esperar con lo necesario para su bebe, Estefania necesita el préstamo para comprar mercadería en ropa y tener más variedad de productos para mejorar sus ventas y mediante su negocio tener el dinero que le permita dar una buena alimentación a sus hijo.
texts.en:
Estefanía is 22 years old. She lives with her parents and her 4 siblings, who are all in school.

She has sold clothing as a traveling merchant or by catalog since she was 15 years old. Now, she is expecting, and she says that a time like this is the moment in which she must work even harder to prepare to provide for her baby.

Estefanía needs the loan to purchase clothing merchandise and to have a greater variety of products to improve her sales. Through her work, she can make the money that will allow her to feed her child well.

loans.use: to buy clothing

loans.name: Dúo Corazon De Jesus Group

texts.es:
DÚO CORAZON DE JESUS
Este dúo esta conformado por Evelyn es originaria de Sumpango, Sac  Evelyn se dedica a la venta de verduras en la terminal de Guatemala, todos los días tiene que madrugar para poder trasladarse en su puesto ya que la venta de verduras comienza desde las tres de  la madrugada, ellas necesita poder ampliar su local con venta de distintas verduras ya que no cuenta con el capital suficiente por lo que solicita a kiva un crédito y poder ampliar su puesto en donde vende, ella promete pagar puntualmente cada pago en cada fecha asignada para poder así tener la oportunidad de que kiva le de apoyo no solo en esta ocasión si no en muchas mas.
texts.en:
DÚO CORAZON DE JESUS [The Heart of Jesus Partnership]

One member of this partnership is Evelyn, a native of Sumpango, Sacatepequez.

Evelyn sells vegetables for a living in La Terminal [Guatemala City's main market]. Every day, she has to be up in the early hours in order to get to her post; vegetable sales start at 3 in the morning.

She needs to expand her business by selling different vegetables and enlarging her stall where she sells. She does not have enough capital, so she is requesting a Kiva loan.

She commits to punctually paying every installment on the specified date, so that she may have the opportunity to be supported by Kiva not only on this occasion but on many more.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables to sell

loans.name: Divinite (2) Group

texts.en:
Barthel is a member of the community bank group Divinite (2) in Brazzaville, Republic of Congo. He runs a small restaurant in Brazzaville to support himself and his family of four young children. In order to have a more stable income and better support his family, Barthel would like to take out his first loan with HOPE Congo of 200,000 CFA. With this small loan he will be able to purchase additional produce for his restaurant, such as eggs, avocados, carrots, lettuce and other ingredients for the salads he specializes in making.

With the change of seasons in Brazzaville, fresh produce can be difficult to come by and Barthel is forced to switch out his ingredients strategically to still offer his clients various options. He dreams of continuing to grow his business so that he will be able to bring up his children well. One day Barthel would also like to travel, returning to Brazzaville to sell goods that he’s purchased abroad. Barthel is the leader of a subgroup within Divinite (2) of 11 other micro-entrepreneurs in Brazzaville.

loans.use: to purchase additional produce for his restaurant

loans.name: Nataly Judith

texts.es:
Nataly Judith tiene 25 años,es conviviente, vive en casa propia junto a esposo e hijos de 04 y 05 años de edad. Vive en una comunidad dedicada al comercio, agricultura y ganaderia; ubicada en el distrito de Saña, provincia de Chiclayo, región de Lamabyeque, costa norte de Perú.

Nataly Judith se dedica a la venta de alimentos preparados y bebidas como chicha, cerveza y gaseosa. Ella solicita crédito para invertir en compra de esteras y moviliario para mejora de local de atención, así como cascos de cerveza para atender incremento de demanda de bebidas frías en local. Con ello tendrá una mejor atención a clientes y así podrá generar mayores ingresos, mejorar sus ganancias y por ende una mejora en calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Nataly Judith is 25 years old and lives in her own house along with her husband and children, who are 4 and 5.

She lives in a community dedicated to commerce, farming, and livestock. It is located in the district of Saña, Chiclayo province, Lamabyeque region, on the north coast of Peru.

Nataly Judith sells ready-made food and drinks, such as gum, beer, and soda.

She is requesting a loan to purchase floor mats and furniture to improve the service area, as well as bottles of beer to meet the increased local demand for cold drinks. With this, she will be able to offer better service to her customers and therefore improve sales, make more income, and consequently enjoy a higher quality of life.

loans.use: to refurbish the service area and purchase reserve supplies (bottles of beer)

loans.name: Anas

texts.en: Anas is a 19-year-old ambitious university student who is majoring in Industrial Design. He is in his first year. He lives with his family that consists of five members. His father is a retired man who currently works as a driver. Anas is planning to find a job in his field of study after he gets his Bachelors' so that he can start supporting his family financially. But he currently doesn't have enough money to pay for his upcoming semester fees. Because of that, he has applied for this loan.

loans.use: to pay for his upcoming semester fees.

loans.name: Saleh

texts.en:
Saleh is a 30-year-old married man and the father of only one child, living with his family in the house of his father in Sana'a, Yemen. He belongs to a humble family. Saleh has a university education. Now, he works as a teacher. In time, Saleh was able to accumulate a good amount of money from his salary and purchased a piece of land. He built his own house on that land that he purchased. That business cost him a lot of money. That money was not enough to complete all the building and renovation of the house. Unfortunately, Saleh doesn't have enough money to do that. As a result, he is requesting a youth loan of 200,000 YER from AMB. He will use the loan to purchase construction materials such as cement, bricks, and iron steel to build other rooms and to renovate all the house from the inside to make it more comfortable and suitable for life.

Saleh's dream in the future is building a second floor and renovating it.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials such as cement, bricks, and iron steel to build other rooms and to renovate all the house from the inside.

loans.name: Alexi Maricela

texts.es:
Alexi tiene como nivel académico 5° grado de educación básica, tiene 31 años de edad y está acompañada, su esposo se dedica a la agricultura,  tiene dos hijos y dependen de ella


Alexi se dedica a la crianza de cerdos, ya tiene 6 años de realizar esta actividad y la aprendió de su padre, además tiene el apoyo de su pareja pues ordeñan 2 vacas de la cual obtienen productos lácteos.

Ella necesita el crédito para comprar 3 cerdos pequeños y dos quintales de concentrado para alimentarlos, de esta forma ella tendrá una fuente de ingresos ya que venderá los cerdos cuando estén grandes.

Su sueño es darles mejores condiciones de vida a sus hijas, espera que su negocio funcione para obtener ganancias ya que también le gustaría mejorare su vivienda.
texts.en:
Alexi completed fifth grade of primary school. She is 31 years old and married. Her husband works as a farmer and they have two children who she takes care of. 

Alexi has spent the last six years raising pigs, a trade that she learnt from her father. She is supported by her partner and together they have bought two cows which provide them with dairy products.  

Alexi needs this loan to buy three little pigs and two quintals of pellets to feed them. This way she will have a source of income when the time comes to sell the pigs once they are grown.

Alexi's dream is to give her children the best living conditions. She hopes that this business will work so she can make a profit as she would also like to make some home improvements.

loans.use: to buy three little pigs and two quintals of pellets to feed them

loans.name: Luvuno

texts.en:
Luvuno appreciates the previous loan that helped her expand her business. She has operated a retail shop business for the past two years, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces the major challenge of seasonality in her business. 

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour.

loans.name: Kenneth

texts.en:
Kenneth is a single man who describes himself as focused. 

He operates a retail business where he sells fruits and vegetables, and he has been involved in this business for 2 years. His business is located in a fast-growing area. He describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of capital. 

He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stock of fruits and vegetables. He will use the anticipated profits to open another outlet. His business goal is to have a wholesale business within 5 years.

He hopes that in the future he will be able to buy some land.

loans.use: to buy more stock of fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Azniv

texts.en:
Azniv lives in Talin town with her husband and two school-age sons. Her husband is a constructor and also helps her with her farming business. Azniv keeps livestock (cows, sheep, piglets and hens), and also cultivates wheat.
 
Her husband sells the produce from their farm in the local market, and thus makes additional income to cover the family's living expenses. The requested loan of USD 600 is very important for this family to purchase forage to feed their livestock. 

Azniv hopes for lenders' goodwill and that she will be able to continue her farming business.

loans.use: to pay for forage to feed her livestock

loans.name: Salome

texts.en:
Salome is married and the mother of 3 children, who all attend school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water.

She sells fruits and green vegetables at the market to earn a living. She continues to struggle to improve her grocery stall, always trying to sell more and to save money in order to have a more formal establishment. 

Salome is requesting a loan to buy sacks of fruits and green vegetables for resale.

loans.use: to buy sacks of fruits and green vegetables for resale

loans.name: Benkan Group

texts.fr:
Benkan est un regroupement de femmes de Koutiala qui se connaissent bien et qui vivent dans de grandes familles traditionnelles avec leurs maris, enfants et autres parents. Elles ont en moyenne 39 ans et ont au moins 5enfants.
Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce d’articles divers tels que, d’Habillement, Produits cosmétiques, Assiettes  et divers. Pour augmenter la taille de leurs activités, les membres ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso. Elles sont à leur deuxième prêt de groupe.
Salimata est un membre du groupe Benkan, 2ème personne assise de droite à gauche, vendeuse des assiettes, Bol, Carafes. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter des qualités d’assiettes, bols, carafes qu’elle vend en détail  à une clientèle diverse. Elle se procure au grand marché. 
Tandis que les autres membres du groupe Benkan comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 165000CFA  chacune au  cours de ce cycle Mme Salimata compte réaliser  195 000FCFA.  
En plus du remboursement des prêts, elles utilisent une partie du revenu  pour faire face aux dépenses personnelles et augmenter son fonds de commerce. 
Elles souhaitent voir renforcer ce partenariat avec  Soro Yiriwaso pour que les stocks ne soient pas rares.
texts.en:
Benkan is a group of women in Koutiala who know each other well and live in large traditional families with their husbands, children, and other parents. They are, on average, 39 years old and have at least five children. This group of women work in commerce selling various goods, such as clothing, cosmetics, plates, etc.

To increase their business, the members decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso's loan program. They are on their second group loan. 

Salimata is a member of the Benkan group and is seated second from the right [in the photo]. She sells plates, bowls, and carafes. She plans to use her loan to buy quality plates, bowls and carafes which she will sell at retail to a group of diverse customers. She procures her goods from a large market.

While the other group members hope to earn an average profit of 165,000 francs CFA for each loan cycle, Salimata expects to earn 195,000 francs CFA.

In addition to paying back the loan, the group members will use a part of their earnings to take care of their personal needs and a part to increase their business capital.

They wish to strengthen their partnership with Soro Yiriwaso so that they never experience gaps in their stocks.

loans.use: to buy diverse products

loans.name: Maimouna's Group

texts.fr:
Créer le 16 Juillet 2012, le banc villageois est composé de femmes qui après quatre cycles ont su faire de leur groupement une structure de solidarité et d’entre aide. Elles habitent toutes le même quartier  ce qui renforce encore les liens. Elles s’activent principalement dans le petit commerce.

Madame Maimouna (debout à droite avec une main levée), est la représentante du groupe. Elle est  mariée et mère de 03 enfants dont 01 fille. Elle s’active dans la vente d’articles vestimentaires à savoir des habits et chaussures en majorité pour enfant. Elle se rend à la capitale pour acheter en demie-gros pour revenir les revendre en détail. Elle a une bonne maîtrise de cette activité puisqu'elle la pratique depuis plus de 05 ans.

Avec ce nouveau prêt, elle compte renforcer son commerce pour générer plus de revenus. 

Avec les bénéfices, elle compte participer de manière significative à la prise en charge des besoins de la famille surtout  dans l'éducation des enfants.
texts.en:
Established on 16 July 2012, the banc villageois is made up of women who, after four cycles, have created a sense of solidarity and mutual aid. They live in the same area, which also strengthens their ties. The group members work primarily in small-scale commerce.

Maimouna (standing on the right [in the photo] with her hand raised) is the representative of the group. She is married and a mother of three children, of whom one is a girl. She works selling clothing, namely children's clothing and shoes. She travels to the capital to buy her goods partly at wholesale and then returns and resells them at retail. She knows her job well due to more than five years' experience.

With this new loan, she plans to increase her business to generate more revenue. 

With her earnings, she plans to contribute significantly to the care of her family's needs, especially her children's education.

loans.use: to buy a dozen pairs of children's shoes

loans.name: Diondji's Group

texts.fr:
Créer le 16 Juillet 2012, le banc villageois est composé de femmes qui habitent toutes le même quartier ce qui renforce les liens de solidarité. Elles s’activent principalement dans le petit commerce.

Madame Diondji (debout à l’extrême droite avec la main droite levée), est la représentante du groupe; mariée et mère de 04 enfants dont 02 garçons. C’est l’une des personnes ressources  de ce groupement et y joue un rôle essentiel dans la gestion des relations humaines grâce à son influence très positive. Elle s’active dans la teinture pour se faire, elle achète des tissus et les divers produits chimiques dont elle a besoin. Elle jouit d’une bonne expérience dans ce domaine pour l’avoir pratiqué pendant plus d’une dizaine d'années.  

Avec son nouveau crédit, elle désire acheter du tissu pour la production de draps et habits à revendre. 

Les bénéfices lui permettront de renforcer son épargne et de mieux prendre en charge les besoins de la famille en nourriture, santé et scolarité.
texts.en:
Created on 16 July 2012, this banc villageois is made up of women who live in the same area, which strengthens their ties of solidarity. They all work primarily in small-scale commerce.

Diondji (standing on the far right with her hand raised) is the representative of the group. She is married and a mother of four children, of whom two are boys. Diondji is one of the resource people in the group, and she plays an essential role in managing the group's internal relationships through her positive influence.

Diondji works dyeing fabrics, so she buys fabric and the various chemical products that she needs to do this. She has had a good experience with this work, which she has been doing for more than a decade.

With this new loan, she wishes to buy fabric to make into cloth and clothing to resell. Earnings will allow her to increase her savings and to take better care of her family's needs, such as food, health, and school.

loans.use: to buy 50 meters of white percale fabric to make into cloth and clothing to resell

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is married and is blessed with children all of whom attend school. She lives in her own house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

Ruth operates a tailoring business, making women's and gents' suits for sale at home. She cites seasonality and stiff competition from other tailoring operators to be her major challenge. 

With the KES 40,000 she wants to purchase cloth materials and sewing threads for her business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase cloth materials and sewing threads for her business.

loans.name: Tabitha

texts.en:
Tabitha is 26 years old and has a beauty salon business in Kisumu town and it has been profitable. She is a single mother of two children. 

This being her first loan term with VisionFund Kenya, she plans to use the amount to buy a stock of beauty products such as hair oil, cosmetics, lotions and hair clippers for use in her salon business. This will enable her to serve her customers well and also make more income which she will use to expand her business and also repay the loan.

In future Tabitha hopes to expand her beauty salon and thereby have a stable business.

loans.use: To buy a stock of beauty products for her salon.

loans.name: Teodora

texts.en:
Teodora owns and operates a variety store business to earn a living. She has been successful in this business for years, and she repaid her previous loan used for the business. She also finds ways to improve her income by operating her motorcycle unit which is used for transportation services.

Relative to this, she would like to take a new loan to increase her product inventory. She is requesting an amount of PHP 15,000 to buy more quantities and varieties of grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

In the future, Teodora wants to improve their way of living and she desires to manage other forms of business. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the word of God she studies.

* All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is married, and has four kids who attend school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past five years, she has operated a motorcycle/car spare parts business from her shop. Her potential customers are motorcycle operators and car operators. In addition she also operates a crop farming business which earns her another source of income. Her major challenge is the high cost of transportation to her place of operation.

With the KES 80,000 she wants to purchase a stock of motorcycle and car spare parts for sale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business and improve her living standards.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of motorcycle and car spare parts for sale.

loans.name: Sameer

texts.en:
Sameer is a 21-year-old university student majoring in Mechanical Engineering, and he is in his last semester. He is planning to open his own business after he finishes his studies. 

Sameer's father sells vegetables, and he has been facing financial problems during this period which didn't help him to pay his son's upcoming semester fees. For that reason, Sameer is now asking for your help by giving him this loan.

loans.use: To pay for his upcoming semester fees.

loans.name: Mwanasiti

texts.en:
Mwanasiti is married and has four children, all of whom attend school. She lives in a rented house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Mwanasiti operates a food selling business, making dumplings, flat bread for sale. She sells from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. 

With the KES 20,000 she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, cooking fat and sugar. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, cooking fat and sugar.

loans.name: Mariama Tacko's Group

texts.fr:
Créer le 16 Juillet 2012, le banc villageois est composé de femmes très engagées et désireuses de faire prospérer leurs activités génératrices de revenus. Elles viennent d’entamer leur cinquième cycle dans le programme et une avancée est notée dans leur travail. Il existe une entente et un esprit d’entre aide  entre les membres du groupe, Elles habitent toutes le même quartier et s’activent principalement dans le petit commerce.
Madame Mariama Tacko  (debout à droite avec une main levée), est la représentante du groupe. C’est une femme très dynamique qui connait une bonne progression depuis son adhésion dans le programme. Elle est mariée et mère de 04 enfants dont 01 fille. En plus de la vente d’articles vestimentaires qu’elle achète à la capitale pour les revendre dans son quartier et environs, elle fait des bonbons qu’elle vend au marché central. Elle a une parfaite maîtrise de ses activités.

Avec son nouveau prêt, elle prévoit acheter des coupons de Basin et des sacs de farine et divers ingrédients.

Avec les bénéfices, elle compte améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille  sur le plan de la nourriture, mais aussi une meilleure prise en charge des frais scolaires des enfants.
texts.en:
Created on 16 July 2012, this banc villageois is made up of women who are very engaged and ambitious with their businesses. They have just started their fifth cycle in the program, and they have made progress in their work. The group members all get along and share a spirit of mutual aid. They all live in the same area and work primarily in small-scale commerce.

Mariama Tacko (standing on the right [in the photo] with her hand raised) is the representative of the group. She is married and a mother of four children, of whom one is a girl. In addition to selling clothing that she buys in the capital and resells in her area and surrounds, she also makes candy that she sells in the central market. She does this work well.

With this new loan, she plans to buy cut Bazin fabric and bags of flour and other ingredients. 

With her earnings, she plans to improve the living conditions of her family in terms of food, but also to better cover the costs of her children's school fees.

loans.use: to buy a dozen six-yard pieces of Bazin fabric at 12,500 francs CFA, and to buy flour and other ingredients

loans.name: Salimata's Group

texts.fr:
Créer le 16 Juillet 2012, le banc villageois est composé de femmes très engagées et désireuses de faire prospérer leurs activités génératrices de revenu. Elles viennent d’entamer leur cinquième cycle dans le programme et une avancée est notée dans leur travail. Il existe une entente et un esprit d’’entre aide  entre les membres du groupe, Elles habitent toutes le même quartier et s’activent principalement dans le petit commerce.

Madame Salimata (debout à l’extrême droite avec la main droite levée), est l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe. Elle mariée et mère d’un garçon. Elle s’active dans l’achat et la revente de céréales locales plus particulièrement le mil qu’elle achète auprès des producteurs dans les villages environnants pour un stockage avant la revente. Elle a une bonne connaissance de ce domaine pour l’avoir pratiqué pendant des années.  

Avec son nouveau crédit, elle désire acheter des sacs de céréales( mil, mais, sorgho) pour la revente.

Les bénéfices lui permettront de se prendre en charge et d’apporter plus d'améliorer le panier de la ménagère du quotidien familial.
texts.en:
Created on 16 July 2012, this banc villageois is made up of women who are very engaged and ambitious in their businesses. They have just started their fifth cycle in the program, and they have made progress in their work. The group gets along and shares a spirit of mutual aid. They all live in the same area and work primarily in small-scale commerce.

Salimata (standing on the far right [in the photo] with her hand raised) is the featured borrower of the group. She is married and a mother of a boy.

Salimata works buying and selling local cereals, especially millet, which she buys from producers in the surrounding villages and stocks before reselling. She does well in this work, which she has done over the years.

With this new loan, she wishes to buy sacs of cereals (millet, corn, sorghum) to resell.

Earnings will allow her to take better care of her family and improve their daily life.

loans.use: to buy at least a ton and a half of cereals at 100 [francs] a kilogram and resell them in 50-kilogram sacs at 175 francs a kilogram

loans.name: Hadija

texts.en:
Hadija operates a charcoal selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She thanks all those who helped her to get the loan. She aspires to be the main supplier of charcoal within her place of operation.
 
With the KES 20,000 that she is requesting, she wants to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Dzine

texts.en:
Dzine appreciates the previous loan that helped her expand her business. 

Dzine operates a vegetable and fruit selling business. Her major goal is to become a leading fruit vendor business in the area to raise her profits.

For that reason with the KES 20,000 she wants to purchase green vegetables, sacks of fruits such as oranges, mangoes, water melons, and pawpaw. She decided to join Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries for her grocery store such as potatoes, tomatoes, fruits, kale.

loans.name: Sami

texts.en:
Sami is a 24-year-old young man living with his family that consists of five members in Mafraq, Jordan. He is a university student majoring in Physics, and he is in his fourth year. 

His father is a retired man, and his pension isn't enough to cover his family needs. This is what made Sami decide to support himself by looking for a good job in his field after getting his Bachelors' degree. But now he doesn't have enough money to pay for his upcoming semester fees. For that reason, he is asking for your help by applying for this loan.

loans.use: To pay for his upcoming semester fees.

loans.name: Abdullah

texts.en:
Abdullah is a 24-year-old university student majoring in Class Teaching, and he is in his third year. He lives with the five members of his family in Jordan. Both of his brothers are serving in the military. 

Abdullah wants to start his own business in his study field in the future after getting his Bachelors' degree. But now he facing financial problems that mean he has difficulties paying his upcoming semester fees. For that reason, he has applied for this loan asking for your help.

loans.use: To pay for his upcoming semester fees.

loans.name: Mwanasiti

texts.en:
Mwanasiti appreciates the previous loan that helped her expand her business, a vegetable and fruit selling business. Her major goal is to become a leading fruit vending business in the area to raise her profits.

For that reason, with the 45,000 KES she wants to purchase green vegetables and sacks of fruits, such as oranges, mangoes, watermelons, and pawpaw. She decided to join Yehu to get financial support for this endeavor.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables for her business.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a 34-year-old woman married to Peter, who adds additional income to support their children's welfare. They are blessed with three children.

Elizabeth has been operating a clothing sales business for a period of ten years earning an income of KES 15,000 at the end of every month. Elizabeth was introduced to VisionFund Kenya by a neighbor and is now servicing her first loan of KES 30,000 and intends to use this amount to buy additional curtains to sell to her customers.

Elizabeth plans to use the anticipated income to pay school fees to her children and hopes to improve the living standard of her family and enlarge her business.

loans.use: to buy curtains to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Binta Dabo's Group

texts.fr:
Créer le 16 Juillet 2012, le banc villageois est composé de femmes très engagées et désireuses de faire prospérer leurs activités génératrices de revenus. Elles viennent d’entamer leur cinquième cycle dans le programme et des efforts sont notés dans leur travail. habitant le même quartier, il existe un esprit d’entraide et de collaboration entre les membres du groupe. Elles font pratiquement toutes le petit commerce.

Madame Binta (debout à l’extrême droite avec une main levée), est la responsable du groupe. Elle est mariée et mère de 04 enfants dont 02 garçons. Elle tient une table au marché de sa commune où elle vend des légumes frais, de la pâte d’arachide et divers autres condiments. Elle fait cette activité depuis plus de 05 ans et maîtrise bien les circuits d’approvisionnement. Avec ce nouveau prêt, elle compte renforcer son activité et acheter d'autres marchandises dont elle ne disposent pas telles que de la pomme de terre, de l'oignon dans le but de mieux satisfaire la clientèle.

Avec les bénéfices, elle désire participer de manière significative à la prise en charge des besoins de la famille surtout dans la gestion de la scolarité des enfants et d'épargner.
texts.en:
Created on 16th July 2012, this banc villageois is made up of committed women who very much wish for their revenue-generating activities to prosper. They have just begun their fifth loan cycle and the work they're putting in really shows. As they live in the same area, there is a spirit of mutual aid and collaboration among the members of this group. Practically all of them work in small scale retail.

Binta, the woman standing to the far right of the photo with her hand raised, is the group's leader. She is a married mother to two sons and two daughters. She has her own stand at the local market, where she sells fresh vegetables, peanut paste and various other items. She has been doing this for over five years and has a solid supply network at her disposal. With this new loan, she plans on bolstering her business by purchasing other produce which she doesn't currently offer, such as potatoes and onions, in order to better satisfy her customers.

She wishes to use the profits from this venture to make a bigger contribution to her family's expenses, especially with her children's school fees and her savings.

loans.use: to purchase crates of aubergines and fresh tomatoes, as well as two 25kg-sacks of potatoes and onions, which will then be resold

loans.name: Sheila

texts.en:
Sheila is married and has school-going children. They live at a rental house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food and school fees for the family.

Sheila has operated a clothes selling business for the past two years. She sells from a shop to her town dwellers, passersby, and neighbors. She faces a major challenge of inflation in her business. 

With the 20,000 KES, she wants to purchase bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Laith

texts.en:
Laith is a 21-year-old independent university student majoring in political science. He lives with his family in Jordan.

Laith works at a shopping mall after finishing his classes at the university to gain income that will help him pay for his semester fees, but he currently doesn't have enough money to pay these fees completely. For that, he is asking for your help by applying for this loan.

loans.use: to pay for his upcoming semester fees.

loans.name: Slobodanka

texts.en:
Slobodanka is married and the mother of one boy. She is a housewife, and her husband transports goods for others for a small fee. Together, they are living in one of the minority communities of Kosovo, which is not developed and has suffered much loss and damage from the war. Like most people in this community, her family lives in very poor conditions. 

Currently, she is in need of a loan in order to change the door and windows of her house. This will help her to improve the living conditions for her family because the renovation will help keep the heat inside during the winter, the rain and snow out, and the utility costs lowered.

This is her first opportunity to address this issue and she is very thankful for the support. She promises to pay on time and hopes to start to work in the near future.

loans.use: to renovate her house by changing the door and windows.

loans.name: Khady Issa's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe de 28 femmes fait partie du banc villageois qui a été crée le 20 septembre  2010. Il regroupe des membres qui vivent dans le même village et ceux des alentours.
Fatou debout sur la photo, levant la main, est âgée de 54 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 9 enfants  dont 7 garçons.
Elle envisage de faire avec le prêt un commerce de divers produits alimentaires.
Elle va acheter du savon en poudre, du poisson fumé. Elle travaille  avec son mari dans la vente de cartes de crédit téléphonique et avec les enfants pour les initier dans le petit commerce.
Les bénéfices servent à assurer le bien être de la famille, améliorer l'alimentation, prendre en charge les frais scolaires des enfants qui vont à l’école.
texts.en: This 28-woman group is affiliated with the banc villageois which was created on 20th September 2010. All of its members live in the same village and its surrounding areas. Fatou, the woman standing to the far right of the photo with her hand raised, is 54 years old. She is a married mother to seven sons and two daughters. She plans on using this loan to create a retail business for herself. She will purchase washing powder and smoked fish for it. She works with her husband selling pre-paid phone cards. Their children also work alongside them, in order to initiate them into the retail business. The profits will be used to ensure the family's well-being, improve their dietary conditions and pay for their children's school fees.

loans.use: to purchase washing powder, smoked fish and pre-paid phone cards

loans.name: Hanafiya

texts.en: Hanafiya lives in a village with her husband and 3 children. She was born in 1977. She is a very hardworking woman. The family gathers its main income from farming; they cultivate potatoes and beans, and they grow fruit trees. In addition to farming, Hanafiya also would like to get involved in cattle breeding. She has been busy with this business for more than 14 years and she is experienced in farming. Her children help her with managing the business. She is asking for a loan of 8000 TJS to buy mineral fertilizers and seeds for sowing in the autumn season. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizers and seeds

loans.name: Shazar

texts.en: Shazar is a hardworking tractor driver and farmer from Wazirabad. He is 26 years old and married. His wife is a housewife who helps him with the farming activities. He has been driving a tractor for 6 years now. He is the sole earner in the family. He uses his tractor for agricultural purposes like transporting agricultural produce, manure, urea, and other items to different locations. A proper fuel supply is important to ensure that transportation is not hindered. But he cannot afford to buy fuel due to financial constraints. Therefore, he has applied for a loan to help him buy fuel for transporting agricultural products.

loans.use: to buy fuel for his tractor.

loans.name: Gulnara

texts.en: Gulnara is a 51-year-old divorced woman. She lives in Marneuli district. The only source of her income is the rent she gets monthly. Gulnara decided to start a trading business and requested a loan. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, enables her to get a loan of 3000 USD to begin her trading business. She will purchase a stock of clothes and linens to trade. This will increase her income and with this increased income Gulnara will improve her living conditions. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to begin to trade clothes and linens.

loans.name: Sokol

texts.en:
Sokol, age 44, is the father of 3 children. He comes from a Roma community, and like most people there, he and his family live in very poor conditions. Despite their living situation, he is very happy and always smiling and optimistic. In order to earn a living, he works transporting goods for others, and as is customary for Roma women, his wife stays home to care for the children and house. 

Due to the low income and their limited opportunities, he has not been able to complete renovations and repairs to his home or improve their living condition. Now, he is requesting a loan in order to replace the windows and doors before the upcoming winter and rainy season. He wants to thank all of the lenders for their support.

loans.use: To replace the windows and doors before the upcoming winter and rainy season

loans.name: Arcadia

texts.es:
Arcadia tiene 49 años de edad, estudió hasta 1° grado en la escuela, actualmente está acompañada y tiene 4 hijos, uno de ellos vive en USA, su otra hija ya está acompañada y por lo tanto con Arcadia solo viven dos hijos menores de edad que estudian en la escuela de su municipio y deben caminar 30 minutos para llegar.

Arcadia se dedica a los oficios domésticos desde que tenia 13 años de edad, conocimiento que adquirió de su madre, actualmente presta los servicios de moler maíz ya que posee un molino y tiene 6 años de estar realizando esta actividad productiva que le genera buenos ingresos, la cual fue iniciativa propia de Arcadia al ver  la necesidad de alimentar a sus hijos. Además de vez en cuando realiza siembra de maíz.
