Ella necesita el crédito para comprar productos agrícolas como fertilizantes, sulfato y herbicidas, además pagará la mano de obra para la siembra de maíz, que será de una hectárea. El préstamo le permitirá sembrar a tiempo y darle el tratamiento y nutrición necesaria que necesita la planta para obtener un buen rendimiento.


Sus sueños son seguir dándole los estudios a sus dos hijos  para que puedan obtener una educación media y esperar que los rendimientos de la cosecha de maíz  sean buenos para seguir trabajando fuerte ya que es una fuente de ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Arcadia is 49 years old. She studied up to 1st grade in school. Currently she has a partner and she has 4 children, one of whom lives in the USA. Her other daughter now has a partner, and so only two school-age children live with Arcadia. They study in the school of their municipality and have to walk 30 minutes to get there.

Arcadia has been doing domestic chores since she was 13 years old, learning the skills from her mother. Currently she offers corn-grinding services, since she has a mill. She has been doing this commercially for 6 years and it generates a good income for her. It was Arcadia's own initiative, on seeing the need to feed her children. As well as this, she occasionally plants corn.


She needs the loan to buy agricultural products such as fertilizers, sulfate and herbicides and also to pay for labour to plant one hectare of corn. The loan will allow her to plant on time and to give the plants the treatment and nutrition they need for a good performance.


Her dreams are to continue to give her two children the opportunity to study so they can get a secondary education and the hope that the corn yields a good harvest so that she can keep working hard because it is a source of income for her family.

loans.use: to buy agricultural products such as fertilizers, sulfate and herbicides and also to pay for labour to plant one hectare of corn

loans.name: Vugar

texts.en:
Vugar is a 37-year-old man. He is married and has two children. They live in the Baku region, but Vugar and his wife are IDP, internally displaced persons, from Fuzuli city. His wife is a housewife. Vugar's elder daughter is studying at college and his other child is going to school. He wants to provide a better future for his children.

In his store, Vugar sells different toys, such as cars, puzzles, puppets, etc. Vugar loves his job because he loves little children. Today he wants to support his lovely business. For this reason, he has applied to Komak Credit Union for a loan in the amount of 1500 AZN to buy more products to sell. Vugar is thankful to the Kiva organization and lenders for help.

loans.use: to pay for more toys to sell

loans.name: Judith Marisol

texts.es:
Judith Marisol tiene 49 años de edad, es conviviente, tiene 02 hijos dependiente y 04 hijos independientes, vive con sus hijos y su conyugue, en el distrito de Pomahuaca, el cual se encuentra ubicado a unos 20 minutos de la Urb. Pucará. El distrito de Pomahuaca es un distrito mediano, cuya actividades principales son el comercio y la agricultura, ye stá ubicado en la provincia de Jaén, región Cajamarca, sierra norte de Perú.

Judith Marisol se dedica a brindar servicio de costura cuenta con un taller de costura ubicada en su propio domicilio, ella tiene más de 15 años de experiencia en el rubro, por su experiencia y su buen servicio cuenta con un buen número de clientela, además se dedica a la venta de marcianos y helados preparados por ella misma, cuenta con muy buenas referencias personales, solvencia moral y económica, el destino del crédito es para invertir en el negocio capital de trabajo (comprando telas para la confección de sus pedidos) y asi poder adquirir una utilidad aceptable para que mejore su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Judith Marisol is 49 years old, has a partner, and 2 dependent and 4 independent children. She lives with her children and her husband in the Pomahuaca district, which is located at about 20 minutes from the town of Pucará. The Pomahuaca district is a medium-sized district dedicated to commerce and agriculture. It is located in the Jaén province, Cajamarca region, in the north mountain range of Peru.

Judith Marison makes a living by providing sewing services. She has a sewing workshop in her own home. She has more than 15 years of experience in this area. Because of her experience and good service, she has a good number of customers. She also makes a living from the sale of freezies and ice cream that are prepared by herself. She has very good personal references, and moral and economic solvency.

The purpose of the loan is to invest in the work about capital of her business by buying cloth to sew her orders, and so to be able to acquire acceptable utilities to improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to invest work labour capital in her business by buying cloth to sew her orders

loans.name: Dúo La Providencia Group

texts.es: Dúo la Providencia es integrada por Blanca de 34 años de edad y desde ya muchos  años ella se dedica al tejido típico de la localidad de San Juan Sacatepéquez, doña Blanca quien ademas de dedicarse al tejidos tipicos tambien desde ya 7 años tiene su pequeña tienda de venta de consumo diario ubicado en su domicilio, doña Blanca le da gracias a Dios por darle la oportunidad de recibir de parte de una institución una capacitación sobre la crianza de marranos y ahora ella está bien motivada queriendo agregar su nuevo negocio, por lo cual necesita de capital para la compra de marranos pequeños y  luego engordarlos. Una actividad más que agrega a su vida con el fin de aumentar sus ingresos y siempre mantenerse al tanto del cuidado de sus 4 hijos. El anelo de ella es seguir apoyando a sus hijos y estar trabajando al lado de su esposo ya que ve crecer a sus hijos y sabe que en un futuro sus hijos esperan más de ellos como padres.
texts.en:
One of the members of the La Providencia partnership is Blanca, who is 34 years' old and has been making a living by weaving textiles typical to her area of San Juan Sacatepéquez for many years. Blanca, as well as making a living weaving typical textiles, has also been running her own small shop selling everyday products out of her house for the past 7 years.

Blanca is thankful to God for having given her the opportunity to undertake training at an institution about breeding pigs and now she's really motivated by her desire to start a new business, for which she needs the capital to buy small pigs which she will fatten up. It's one more occupation which she can add to her life in order to increase her income and keep supporting herself and her 4 children. Her dream is to continue supporting her children and keep working alongside her husband because bringing up their children and creating a good future for them requires more of them as parents.

loans.use: to buy pigs for breeding

loans.name: Claris

texts.en:
Claris is a married woman and has two kids who attend school. Her husband works too. Together, they own a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

For the past two years, Claris has operated a tailoring business for men and women. She dreams of establishing a boutique in the future. 

With the 30,000 KES she has requested, she wants to purchase cloth and sewing thread for her business. She decided to join Yehu to access financial support to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase cloth and sewing thread for her business

loans.name: Ramik

texts.en:
Ramik is a twenty-four-year-old single man. He is a gardener and lives with his father. He has been growing fruit trees for four years and selling them at the local bazaar. He sells seasonal fruits such as apples, pears, peaches and plums. His monthly income from this is 170 AZN. His father helps him to water and care for the trees.

Azerbaijan has very rich cuisine, so fruit are in high demand throughout the year. People use fruit to make cherry and plum jam, peach juice and cakes (pear and apple cake). Dried fruit are also very popular in Azerbaijan. 

Ramik lives with his old father in a region with a shortage of water. This is a major challenge for his garden. He needs to supply water every week in order to raise the fruit trees. He has applied for 1,200 AZN to create a water reserve for the autumn.

loans.use: to supply water every week in order to raise trees

loans.name: Doreen

texts.en: Doreen is 28 years old and married with three children. She lives in Kasese, Uganda. Doreen has been selling secondhand clothes for two years to have a source of income. Doreen is hardworking, although she is faced with the challenge of competition. Doreen has a dream of buying land, building a house and expanding her business. Doreen wants a loan to buy secondhand dresses, shirts, trousers and blouses for resale.

loans.use: to buy secondhand dresses, shirts, trousers and blouses for resale.

loans.name: Maka

texts.en: Maka is a thirty-seven-year-old married woman. She lives with her husband Gela and three children in the Chiatura district of Georgia. The only source of income for her family is her husband's monthly salary working at local mine. Maka married at an early age and wasn’t able to get an education, so she has no university degree, which is one of the main reasons for her unemployment.  She looks after her three children and stays home but she has a great desire to be involved in a trading business. Maka can’t request a loan from financial institutions until the Start Up program begins. This program is a joint product of Kiva and Credo. She requested a loan of 2,500 Gel to begin trading clothing and linens. She plans to go to Turkey and purchase the products at wholesale prices and then resell the items to her friends and villagers.  This will give her a chance to earn her own stable income. She hopes her income will provide a better future for her children.

loans.use: to begin trading clothes and linens

loans.name: Marine

texts.en: Marine is 54 years old. She is married and lives with her husband and son in Lagodekhi district in east Georgia. The family is involved in agricultural activities. In particular, they have a vineyard and a plot of land where they grow fruits and vegetables. Marine sells the harvested products locally at good prices. In addition, they have a plot of agricultural land that needs cultivation. Marine has requested a loan to purchase a tractor. The startup loan program, which is a joint initiative of Kiva and Credo, enables her to get a loan of 3,800 GEL to purchase a tractor and to cultivate her land. She will also rent it out to other villagers and will earn additional income. Marine awaits your support.

loans.use: to purchase a tractor to cultivate her land and then rent it out

loans.name: Rahila

texts.en:
Rahila is a 63-year-old married woman. Her family is big: she has a son and four daughters.  She has been a gardener for 20 years, raising live plants to sell. Her monthly income is 190 AZN. 

Raising live plants is very popular in Azerbaijan, especially in regions. Local people like to decorate their houses and work places with beautiful plants and flowers. This makes their life and workplace more beautiful and comfortable. Additionally, they are less stressed and more productive around plants.

Raising live plants is hard work and takes a lot of time. Rahila loves her job very much. She properly takes care of her flowers, trees, and plants. She sells them at a bazaar and has good clients. 

She applied for a 1,500 AZN loan in order to buy good fertilizer and new garden tools for her garden. This will save her garden, and she will be able to take care of her flowers and increase sales.

loans.use: to buy good fertilizer and new garden tools for her garden.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: Florence is 30 years old and single with one child. She lives in Kasese, Uganda. Florence has operated a bar for one year. She began the business to meet her day-to-day expenses. Florence has a dream of buying land, expanding her business and educating her child, despite limited capital. Florence wants a loan to buy beers, sodas, water and spirits to sell.

loans.use: to buy beers, sodas, water and spirits to sell in her bar.

loans.name: Zachary

texts.en:
Zachary is a smallholder farmer from Thika, which is a pineapple growing region in Kenya. He has 5 children, who he sustains through the sale of milk and eggs. He has been doing this for 12 years. He also engages in other personal businesses for extra income. 

Zachary would like to improve his farm output in order to have higher sales. However, he is constrained by capital. He is seeking a loan via Juhudi Kilimo to purchase a pasture and a chaff cutter. 

Pasturing his livestock will offer benefits for himself, consumers, animals and the environment. For Zachary, feeding livestock on a pasture is an important part of ensuring that the animals have comfortable, healthy living conditions. Confinement in crowded conditions or cold, damp barns can contribute to respiratory and other health problems for all livestock, including poultry.   With your loan, Zachary’s cattle will get more fresh air and exercise, and spend less time crowded together.

He plans to spend the increased income on farm inputs. When asked, “How will this loan benefit your family?” Zachary replied. “Better living standards.”

loans.use: to purchase a pasture and a chaff cutter

loans.name: Shareen

texts.en:
Shareen is a married woman and has three kids who attend school. Her family lives in a rental house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

Shareen has operated a tailoring business for the past three years, serving both men and women. She dreams of establishing a boutique in the future. 

With the loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings, she wants to buy more cloth and sewing thread. She decided to join Yehu to access financial support to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy cloth and sewing thread for her business.

loans.name: Joan

texts.en:
Twenty-nine year old Joan does not boast of a university degree or even a certificate from an agricultural institute, but she is an accomplished farmer from Kapsowar area of Kenya and commands a lot of respect. She is happily married and, together with her handsome husband, they are blessed with 4 children. 

For the past 2 years she has been involved in mixed farming and because of the immense knowledge she has on farming, farmers from their village and neighboring villages troop to her home to seek technical advice on the best farming techniques. Joan has identified free space on her farm and wants to fully utilize this space by keeping a good quality dairy cow. 

Dairy farming in Kenya is a very profitable venture and milk prices in the recent past have been going up, so Joan, being a visionary and entrepreneurial woman, wants to take full advantage of this. She has chosen the breed of cow that she will keep, and she knows that she will not only get milk from the cow but also manure, and this will boost the fertility of her farm. Selling her milk will never be a problem because there is a ready market and she will also be selling to big dairy processing firms. 

Joan said she chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan because they offer agricultural based loans, and their interest rate is low and is on a reducing basis. She underwent training through Juhudi Kilimo, and from this training she learned that saving is a continuous process in many microfinance institutions. 

Joan hopes that through the accumulated profit she will be able to start adding value to her milk by starting services such as packaging and the production of other dairy products. This loan will change her life and will secure the future of her school-going children

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Hello world, meet Stephen!  

Stephen is a 40 year-old father of 4 who practices mixed farming for a living.  He comes from Thika (Central Kenya) where he has been doing this work for 6 years.  His primary income sources are from selling milk, eggs and tea, as well as income from transportation services and personal business.

Stephen’s hobby is feeding chicks!  He ensures the health of his farm by watering plants and tendering to his animals.  Stephen is seeking a loan to construct poultry housing and to purchase more poultry and a chaff cutter. 

Many rural farmers in Kenya keep poultry because they provide them with companionship, food and fibre in form of eggs, meet and feathers.  With your loan, Stephen will have not only enjoy raising chickens for fresh eggs and meat, but also tap into the large commercial chicken industry.  The housing will provide comfort, protection and efficient production for the poultry.  Stephen will also benefit from the convenience the house will afford him.  The money he will make as a result will help him pay for his children’s education.  His family at large will enjoy an improved standard of living

loans.use: to purchase poultry

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline is a 27-year-old woman who is separated from the husband and is taking care of one child.  Caroline has been a tailor for a period of six years, earning an income of KES. 15,000 at the end of every month.

Caroline is now servicing her second loan of KES. 36,000 with VisionFund Kenya, and intends to use this amount to buy some material to make dresses, skirt suits, and trouser suits for her customers.  

Caroline plans to use the anticipated income to open a retail shop, and hopes to become a successful businesswoman by building rental and business houses in her hometown.

loans.use: To buy material to make dresses, skirt suits and trouser suits for her  customers.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
The majority of the people living in poverty in Kenya come from the rural areas. Most of them, like Charles, are smallholder subsistence farmers. While there are numerous differences between them, such as crops grown and levels of productivity, income and government support, they share many commonalities. Despite their marginalised status in society, productivity gains by smallholders will significantly drive poverty reduction. 

Charles, 26, comes from Nandi Hills, which is a small agricultural town in the Great Rift Valley.  He sustains his one child through selling milk, eggs and crops from his farm. He is also engaged in other side businesses since he is not making enough income. 

Like Charles, many rural smallholder farmers are still snared in poverty and they face a set of common challenges preventing them from escaping this trap. The biggest problem smallholders face throughout the region is lack of sufficient access to land, which makes it difficult for them to boost their incomes significantly. 

Charles is seeking a loan to purchase a piece of land. This will make him have legal rights over the property and increase his agricultural output. This will enable him to make enough income to afford business related expenses that are too high for him at the moment. 

Charles stated that he will use the loan to raise the living standards of his family.

loans.use: to purchase land

loans.name: Aramanzani

texts.en:
Aramazan is 55 years old, married with four children and living in Kasese, Uganda. He has a motorcycle transport business, which he has been running for fourteen years, plus does farming for additional income. Aramazan started his business because he wanted to be self-employed. He is a hard-working man dreaming of making his business stable, but limited capital and road accidents are challenges he faces.
Aramazan needs a loan to buy motorcycle spare parts and tyres.

loans.use: to buy motorcycle spare parts and tyres

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is a married woman and has been blessed with two children, all of whom attend school. Together with her husband, they live at their own house that neither has electricity nor piped water. 

She has operated a fish selling business for over two years, selling from her home to restaurant operators and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality.

With the Kshs 10,000 she wants to purchase bundles of fish for resale. She dreams of expanding her business and establishing another business in the near future

loans.use: to purchase bundles of fish for resale

loans.name: Ruwaida

texts.en:
Ruwaida is a 22 years old, single, young lady. She lives in Jordan with her family that consists of nine members. 

She is a university student majoring in the Arabic Language, and she is in her fourth year. Ruwaida is only one step away from reaching her aim which is finding a job in her study field. But unfortunately she doesn't have enough money to pay for her upcoming semester fees. For that, she has applied for this loan.

loans.use: to pay for her upcoming semester fees.

loans.name: Oraib

texts.en:
Oraib is a 22-year-old, single lady living with her family in Jordan.  She is a university student majoring in Computer Science, and is in her fourth year. 

Oraib is seeking to get her Bachelors' to find a job in her study field, and she is now applying for this loan to be able to pay for her upcoming semester fees.

loans.use: To pay for her upcoming semester fees

loans.name: Joseline

texts.en:
Joseline is a married woman with two children, both of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

Joseline operates a food stall selling vegetables. She sells at the market to town dwellers and neighbors. She faces the challenge of high cost of transportation to her place of operation. She dreams of expanding and establishing a motorcycle transport business in the future. 

With the loan of 20,000 KES, she wants to purchase green vegetables, two crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business

loans.use: to purchase green vegetables, two crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale.

loans.name: Shakila

texts.en: Shakila is a 24-year-old married woman and a mother of four children. In order to help her husband take care of the family, she began a milk-selling business. She is known in her town for providing good quality milk. She owns two buffaloes and one cow. She is happily supporting her family with the income generated. She is in her fourth loan cycle. She has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR to purchase another buffalo. She is hopeful that the increase in milk production will help her to generate more income.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo.

loans.name: Irubgu

texts.en:
Irubgu is a married man with two children, both of whom attend school. He owns a house that has piped water but not electricity. 

Irubgu operates a water vending business, selling from home to his neighbors and passersby. He faces a major challenge of seasonality in his business. His dream is to have big water storage in the near future.

With the 30,000 KES, he wants to purchase a water tank for storing water for resale. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: to purchase a water tank for storing water for resale.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is a married woman. She owns a house that has neither electricity not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

Janet operates a grocery vegetable selling stall; she sells at the market to town dwellers and neighbors. She faces a challenge of the high cost of transportation to her place of operation. 

With the Kshs 25,000 she wants to purchase green vegetables, two crates of tomatoes, and onions to sell. 

She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase green vegetables, two crates of tomatoes, and onions

loans.name: Dima

texts.en:
Dima is a 21-year-old young ambitious lady living with her family, which consists of six members in Irbid, Jordan. Her father is a retired man. 

She is a university student majoring in Management and Finance Sciences, and she is in her third year. Dima is seeking to work in her study field after getting her Bachelors'. 

Because she currently doesn't have enough money to pay for her upcoming semester fees, she has applied for this loan.

loans.use: To pay for her upcoming semester fees

loans.name: Kaneez

texts.en: Kaneez is a 45-year-old hardworking woman. She has four children. For the last 15 years, she has been providing the service of stitching in her locality. She is quite popular for her stitching skill. Over the years, she has established a good clientele. However, due to lack of availability of funds, she is unable to meet the daily demands of her customers. In her third loan cycle, Kaneez has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR. She intends to use this loan to buy more spools of thread, laces, and buttons. It will allow her to sew more dresses to generate a healthier source of income.

loans.use: to buy more spools of thread, laces, and buttons.

loans.name: Munawwar

texts.en: Munawwar is a 51-year-old vigorous lady who has been making clothes for many years. She sews for the people of her community and uses the income to support her entire family. However, due to a lack of funds, she is unable to meet the daily demands of her customers. For this reason she has requested a loan of 40,000 Pakistani rupees (PKR) from Kashf Foundation. She intends to use this loan to buy more spools of threads in different colors, along with packs of laces, zippers and buttons. These will allow her to increase her revenues so she may be able to generate a healthier source of income. She is in her third loan cycle and has been successful with her past repayments.

loans.use: to buy more thread, laces, zippers and buttons.

loans.name: Azra

texts.en: Azra is a vigorous 39-year-old lady who has been providing tailoring services for many years and is quite skilled at her job. She sews for the people of her community and uses the income to support her entire family, including her four children. She requires financial help to meet the daily expenses of her shop as most of her income is spent on her children. Thus, in her fourth loan cycle she has requested 40,000 Pakistani rupees (PKR). With this loan she intends to buy a new sewing machine and more sewing material, such as needles and spools of threads. She wants to generate more income in the future.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine and more sewing materials like needles and thread.

loans.name: Yesenia

texts.es:
Yesenia de 31 años de edad tiene como nivel académico tercer grado, está casada y su esposo es pastor de una iglesia, tiene 4 hijos de los cuales solo dos van a la escuela. 

Yesenia  es ama de casa, pero también le ayuda a su esposo a cultivar maíz, aunque este año les fue mal con la cosecha debido al mal clima, ellos siguen adelante cultivando ya que es su forma de obtener ingresos, para llegar al lugar donde siembra con su esposo debe hacer un recorrido de 20 minutos a pie.


Ella necesita el crédito para comprar 6 sacos de abono y pagará a una persona que le ayude a su esposo a sembrar una hectárea de maíz.

Su sueño es que Dios le de vida para poder seguir trabajando ayudarle a su esposo, que a sus hijos no les falte nada en casa, que sigan estudiando y que sean profesionales, ella espera lograr sus sueños aunque sea con sacrificio.
texts.en:
Yesenia is 31 years old and reached third grade of education. She is married and her husband is pastor of a church. She has four children, two of whom go to school.

Yesenia is a housewife, but she also helps husband grow corn. Although this year the harvest was poor due to bad weather, they carry on farming since this is how they earn their income. She walks for 20 minutes to reach the plot where they grow the crops.

She needs the loan to buy six sacks of compost and to pay for a person to help her husband to sow a hectare of corn. 

Her dream is that God will give her life to keep on working and helping her husband, that the children will lack nothing and they will continue studying to become prefessionals. She hopes to achieve her dreams even through sacrifice.

loans.use: to buy six sacks of compost and pay a person to help her husband sow a hectare of corn.

loans.name: Sri Pandhalamman Shg - Poovallur Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Baby is a leader of the “Sri Pandhalamman” Self-Help Group (SHG) which includes 7 other women, to which PAT, the local NGO, has been giving loans to improve their livelihoods. Baby lives in a small hamlet in the rural area of Poovallur, Tamil Nadu. She is married and her husband is a farmer. They have a child. They live in a house with a thatched roof.

India accounts for six lakh (600,000) deaths every year caused by acute lower respiratory infections. This is the leading causes of disease and mortality, which are the offspring of indoor pollution and lung congestion caused by the use of traditional stoves emitting smoke. A majority of villagers usually cook on the earthen stove or a three brick earthen burner, which over a period of time is responsible for lung disease and blurred vision.  

Hence, Baby and her group members are looking forward to this loan to purchase smokeless stoves that can be used in their kitchens and help them breathe clean air.

loans.use: to purchase a smokeless stove.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma appreciates the previous loan that helped her expand her business.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past two years, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. 

With the loan that she is requesting, she wants to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour.

loans.name: José Lucas

texts.es:
Lucas es un joven de 23 años de edad, estudió hasta sexto grado, se acompañó y su pareja es ama de casa, aún no tiene hijos y vive con sus padres y 2 hermanos.

Lucas tiene dos años de trabajar como albañil, trabajo que le enseñó su suegro, cuando no trabaja de albañil, él siembra granos básicos de forma que siempre se mantiene ocupado tratando de obtener ingresos para salir adelante.

El crédito lo necesita para comprar fertilizantes y pesticidas para aplicarlos a su cultivo y así tener una buena cosecha y granos básicos para el consumo del hogar.

Él desea seguir trabajando fuertemente para construir su casa y que cuando sus hijos nazcan ya tengan un hogar propio donde vivir.
texts.en:
Lucas is a young man, age 23, who studied until the sixth grade.  His life-partner is a housewife, and they do not yet have children.  They live with his parents and two brothers. 

For two years, Lucas has been working as a bricklayer, work that his father-in-law taught him. When he is not working as a bricklayer he plants basic grains; so he is always busy trying to earn income in order to move forward.

He needs the loan in order to purchase fertilizer and pesticide to use on his crop, and thus have a good harvest and basic grains for home consumption.

He wants to continue working hard in order to build his house, so that when his children are born they might have a home of their own, where they can live.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and pesticide to use on his crop, so that he can have a good harvest and basic grains for home consumption.

loans.name: Najma

texts.en:
Najma has successfully maintained her business of manufacturing steel boxes with the support of Kashf Foundation and Kiva. Her husband, who is also shown in the photo, helps her running this business. Previously with the help of Kiva loan she was able to purchase required things for her business.  

Now, in order to meet the demands of her customers, she has applied for a loan of 40,000 PKR to purchase good quality, nails and some locks. She is in her 5th loan cycle with a good credit history. She expects a boost in her earnings and wishes to spend it on the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to purchase good quality nails and some locks.

loans.name: Asmaa

texts.en:
Asmaa is 24 years old. She lives in Jordan with her family. Her father works in a governmental entity. Asmaa is a single university student majoring in Computer Information Systems, and she is in her fourth year. She is hoping to get a job at a bank after getting her bachelors' degree. 

Now Asmaa is requesting a loan that will help her pay her upcoming semester fees.

loans.use: To pay her upcoming semester fees.

loans.name: Imtayaz

texts.en:
Imtayaz is a 38-year-old married woman; she has been doing business selling crockery for the past five years. She offers various types of crockery such as glasses, dinner sets, bowls etc. Her husband also assists her in selling them to the people of their community and in the local market. She makes a sufficient amount of income to contribute to the family's income. 

In order to improve her business she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of 45,000 PKR. In this way she will be able to purchase more variety of crockery such as tea sets, bowls and glasses in various sizes and designs. She is expecting boost in her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more variety of crockery such as tea sets, bowls and glasses in various sizes and designs.

loans.name: Nelly

texts.en:
Wonderful Kiva lenders! Meet Nelly, a 50 year old mother who is so humble, honest and a very hardworking woman on this planet Earth. Nelly is a mother of four lovely children that she really adores so much and will always do anything good so that they never go to bed with hungry stomachs. 

Nelly hails from the Kapsowar area of Kenya. Nelly never got the opportunity to advance her education and get a white collar job but this did not kill her dream of wanting to succeed in life. Nelly started farming and has been doing farming for the past 3 years. Through those years she has gathered so much experience and all the farming techniques are at her fingertips. 

Nelly practices mixed farming on her farm and through the profits she has managed to take care of her family's needs and also give her children a good education because she believes that education is the only “key to success”. Nelly is a woman who is very enterprising and she is seeking a loan of KES 65,000 to start horticulture farming on her farm. Because of favorable weather patterns, a good road network in her village, good soil and a ready market for horticulture products, Nelly wants to take advantage of that and reap more profits. 

Juhudi Kilimo is partnering with Kiva and Kiva lenders to help aspiring women like Nelly to make their farming dreams come to reality through training and loan financing. Nelly hopes that through the loan she will improve her living conditions. Nelly's dreams and projections are that by the end of the first year she will not only be selling in the local market but will also be selling in international markets through exporting fruits and vegetables. Through this she will be able to assure her children a secure future and uninterrupted learning because she will be able to pay tuition fees on time. Nelly is not a selfish woman and will also want to impact positively on society that is why she will employ people to work for her on her horticulture farm, hence having an impact on society.

loans.use: To start horticulture farming.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to expand his horticulture farm.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes operates a cosmetic shop business. Her potential customers being town dwellers and neighbours especially women. She dreams of expanding her business to meet her family's basic needs and she appreciates the support of the previous loan that helped her to boost her business. 

With the loan that she is requesting, she wants to purchase perfumes, lipsticks and body lotions. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase perfumes, lipsticks and body lotions.

loans.name: Rania

texts.en:
Rania is a 21-year-old single lady living with her family that consists of seven members in Salt, Jordan. She is a university student majoring in Teaching Children, and she is in her third year. 

Rania loves children, and she is planning to find a job in her field after getting her Bachelors' degree. But not having enough money to pay for her upcoming semester fees has pushed her to apply for this loan.

loans.use: To pay her upcoming semester fees.

loans.name: Pothigai Shg - Nerunjalakudi Group

texts.en:
Indra leads a group “Pothigai,” which includes 13 other women residing in the Nerunjalakudi village in Trichy District of Tamil Nadu. They are all married, and to support their family incomes and meet their monthly expenditures, they have to work. 

Indra is the featured borrower. For cooking, she, like the others uses the traditional chulha, a makeshift stove that use firewood, which emits a lot of smoke. The smoke not only causes health problems among the family members, but also pollutes their surroundings.

She, like the others, is seeking a loan to purchase a Greenway cooking stove. The benefits of the Greenway stoves are fuel savings, using all solid fuels, minimized emissions of harmful carbon components, fast and convenient cooking, and high durability, being maintenance free, and being smokeless. 

She intends to repay the loan amount in easy monthly installments. This loan product will help her in preventing diseases, saving on firewood expenses, and promoting a clean environment.

loans.use: to purchase a low-smoke cooking stove.

loans.name: Anbumani Shg-Anaikudam Group

texts.en:
Latha leads a group “Anbumani” including seven other women residing in the Anaikudam village of Ariyalur district in Tamil Nadu. They are all married, and to support their family income and meet their monthly expenditure, they have to work. They are hardworking women. 

Latha is the featured borrower. For cooking, she, like the others, uses the traditional chulha, a makeshift stove that uses firewood, which emits a lot of smoke. The smoke not only causes health problems among the family members, but also pollutes their surroundings.

She, like the others, is seeking a loan to purchase a Greenway cooking stove. The benefits of the Greenway stoves are fuel savings, using all solid fuels, minimized emissions of harmful carbon components, fast and convenient cooking, and high durability, being maintenance free, and being smokeless. 

She intends to repay the loan amount in easy installments. This loan product will help her in preventing diseases, saving on firewood expenses, and promoting a clean environment.

loans.use: to buy a smokeless stove.

loans.name: María Del Carmen

texts.es:
María de 36 años de edad, no estudió  y mejor decidió aprender los oficios de la casa y ayudarle a su madre, tiene 4 hijos y solo una hija estudia. 

María trabaja como empleada en una tienda desde hace unos 4 años, antes también trabajaba en casa ya que es madre soltera y tiene que llevar el sustento para sus hijos. 

Ella necesita el crédito para cambiar el techo de su casa pues se encuentra bastante deteriorado y en época de lluvia es muy difícil estar moviendo todo para que no se moje, esto mejorara la condición de vida de ella y su familia. 

A ella le gustaría ver a sus hijos con una buena estabilidad familiar y ver crecer a sus nietos en buenas condiciones.
texts.en:
María is 36 years old. She didn't go to school and decided to learn how to keep a house and help her mother. She has 4 children and only one daughter is in school.  

María has worked as a store employee for 4 years. Previously she also at home because she is a single mother and she has to support her children. She needs the loan to put on a new roof because the one she has has deteriorated a lot and is is very difficult to be moving everything so it won't get wet. This will improve her and her family's quality of life.  

She would like for her children to have family stability and to see her grandchildren grow up in good conditions.

loans.use: to put on a new roof on her house because the one she has has deteriorated a lot.

loans.name: Salvador

texts.es:
Salvador tiene 62 años de edad, no estudió debido a que padeció una enfermedad en parte de su cuerpo y le era difícil asistir a la escuela en esas condiciones, después de su recuperación quiso seguir las enseñanzas de su padre quien era un gran agricultor. Está casado y tiene 7 hijos que ahora ya todos están casados y solo vive con 2 nietos. 

Salvador trabaja en la agricultura, la parcela está a 2 km de su casa y tiene un pickup en el cual se transporta. 

Él necesita el crédito para comprar abono y pagar mano de obra para trabajar el cultivo.

A él le gustaría ver crecer a sus nietos y que estudien ya que por situaciones de la vida él no tuvo esa oportunidad.
texts.en:
Salvador is 62 years old. He didn't go to school because he had a disease in part of his body and it was difficult for him to go to school under those conditions. After recuperating, he wanted to follow his father's teachings, because his father was a great farmer. He is married and has 7 children who are married now. He just lives with 2 grandchildren.  

Salvador works in agriculture. The land is 2 km from his house and he has a pickup he uses to get there. He needs the loan to buy fertilizer and to pay for labor to work the crops. 

He would like to see his grandchildren grow up and for them to get an education because due to life situations, he didn't have that opportunity.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and to pay for labor costs to work the crops.

loans.name: Shenaz

texts.en:
Shenaz is a 37-year-old married woman who has been running a business selling cattle for many years. The business is doing well enough to provide her with a decent life. She has five children. She is very motivated to provide them with a beautiful life. She has improved her business to meet the day-to-day expenses of her household. 

This is her 5th year with Kashf Foundation. Now she has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR to purchase more cattle. She dreams of providing better standard of living to her children.

loans.use: to purchase more cattle.

loans.name: Dúo Bellos Amaneceres Group

texts.es:
DUO BELLOS AMANECERES
El grupo formado por doña Elsa Alicia, quien nos cuenta que es casada tiene 3 hijos que viven aun con ella, y se dedica a la venta de ropa típica desde hace 3 años, lo que más vende son cortes sanjuaneros con costura, pero ahora quiere comenzar a vender suéteres ya que le han pedido, sale a vender 4 veces a la semana por la aldea Sacsuy y Llano de la Virgen, deja ropa y pasa cobrando, solicita este crédito porque necesita incrementar su capital para comprar cortes sanjuaneros y mandarlos a bordar y también suéteres.
texts.en:
THE BELLOS AMANECERES DUO

This group includes Elsa Alicia, who tells us that she is married and has 3 children who still live with her. She has worked selling traditional clothing for 3 years. What she sells the most are "cortes sanjuaneros" [traditional skirts] with embroidery. Now she wants to start selling sweaters as well, as she has been asked for them. She goes out to sell 4 times a week around the towns of Sacsuy and Llano de la Virgen. She delivers clothes and collects payment. She is asking for this loan because she needs to increase her capital to buy cortes sanjuaneros and have them embroidered, as well as sweaters.

loans.use: to buy traditional clothing to sell.

loans.name: María Gloria

texts.es:
María de 42 años de edad, solamente estudio hasta 5° grado debido a que la escuela estaba demasiado lejos y era tiempo de guerra, ella tiene 2 hijos y solamente uno estudia.

 Ella es costurera, desde hace muchos años se  ha dedicado a este tipo de labor que aprendió cuando dieron clases de cortes y confección en un lugar cercano y a ella le llamó la atención, aprendió y decidió poner en práctica sus conocimientos y adquirir   experiencia a través del tiempo. Además ella tiene elaboración de dulces típicos y lo hace junto con unas amigas.

María necesita el crédito para comprar abono y demás elementos agrícolas para que su hijo trabaje la tierra. 

Sus planes son mejorar la fabricación de dulces y vinos artesanales y retirarse de la costura ya que padece de asma y alergias al cortar la tela y le provoca dificultad al respirar.
texts.en:
María, who is 42 years old, only studied until 5th grade because the school was too far away and it was wartime. She has 2 children and only one studies.

She is a seamstress. For many years she has done this type of work, which she learned when sewing and tailoring classes were given nearby which caught her attention. She learned and decided to put her knowledge into practice and gain experience over time. In addition, she has been making sweet pastries together with some friends.

María needs a loan to buy fertilizer and other agricultural items so that her son can work the land. 

Her plans are to improve the production of sweet pastries and traditional wine and retire from sewing because she is already suffering from asthma and allergies when she cuts the fabric and it causes her difficulty breathing.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other agricultural items so that her son can work the land.

loans.name: Sembaruthi Shg-Venanallur Group

texts.en:
Uma, 35 years old, is the leader of the Sembaruthi Self Help Group, which was formed by the local NGO, People's Action for Transformation (PAT) in Tamil Nadu, India. She lives in Venanallur village, Ariyalur district. Uma lives in her own house with her two children and husband. Her husband is a farmer. Uma has previously taken loans from the PAT and she is regular in her repayment of the loan.  

Uma wants to buy a smokeless stove for her family. The stove is manufactured by Greenway Grameen Infra Pvt, Ltd. It costs INR 1,400. It is more efficient than the traditional mud stove. Traditional stoves consume more time and money. Burning of biomass fuels causes almost 500,000 deaths every year in India alone. (Source: WHO 2009). Smokeless stoves prevent sickness and deaths from the indoor air pollution due to cooking activities.

Uma and the other member of the group are requesting a loan to buy smokeless stoves and have healthier lives.

loans.use: to buy a smokeless stove.

loans.name: Sevvanthi Shg-Venanallur Group

texts.en:
Vimala is a 22-year-old woman who is married and has a child. Vimala’s husband is a marginal farmer with an average income.

Vimala has learned of a smokeless stove manufactured by Grameen Infra that uses 65% less fuel than traditional mud cook stoves. Most members in her community use conventional firewood stoves in their kitchens, which cause 70% more smoke emissions than the smokeless stove. Vimala wishes to be able to save money on fuel expenses as well as to provide a good atmosphere in the house, devoid of dangerous fumes.

Vimala is a leader of the Sevvanthi Self-Help Group (SHG), which is located in Venanallur village of Ariyalur District in Tamil Nadu, India. She, like the other seven members of the group, wishes to request a group loan in order to buy this smokeless stove. They all are hoping to benefit from the lower fuel costs and safety of lower smoke emissions.   

This is Sevvanthi group’s very first loan from Kiva. The group members are very excited about the opportunity to purchase this sustainable stove and wish to thank the lenders.

loans.use: to buy a smokeless stove.

loans.name: Maryam

texts.en:
Maryam is a 41-year-old married woman and a mother of four. She has been running a business selling cloth for many years. She purchases a variety of fancy embroidered cloth from the main city and then sells it to the people of her vicinity. She has become famous for selling good quality fabric in her community. 

Currently, Maryam requested a loan of PKR 45,000 from Kashf Foundation to buy a new collection of fancy cloth in different colors and designs. She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan and wants to grow her business. She dreams of providing better standard of living to her family members.

loans.use: to buy a new collection of fancy cloth in different colors and designs.

loans.name: Mahir

texts.en:
Mahir is 29 years old, a married man with a daughter and a son. His wife is a housekeeper and takes care of children. He is a gardener and has been raising such seasonal fruits as pears, peaches and quince for 9 years. He sells his harvest at the local bazaar and gets for this 200 AZN. The members of family are refugees and live in an IDP settlement.

Fruits are in high demand in Azerbaijan. People raise and sell fruits during the whole year. Local people like to go to Mahir’s grocery because harvests there are always fresh and tasty.

Mahir has a big garden but a few trees to collect a harvest from. This results in a lower sales income and makes it difficult for him to cover the demand. He applied for a 1,200 AZN loan in order to buy new trees, expand assortment and increase income.

loans.use: to buy new trees, expand assortment and increase income.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To add to his personal savings and buy some additional computers.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is 46 years old and runs a butchery business in Kisumu town. She is a single mother to 2 children. She has been in this business for the past 21 years and it has been profitable.

She will be using this loan to buy more stock of meat to sell in her business. This will enable her to serve more customers and make more income which she will use to boost her business and also repay the loan.

This is Jane's first loan term with VisionFund Kenya and in future she hopes to grow her business and be successful.

loans.use: To buy more stock of meat to sell.

loans.name: Ada Alicia

texts.es: Ada de 53 años de edad es madre soltera vive con su hija en casa propia, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa para todas las edades, el negocio lo tiene ubicado  en la  mega  plaza que se encuentra cerca de su casa,  con  lo que gana de sus  ventas logra solventar las necesidades de su hogar,  Ada  solicita un crédito para la compra de mas ropa para damas, caballeros y niños todo por mayor para continuar con sus ventas  y tener junto con su hija una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Ada is a 53-year-old single mother who lives with her daughter in her own home. She devotes her time to the sale of clothing for all ages. Her business is located in the mega market near her house. Based on her earnings from the sale of clothing, she is able to pay for the basic necessities in her home. 

Ada is requesting a loan to buy more clothing for women, men and children, all at wholesale prices, to continue with her sales and, together with her daughter, have a better quality of life.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for women, men and children at wholesale prices

loans.name: Naiyar

texts.en:
Naiyar is a married woman and has been running her own beauty parlor for the last four years. She is doing her job passionately; she knows the techniques of makeup and hair styling. She is a well-known beautician in her town. She has slowly but surely improved her business through the support of Kashf Foundation. 

Now she has requested a loan of 55,000 PKR to buy more beauty products for her beauty parlor, including lotions, makeup kits and lightening creams. The loan will enable her to cater to a large number of customers efficiently. She is in her 8th loan cycle with a good credit history.

loans.use: to buy more beauty products for her beauty parlor, including lotions, makeup kits and lightening creams.

loans.name: Kosar

texts.en:
Kosar is a 56-year-old married woman. She started a business doing hand embroidery four years ago. She makes beautiful patterns for the people of her community. Her designs are much in demand and she has managed to consolidate a clientele that allows her to contribute to the expenses of her home. 

To help her to continue her operations, she has requested for a loan of 45,000 PKR to buy reels of threads in different colors and packs of beads, sequins and stones for embellishment. In this way she will be able to cater more customers consistently. She is hopeful to get increase in her income by targeting more customers. She is in her 5th loan cycle with a good credit history.

loans.use: to buy reels of threads in different colors and packs of beads, sequins and stones.

loans.name: Mwana

texts.en:
Mwana is 46 years of age, married and with three kids, all of whom attend school which is the reason of her hard work.  She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. 
	
Mwana operates a business selling lessos from home for the past six years, selling to passersby and neighbours. She cited seasonality and theft as her main problems.  

With the KES 10,000 she wants to purchase lessos for resale at a profit. Her dream is to see her children get better education and become important people in the society.

loans.use: to purchase lessos for resale at a profit.

loans.name: Kungumapoo Shg-Nagamangalam Group

texts.en:
Given its abundance, firewood is a common domestic fuel in India, especially in rural households. Jeyalakshmi, who hails from Nagamangalam of Ariyalur District in Tamil Nadu, cooks food using a makeshift cook stove that runs on firewood. Many women living in her neighborhood are dependent on similar cook stoves and firewood. 

Unfortunately, these women are putting themselves at the brink of contracting fatal lung diseases such as lung cancer, pneumonia, bronchitis, etc., as they inhale a high volume of smoke emanating from burning firewood every day.         

Jeyalakshmi (with hand raised) has teamed up with 14 other women called Kungumapoo Self-Help Group to purchase low-smoke cook stoves available in the market. All these women earn a living by small livelihood activities. Their earnings are not sufficient to purchase the smokeless stoves. So, they wish to seek a loan to buy 15 low-smoke cook stoves.    
 
A loan from you will help them breathe safer air while preparing food for their families.

loans.use: to buy a smokeless stove.

loans.name: Juan Antonio

texts.es: Juan de 30 años de edad vive en casa propia con su mama y sus hermanas viven humildemente y es muy trabajador se dedica a cultivar hortalizas y granos básicos, también se dedica al engorda ganado, comercializa sus productos en los alrededores de la zona, Juan solicita un crédito para invertir en la compra de insumos para el cultivo comprando herbicidas, abonos, fertilizantes, semillas, controles de plagas,  etc. y darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Juan is 30 years old. He lives in his own home with his mother and sisters. They live a simple life. 

He is a hard worker and devotes his time to raising basic vegetables, grains and beans. He also fattens cattle. He sells his produce all around the region. 

Juan is requesting a loan to invest in the purchase of supplies for the crops. He will buy herbicides, manure, fertilizers, seed, pest control, etc. He hopes to give his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: To buy herbicides, manure, fertilizers, seed, pest control, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase an assortment of clothing.

loans.name: Shaiq

texts.en:
Shaiq is a 31-year-old refugee. He lives with his wife, son and daughter in an IDP settlement. His wife is a housekeeper and takes care of children. The only source of income for the family is gardening. Shaiq has been raising and selling seasonal vegetables for 4 years. He raises and sells vegetables at the local bazaar and his monthly income is 240AZN. 

Azerbaijani people like their national cuisine because it’s very rich and delicious. People cook different tasty dishes such as bughlama, badimjan dolmasi, chigirtma and etc. Shaiq sells vegetables such as cucumber, potatoes, tomatoes, greens and so on. Additionally he works as a taxi driver in his free time in order to get some earnings for family.

Shaiq has a lack of water for his garden and his income isn’t enough for a water reserve. He applied for 1,200 AZN loan in order to get a supply of water and be able to harvest properly.

loans.use: to get a supply of water and be able to harvest properly.

loans.name: Zainabu

texts.en:
Zainabu, aged 37 years, is a married woman with four children, all of whom attend school. She lives at her own house that has electricity and piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past two years, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. 

With the loan, she wants to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business

loans.use: to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour.

loans.name: Zuena

texts.en:
Zuena operates a clothes selling business. She sells at the market to dwellers of her town and her neighbours. She appreciates the support of the previous loan that helped her to buy stock for her business. She cites her major challenge to be seasonality. Zuena dreams of establishing a boutique in the future.

With the loan she is requesting she wants to purchase two bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase two bales of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Alaa

texts.en: Alaa is a 23-year-old university student majoring in Air Conditioning Engineering, and he is in his third year. He lives with his family that consists of three members in Jordan. Alaa is seeking to find a job in his field after graduating so that he will start supporting his family financially. Now he is requesting a loan to pay for his upcoming semester fees.

loans.use: To pay for his upcoming semester fees

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy corn and firewood.

loans.name: Shatha

texts.en:
Shatha is a 24-year-old university student majoring in General Business, and she is in her fourth year. She lives with her family which consists of six members. Her father is a driving instructor. 

Shatha is only one step away from reaching her aim of working in her field after graduation. But now she doesn't have enough money to pay for her upcoming semester fees. For that reason, she has applied for this loan.

loans.use: To pay her upcoming semester fees.

loans.name: Safia

texts.en:
Safia is a 44-year-old married woman. She has 6 children. A year ago she started business selling cloth to provide financial support to her husband in meeting their household expenses. Safia buys cloth in various fabrics, in different colors and designs from the market at wholesale rates and then sells them to the people of her community. She has a varied customer base and is able to earn enough through her business. 

Now she has requested a loan of 50,000 PKR to buy a wide variety of cloth in different colors and designs to attract more customers and expand her business. She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan. She expects a boost in her earnings with the loan and plans to spend part of her profits on the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to buy a wide variety of cloth in different colors and designs.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Andres Lino

texts.es:
Andres es un hombre de 34 años de edad, casado, tiene 3 hijos varones (5,2,1), y su negocio es la elaboración y venta de pan.
Él es una persona emprendedora, innovador, perseverante, paciente, responsable y muy trabajador. Su trabajo lo realiza en la zona de Villa Juliana un área caracterizada por ser el espacio de comunicación con la cuidad de La Paz , porque al transcurrir los años se pobló por personas que se reubican (migrantes del campo) al no encontrar espacio para habitar en la hoyada (La Paz), la crisis económica que vivía el país repercute en el área rural empujando a sus habitantes hacia la migración del campo a la ciudad desde la provincias Ingavi, Pacajes, Los Andes, Omasuyos y Manco Kapac predominantemente. 
Andres es de tez morena, cabello corto negro, estatura mediana, su lengua materna es el aymara, el cual utiliza para comunicarse dentro de su entorno familiar y también con algunos clientes de su zona, utiliza el español para el resto. Su negocio es una panadería ubicada en la casa de sus suegros, donde habitan la familia de su cuñado, sus suegros y su familia de cinco integrantes. Su experiencia de más de 15 años como ayudante de panadero lo ha llevado a independizarse y con la ayuda de su esposa realizó la compra de un horno industrial. Cada mañana unos minutos después de amanecer, Andres de dirige (con su carrito de dos ruedas) cargado de canastas llenas de pan, a las tiendas de sus clientes, les deja las canastas en la puerta y rápidamente continúa su recorrido (caminando) para volver a su panadería y realizar la misma labor por otros barrios.
Él sueña ampliar su panadería y tener más ayudantes para llegar a más clientes. Por el momento su negocio necesita material de trabajo como harina blanca, manteca, leche y otros insumos. Su deseo es generar mejores ingresos económicos realizando la compra de harina (y otros insumos) por mayor.
Es por esos motivos que Andres solicita un préstamo para la compra de harina por mayor y con los beneficios pagar los estudios de sus tres hijos.
texts.en:
Andres is 34 years old, a husband, and a father of three young boys, ages five, two, and one. He also runs a bakery in Villa Juliana, near city of La Paz, where he prepares and sells bread. Andres, his wife, and their three children share a home with her parents, her brother, and his family. 

Andres is a creative, tenacious, patient, and hardworking businessman. His bakery is in an area that has become linked to the city of La Paz. Bolivia’s economic troubles have hit the provinces of Ingavi, Pacajes, Los Andes, Omasuyos and Manco Kapac hard, and driving rural residents to the capital. Migrants from the countryside have arrived and been unable to find a place to live in the capital, so many have settled in Villa Juliana. 

Andres has a brown complexion, short hair, and is of medium height. His native language is Aymara, which he speaks with his family and with some of his customers. Andres is fully bilingual and can speak to anyone in Spanish. 

The bakery is located in the home of his wife’s parents. Andres worked in a bakery for over 15 years before going into business for himself, and, with his wife’s help, purchased an industrial oven. Every morning just before sunrise, he goes out on his motorbike, carrying baskets filled with bread, and makes deliveries to his customers. He quickly dismounts, leaves the bread at the customer’s door, then rushes to his next delivery. Andres then returns to the bakery to prepare more bread for customers in other neighborhoods. 

Andres hopes to expand his bakery and employ a larger staff so he can reach more customers. The bakery now needs wholesale supplies, such as white flour, butter, milk, and other ingredients. Andres is hopeful that investing in these goods will boost his income, and is therefore applying for a loan. He will use the additional income from the bakery to pay for his children’s education.

loans.use: to purchase flour wholesale and use the income from his bakery to pay for his children's education.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a 25-year-old  woman married to Simon who adds additional income to support the welfare of their family. They are blessed with two children. Mary operates an office supplies business, as well as a local money transfer business as a secondary business, which have been in operation for five years, earning her an income of 10,000 KES at the end of every month.

Mary is now servicing her third loan of 30,000 KES with VisionFund Kenya and intends to buy writing pads, files, printing paper and envelopes to sell to her customers.

Mary plans to use the anticipated income to educate her children and be able to further their education to higher levels, and she hopes to become a successful business woman.

loans.use: to buy writing pads, files, printing paper and envelopes to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Dúo Cantares Group

texts.es: Dúo Cantares este grupo esta conformado por la señora Keny Carola de 22 años de edad,ella se dedica a la venta ropa nueva, ya hace varios años que se dedica a esta actividad, gracias al apoyo de su familia y la de kiva, en esta oportunidad ella esta solicitando este credito para la compra de ropa para la venta, esperando que nuevamente le puedan ayuda con su negocio.
texts.en:
The Dúo Cantares group is made up of Keny Carola, age 22. She devotes her time to the sale of new clothing. She has been involved in this business for several years now, thanks to the support of her family and Kiva. 

This time she is requesting a loan to buy clothes to sell. She hopes that you will once again be able to help her with her business.

loans.use: To buy clothes to sell

loans.name: Biasha

texts.en:
Biasha appreciates the previous loan that helped her expand her business.

Biasha operates a fruits and vegetables selling stall; she sells at the market to town dwellers and neighbours. She faces a challenge of competition and seasonality in her business. 

With the KES 20,000 Biasha wants to purchase sacks of fruits, oranges, bananas and green vegetables for resale. She dreams of expanding and establishing a retail shop in the future.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of fruits, oranges, bananas and green vegetables for resale

loans.name: Amina

texts.en: Amina thanks Yehu and Kiva at large for the support they have been giving her and she has managed to grow in her business. Here again she comes to you requesting a loan of 20,000 KES to purchase extra seats for business continuity since the demand is now increasing as time goes by.

loans.use: to purchase extra seats for her business (chair rentals)

loans.name: Asesewa Group

texts.en:
The group Asesewa is located in Teshie-Accra, Ghana and is a group of five very active women who, above all, want to better their quality of life. They are selling rice and stew, tea and bread, cooking oil, gari (cassava flour), secondhand clothing, underwear, diapers, noodles and kerosene.

Irene is 39 years old and married with 2 children who range in age from 4 years to 17 years. She is a member of the group and is very excited to begin a seventh loan cycle with ID-Ghana, Teshie branch. Irene sells secondhand clothing, underwear, diapers and kerosene. Her business income is able only to pay for the costs of maintaining her home. She is requesting a new loan in order to buy more secondhand clothing, underwear, diapers and kerosene to cover all of her customer demands because without more investment capital, she feels that her own income is not sufficient. 

Besides the loans, Irene and the other members of Asesewa also benefit from a combination of loans and education (training). The loan officer and the training officer share timely and useful information with the members on a variety of subjects like health, hygiene and nutrition as well as self-esteem and violence against women. The members learn about effective business management practices and customer service, as well as gain essential knowledge about business planning, customer service, marketing and pricing. All of these subjects help them better their lives both economically and developmentally.

loans.use: To buy more secondhand clothing, underwear, diapers and kerosene to cover all of her customer demands.

loans.name: Balqees

texts.en:
Balqees is 48 years old, a married woman and mother of six children. The man shown in the photo is Balqees’s husband, who is a driver by profession and provides transportation services using his three-wheeled rickshaw. He has been driving a rickshaw for many years to meet the family's expenses, but now the rickshaw requires proper maintenance to keep it in its functional routine. For this reason, Balqees has applied for a loan of 40,000 PKR, for her husband. He wants to buy new tires with some auto spare parts for his vehicle. This will help him drive more smoothly and provide better transport service to his passengers. 

Balqees is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her husband and will bring positive changes to his business.

loans.use: to buy new tires with some auto spare parts.

loans.name: Salma

texts.en:
Salma, a 39-year-old married woman, runs a small boutique at home to provide for her family. She purchases cloth from the market at low prices, sewing and then selling it to the people of her locality. She always has a great product selection to offer, and she earns a good income that contributes to her family's well-being. 

For the improvement of her business, Salma has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR to buy a greater variety of cloth and spools of thread in various colors. These purchases will allow her to fulfill the demands of her customers on time. With a good credit history, this will be Salma’s sixth loan.

loans.use: to buy a greater variety of cloth and spools of thread in various colors.

loans.name: José Ismael

texts.es:
José de 28 años de edad, no estudió por el nivel de pobreza que había en su  familia, por lo cual tenía que trabajar para ayudar con los gastos del hogar, ahora está acompañado y tiene 2 hijos, los cuales todavía no estudian. 

José siempre se ha dedicado a la agricultura, específicamente a la siembra de sandía, maíz y maicillo, él tiene que caminar 2 km para llegar a su trabajo. 

Este crédito lo necesita para pagar la mano de obra, comprar el abono y hacer la limpieza del cultivo. 

Su sueño es que sus hijos estudien y se preparen.
texts.en:
Jose is 28 years old and didn't go to school because of his family's level of poverty. Because of this he had to work to help with the household expenses. Now he has a partner and 2 children who haven't gone to school yet. 

Jose always worked in agriculture, specifically harvesting watermelon, corn, and sorghum. He has to walk 2 km to get to work. He needs this loan to pay for labor, to buy fertilizer, and to clean his crops. His dream is for his children to study and be prepared.

loans.use: to pay for labor, to buy fertilizer, and to clean his crops

loans.name: Malika

texts.ru: Малика трудолюбивая женщина. Ей 41 года. Она вдова и имеет одного сына. Ее сыну 21 года. Малика более чем 5 лет занимается изготовлением и продажей самбуса. Она изготавливает самбуса у себя дома и продает на местном рынке, где она имеет торговую точку. Малика с бизнесом справляется сама и является единственным кормильцем семьи. Ее сын болен и Малика лечит ее. Она данное время она не имеет денег для покупки лекарства. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 5000 сомони для покупки лекарства для лечения сына. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Malika is a hardworking woman. She is 41, widowed, and has a son who is 21 years old. Malika has been making and selling sambusa for over five years. She prepares them at home and sells them at the local market, where she has a sales point. Malika runs the business herself and is the only breadwinner in the family. Her son is ill and Malika takes care of him, but she does not have enough money to buy his medicine. She has applied for a loan of 5,000 somoni to buy medicine for her son. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: To buy medicine for her son

loans.name: Elchin

texts.en:
Elchin is a married man with two children, a boy and a girl. His wife is pregnant and soon his third child will born. Elchin has a car and he is working as taxi driver. Also he configures water heating systems, combis, etc. He transport combis and other devices with his car, but a while ago his car damaged. 

To repair his car, he needs a loan in the amount of 700 AZN. This is his second loan and the previous loan was paid successfully. Elchin says great thanks for repeated loans from the Kiva organization

loans.use: to repair the car used in his business.

loans.name: Eghisapet

texts.en:
Eghisapet is an experienced farmer from Shaghap village in the Ararat region. She lives with her son, daughter-in-law and  one-year-old grandson. 

Eghisapet is the main breadwinner of the family. Her salary, however, is not enough to effectively meet her family's needs. To be able to cover those needs, Eghisapet is also engaged in breeding livestock (calves and hens) and in the cultivation of barley and tomatoes. She sells the agricultural products in the local market, and this is a very important source of the family's income. Her son assists her greatly in everyday activities related to farming. 

Eghisapet currently needs to make some investments in her agribusiness in order for it to function in a sustainable way. She needs a loan of 3,000 USD to purchase fertilizer, fuel, and forage for the livestock. She has taken a loan from a local financial institution before, but unfortunately wasn't able to pay it back. However, thanks to the hard work during recent times, Eghisapet was able to run her agribusiness in a sustainable way, ensuring that she will be able to cover the monthly payments. So, she has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The second-chance loan program provides loans to people who have a bad credit history and have no access to credit products. 

Eghisapet and her family rely on the goodwill of the lenders, and will be thankful to them for helping the family to maintain their agribusiness.

loans.use: to pay for fertilizer, pesticides, fuel, and forage for the livestock.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy cement, sand, gravel and PVC pipes to change the gray water pipes and fix the bathroom in her home.

loans.name: Amigos Del Milenio Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “AMIGOS DEL MILENIO”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.                                                                                                                                                                                             
La socia Sonia continua con su negocio de imprenta, la socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete  a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas, la socia lleva años dedicándose a este negocio el cual le tare satisfacciones tanto económicas como personales, la socia es una persona responsable, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el préstamo para la compra de tintas, papeles entre otros.
Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de ferretería, venta de productos de belleza, llamadas telefónicas, venta de productos de belleza, trabajadores del sector privado.
La persona que sale con la cara tapada no pertenece al banco comunal.
texts.en:
These are the members of the “Amigos del Milenio” Communal Bank. This bank is located in the district of Cusco, within the province of Cusco and the department of Cusco.

The member, Sonia, continues with her printing business. She feels grateful for the loan that she has been granted, and she promises to make her payments on time. She has devoted herself to this business for years; and it gives her both economic and personal satisfaction.  She is a responsible person, and this is the way that she provides for her family.

She is requesting the loan for the purchase of ink and paper, among other items. 

The other members earn their livings with a hardware business, by selling beauty products, by selling phone calls, and by working in the private sector. 

The person whose face is covered does not belong to the communal bank.

loans.use: to purchase ink and paper, among other items.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is a 54-year-old man married to Philemona who adds additional income to support their family. They have been blessed with four children. 

David has been a shoe cobbler for a period of ten years, earning himself an income of 8,000 KES at the end of every month.

David is now servicing his fifth loan of 10,000 KES with VisionFund Kenya and intends to use this amount to purchase leather shoes and some glue, which he needs to facilitate his daily work.

David plans to use the anticipated income to open a shoe shop and hopes to have a bright future with a successful life.

loans.use: to buy glue and leather shoes to sell to his customers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay school fees for her child.

loans.name: Ann

texts.en:
Ann is a married woman. She has four children. She describes herself to be loyal. She operates a retail business where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for four years. Her business is located in a strategic place. 

Ann describes her biggest business challenge to be price fluctuations. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more stock of clothes. Her business goal is to have a fully sufficient boutique within five years. She will use the anticipated profits to enlarge her boutique.

loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes

loans.name: Asia

texts.en:
Asia appreciates the previous loan that helped her expand her business.

She has operated a beauty salon business for the past year, her potential customers mostly being ladies. In addition she also operates a retail shop business, which earns her an additional source of livelihood. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of business. 

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase a stock of hair dryer machines for her beauty salon business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business

loans.use: to purchase a stock of hair dryer machines for her beauty salon business.

loans.name: Hadija

texts.en:
Hadija is married and has two children, both of whom attend school. She lives in a rental house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Hadija has operated a food selling business, making dumplings and flat bread for sale. She sells from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. 

With the KES 15,000 loan, Hadija wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, cooking fat and sugar. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, cooking fat and sugar

loans.name: Shorouq

texts.en: Shorouq is 22 years old. She lives in Jordan with her family that consists of five members. Shorouq is a single university student, majoring in Applied Chemistry, and she is in her fourth year. She is hoping to get a job in her field of study after getting her bachelors degree, and she is only one step away from that. Now Shorouq is requesting a loan that will help her pay for her upcoming semester fees.

loans.use: to pay for her upcoming semester fees.

loans.name: Krobo Bukum Group

texts.en:
The group Krobor Bukom is located in Teshie-Accra, Ghana and is a group of four very active women who, above all, want to better their quality of life. They are selling earrings, necklaces, maize, cosmetics and second-hand clothing.
