Grace is 44 years old and a single mother of two children, 19 and 22 years old. She is a member of the group and is very excited to begin a sixth loan cycle with ID-Ghana, Teshie branch. Grace sells maize. Her business income is able only to pay for the costs of maintaining her home. She is requesting a new loan in order to buy three sacks of maize to cover all of her customer demand because without more investment capital, she feels that her own income is not sufficient. 

Besides the loans, Grace and the other members of Krobor Bukom also benefit from a combination of loans and education (training). The loan officer and the training officer share timely and useful information with the members on a variety of subjects like health, hygiene, and nutrition as well as self-esteem and violence against women. The members learn about effective business management practices and customer service, as well as gaining essential knowledge about business planning, customer service, marketing and pricing. All of these subjects help them better their lives both economically and developmentally.

loans.use: To buy three sacks of maize to cover all of her customer demand.

loans.name: Edward

texts.en:
Hello! Introducing Edward, a 40-year-old father who is full of energy and a very hard worker. He hails from the Kapsowar area of Kenya, an area with good and favorable weather patterns that support farming. He is a father of two children who are under his care from his marriage. Edward completed his secondary school education thanks to the financial support and effort of his parents, but never advanced. This never killed the spirit he had for succeeding in life. 

Edward has been farming for the past two years, and through mixed farming, he has been able to take care of his family. He loves dairy farming and has even nicknamed one of his cows 'Lelmet' (from a person's name). Although Edward passionately loves farming, he faces the challenge of water shortages. Most of the rain water goes to waste, which is why he is seeking a loan to buy a water tank and water pipes. Edward comes from an area where there is no piped water. Therefore this water tank will assist him to harvest water during the rainy seasons and also to store water for home consumption. Harvested water will assist Edward to irrigate his farm, ensuring that there is a constant production of crops. 

This loan will turn the life of Edward around as he will no longer have to walk long distances in search of water, hence saving more time and generating the energy and time to his farm. This loan will help Edward's wife (Emmy) because she will no longer have to walk for hours in search of this precious commodity.

loans.use: to buy a water tank and water pipes.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is a 52-year-old man married to Rose who adds additional income to support their family. They are blessed with three children.  Peter has been operating a restaurant business for ten years, earning himself an income of KES. 8,000 at the end of every month.

Peter is now servicing his fifth loan of KES. 10,000 with VisionFund Kenya and intends to use this amount to buy milk, bread, rice, wheat and maize flour and soft drinks to add to his current stock which seems to be running out.

Peter plans to use the profits he earns to expand her wife's green grocery business and educate his children.  He hopes to be a successful businessman and grow in his business.

loans.use: To buy milk, bread, rice, wheat flour, maize flour and soft drinks

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Hello, Kiva lenders! Meet Elizabeth, a 50-year-old youthful shosho (old mum), very hardworking, honest, and ever smiling mother of four children. She lives with her husband in a remote village in Kapsowar, in the Rift valley region of Kenya. 

Elizabeth passionately loves farming. She has been farming for the past five years and has always managed to provide for her family. Feeding the large family she has requires a lot of hard work and determination. Her other sources of income are crops and some personal business that she does in order to provide food for her large family. 

In farming, she enjoys the returns she gets but is challenged to maintain a good standard of living. Elizabeth has identified free space in her farm and wants to fully utilize this space by keeping a good quality dairy cow. Dairy farming in Kenya is a very profitable venture and the price of milk in the recent past has been going up, so Elizabeth, being a visionary and entrepreneurial woman, wants to take full advantage of this. She has chosen the breed of cow that she will keep, and she learned that she will not only get milk from the cow but also manure and this will boost the fertility of her farm. Selling the milk will never be a problem because there is a ready market and she will also sell to big dairy processing firms. 

Elizabeth said she chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan because they offer agriculture-based loans and their interest rate is low and on a reducing basis. She underwent training through Juhudi Kilimo and from the training she learned that saving is a continuous process in many micro-finance institutions. 

Elizabeth hopes that through the accumulated profit she will be able to start adding value to her milk by starting services such as packaging and the production of other dairy products. This loan will change her life and will secure the future of her  school-going children. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: To buy a quality breed of dairy cow

loans.name: Luz Dary

texts.es: A sus 51 años de edad Luz es madre soltera y  tiene 6 hijos, mismos que ya son mayores de edad, Luz vive con una hija y 3 nietas,  Luz se dedica al jornal del trabajo en el  campo y a la crianza de animales menores, ella se dedica a la crianza de pollos desde hace 4 años, el crédito lo necesita para comprar pollos y de esta manera mejorar su negocio, también desea adecuar los galpones para criar sus pollos, lo que Luz aspira es readecuar los galpones  y por medio los ingresos  de su trabajo diario y su negocio  comprarse un terreno donde pueda sembrar algún producto para ayudar a su hija y sus nietas.
texts.en: Luz is a 51-year-old, single mother of six adult children who lives with one of her daughters and three granddaughters. Luz works as a day laborer on farms and ranches, and specializes in the care of small animals. She has also raised chickens for the past four years. She is applying for a loan to purchase more chickens and to renovate the shed that houses her flock. Luz will use the income from her day work and her business to purchase a plot of land where she can grow crops and earn additional income for her daughter and granddaughters.

loans.use: to purchase chickens.

loans.name: Bayan

texts.en: Bayan is a 21-year-old ambitious young lady living with her family in Jordan. Her father works at a governmental entity. Bayan is a diploma student, and she is seeking to find a good job after getting her bachelors degree so that she can start supporting her family financially in the future. Because she currently doesn't have enough money to pay for her upcoming semester fees, she has applied for this loan.

loans.use: to pay for her upcoming semester fees.

loans.name: Mwanamjaka

texts.en:
Mwanamjaka is 24 years old, married, and has been blessed with two children, 3 years old and eight months old. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

For the past four years, she has operated a retail shop business, selling household consumables to local customers. She faces a major challenge of high cost of transportation to her place of operation. 

With the Kshs 50,000 she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, beans, maize flour, and soft drinks. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, beans, maize flour, soft drinks and a freezer

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase a horse wagon.

loans.name: Alvaro German

texts.es: German es un joven trabajador, vive en el campo con sus padres y hermanos, sus padres tienen bajos recursos económicos y German desea trabajar para salir adelante y apoyar a sus padres en agradecimiento que por lo menos la alimentación no le hizo falta aunque no les alcanzo para darle la educación a él y a ninguno de sus hermanos, German se dedica al jornal en la agricultura, y tiene una paqueña huerta de papas a medias con un amigo, el crédito lo necesita para invertir en la compra de abono para ponerle a sus plantas y así pueda tener buena cosecha y ayudar a mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
German is a young worker.  He lives in the countryside with his parents and siblings.  His parents have few economic resources, and German wants to work in order to get ahead and help his parents as a way to thank them for providing him with food even though they did not have enough to provide him or his siblings with an education.  German works as a farmer, and he has a small potato garden that he shares with a friend.

He is in need of this loan to purchase fertilizer that he will apply to his plants so that he can have a better harvest and help to improve his family's quality of life.

loans.use: purchase fertilizer.

loans.name: Solomon

texts.en:
Solomon is a married man. He has two children. He describes himself to be ambitious. He operates a retail business where he sells electronics. He has been involved in this business for five years. His business is in a developed location. 

Solomon describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of finances. He will use the Kes 30,000 loan to buy more stock of electronics. His business goal is to be a supplier within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will have a stable business to enable him to sustain his family. This is his third loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. His previous loans were repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy more stock of electronics

loans.name: Sadek

texts.en:
Sadek is 29 years old, a single man and a father of two children. Sadek studied till Elementary education. Due to the miserable conditions of his family, Sadek couldn't complete his studies. He didn't surrender to the miserable conditions of his family, but strives to improve the living standard of his family. He has a good reputation among his neighbors. They describe him as a kind and hardworking young man. 

Previously, he worked in one of his neighbors' grocery. Over time, he was able to accumulate a good amount of money and started his own business which is a small grocery. He started his own business more than five years ago. The working capital of his grocery increased more and more. He started this business with a small amount of capital. Thanks to Sadek's hard work, he has been able to develop and expand his merchandise. The profits from this business have allowed Sadek to expand his sales volume. 

For the purpose of further developing his business, Sadek turned to Al-Amal Microfinance Bank. He is requesting a Youth loan of 500,000 YER to buy more foodstuffs to be able to meet the demand of his customers.

Sadek plans to invest the earnings from the loan to further increase his business. He also intends to expand his business more in order to provide his family with a lot of money.

loans.use: to buy more foodstuffs to be able to meet the demand of his customers.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is a married woman and has children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

For the past three years, she has operated a cereals shop business, selling to her neighbors and passersby. She mentioned seasonality and theft as her major challenges. Josephine dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the 25,000 KES loan, she wants to purchase bags of maize, rice and beans for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bags of maize, rice and beans for resale.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary has a beauty salon business in Kisumu town and she has been running it for the past five years. She is 42 years old, married and together with her spouse they have been blessed with four children. Right now her current monthly income is 35,000 KES. 

She will be using this loan to install electricity in her home. She will use the anticipated profits to expand her business. 

This is her third loan term and she paid her previous loans successfully. In the future, Mary hopes to grow her business and be successful.

loans.use: to install electricity.

loans.name: Benjamin

texts.en:
Meet Benjamin, a father of two who practices mixed farming in Nandi Hills, Kenya. He has been in this business for 44 years! He makes a living farming and selling his produce, which includes milk, eggs and crops, at the local market. He also offers transportation services on his motorcycle besides engaging in other businesses for extra income.

Benjamin spends most of his time pasturing his cows. Currently though, he is facing a big challenge of transporting feed from the store to the animal shed.  

Today, Benjamin is seeking a loan to purchase cereals. Farm supplies are increasingly becoming expensive by the day. Farmers who seek cheaper sources end up buying ‘fake’ seeds that either do not germinate or the do not produce quality seeds. With your loan, Benjamin is going to afford seeds for planting from recommended sources to ensure his crops grow healthy and productive.

Profits made from this harvest will be reinvested into the business for growth. When asked “How will this loan benefit your family?” Benjamin replied, “I will start a cereals business which will increase my family’s cash flow.”

loans.use: to purchase cereal seeds.

loans.name: Gregoria Catarina

texts.es: La señora Gregoria Catarina de 29 años tiene dos hijos (9 y 4 ) y este es su segundo crédito que ella solicita, ella  se dedica a la venta de jabón y bancos  ambulantemente ya que ella con  su esposo se dedican a venderlos en los mercados de distintos municipios de Guatemala ya llevan más de 1 y medio vendiendo ella solicita un nuevo crédito para comprar más mercadería ya que necesitan más capital para invertir ya que han logrado incrementar sus ventas porque los productos que distribuyen lo venden a un menor costos que en otros tiendas, su sueño y es lograr tener un ahorro ya que desean darle una mejor educación a sus  hijos que están pequeños y darles un mejor futuro en su vida, ella agradece por el apoyo que se les brindo ya que ha podido mejorar su negocio y solicita su apoyo nuevamente.
texts.en:
Señora Gregoria Catarina is 29 years old, married, and the mother of two children, ages 9 and 4. She and her husband sell soap and cleaning products in markets and on the streets of Antigua and surrounding towns. The couple has run this business for over a year and a half. Señora Gregoria Catarina is applying for a second loan so she can purchase more merchandise. She and her husband have increased their sales as they offer their customers lower prices than they can find in stores. 

Señora Gregoria Catarina hopes to build savings as she and her husband want to ensure that their young children receive an education and a better life. She is grateful for the support of lenders, which has already allowed her to improve her business and motivated her to apply for a second loan.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise to sell (soap and cleaning products).

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past four years, she has owned a food stall business, where neighbors and town dwellers are her potential customers. 

With the 50,000 KES loan, she wants to purchase stock of goods to sell, such as sugar, rice, maize, wheat flour and cooking fat.

loans.use: to purchase stock of goods to sell, such as sugar, rice, maize, wheat flour and cooking fat.

loans.name: Annah

texts.en:
Annah appreciates the previous loan that helped her expand her business.	

For the past three years, she has operated a clothing and shoe selling business, selling at the market to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of stiff competition in her business. She dreams of expanding and establishing a boutique business in the future. 

With the loan that she is requesting of 10,000 KES, she wants to purchase bales of clothes and shoes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes and shoes for resale.

loans.name: Mwanamkuu

texts.en: Mwanamkuu is grateful for the Kiva support because Kiva and Yehu have helped her in life to make ends meet with the loan she got. She is very thankful. Here again she comes to you requesting another loan of KES 15,000 to buy potatoes, wheat flour, maize flour and cooking fat for her business.

loans.use: to buy potatoes, wheat flour, maize flour and cooking fat for her business

loans.name: Merita

texts.en: Merita previously used a loan to buy onion and potato seeds for planting. This past year, she also built a little variety type of store in the city of Korca and she needs your financial help again to buy inventory items for the store. Merita wanted to thank all her lenders for their help and wish them 'happy season' ahead.

loans.use: to buy inventory items for her store.

loans.name: Tariq

texts.en: Tariq is a 23-year-old university student in his third year. He lives in Jordan with his family, which consists of five family members. He also works in the evenings at a clothing store. Tariq wants to start his own business in his field of study in the future after getting his bachelors degree. However, he is currently facing financial problems that are stopping him from paying his upcoming semester fees. For that reason, he has applied for this loan and is asking for your help.

loans.use: to pay for his upcoming semester fees.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: La joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por  tener 21 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riego, se dedica a la venta de medicina natural desde hace algunos años, su negocio lo tiene ubicado cerca de su lugar de residencia, la joven vive con su compañero de vida quien también le ayuda en el negocio, ellos son conocidos como muy trabajadores y responsable, con lo que gana de sus ventas logra solventar las necesidades de su hogar, la joven solicita un crédito para la compra de mas medicina natural por mayor y continuar con sus ventas que le generan buenas ganancias y asi tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: The young person who has her face pixelated is 21 years old and lives in a high risk area. She has been working selling natural medicine for some years. Her business is located near her place of residence. She lives with her life companion who also helps her in the business. They are known as hardworking and responsible. They are able to meet the household necessities with the income from their sales. She is asking for a loan in order to buy more natural medicine at wholesale in order to continue sales that generate good earnings and therefore to have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy more natural medicine at wholesale for her business

loans.name: Adila

texts.en:
Adila is a 51-year-old refugee with a daughter and two sons. She lives with her husband and children in an IDP (Internally Displaced Persons) settlement. Adila’s husband is a laborer, but the main source of the family’s income is husbandry. Adila's monthly income is 210 AZN.

Husbandry is very popular in Azerbaijan. People breed cows and sell dairy products because such products are in high demand. Adila has been breeding cows for 30 years and has good experience in this profession. She has three cows; she breeds and fattens them and then sells dairy products at the local bazaar.

A refugee’s life is very hard and Adila and her husband can hardly cover the family’s needs. Adila applied for a 1,500 AZN loan in order to repair a cow stall and buy one additional cow. She will sell more dairy products and be able to increase income for family.

loans.use: to repair a cow stall and buy one additional cow.

loans.name: Mirna Antonia

texts.es:
Mirna de 29 años de edad, estudió hasta bachillerato, está separada de su esposo y vive junto a sus padres, tiene solo un hijo y depende de ella.

Mirna trabaja en una industria de productos derivados del atún, ella se desempeña pelando pescado, viaja todos los días en la tarde para ir trabajar y sale al siguiente día en la madrugada. Aparte de esto, Mirna se dedica al comercio de productos de belleza como perfumes, jabones, cremas etc. y también poseen junto con su madre una pequeña tienda de artículos para el hogar. 

El préstamo solicitado lo necesita para comprar productos como arroz, gaseosas, azúcar, café, etc. para la tienda que posee en la casa.
Mirna sueña con seguir trabajando en su empleo por muchos años, e ir invirtiendo el dinero que gane en su negocio familiar, y de esta manera llegar a tener una excelente situación de vida.
texts.en:
Mirna, age 29, has completed secondary school. She is separated from her husband and she lives with her parents; she only has one dependent child.

Mirna works in a tuna fish processing plant, skinning fish. She goes to work every day in the afternoon and returns in the early morning hours on the following day.  In addition to this, she works selling beauty products such as perfumes, soaps, creams, etc.; and along with her mother, she also has a small general store.

She needs the loan in order to purchase products such as rice, soft drinks, sugar, coffee, etc., for the store that she has in the house.

Mirna dreams of continuing to work at her job for many years and investing her earnings in her family business, so that she can achieve an excellent standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase products such as rice, soft drinks, sugar, coffee, etc., for the store that she has in her house.

loans.name: Faith

texts.en:
Faith is a 23-year-old single lady who has been running a grocery stall for a period of five years, earning an income of KES 8,000 at the end of every month.

Faith was introduced to VisionFund Kenya by a Credit Officer and is now servicing her first loan of KES 10,000. She intends to use the entire amount to buy cabbages, green vegetables, carrots and fruits to sell to her customers.

She plans to use the anticipated income to open a retail shop and hopes to have a bright future with a lot of success.

loans.use: To buy cabbages, tomatotoes, carrots, green vegetables and fruits to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cement, sand, gravel, bricks, and iron in order to construct a room at her home

loans.name: Dúo Efecios Group

texts.es: Dúo Efecios La encargada de este grupo es la señora Ruth Maribel quien tiene una venta de shampoo, jabón, pañales desechables, cremas, desde hace 3 años ubicado en el mercado de su pueblo.  Tiene la necesidad de comprar más producto para su tienda, pero el dinero que tiene no le alcanza por tal motivo necesita hacer nuevamente otro préstamo para poder comprar los productos que le hacen falta en su negocio.  Su sueño sigue siendo tener un local propio para ya no seguir arrendando y crecer con el negocio cada día.  Cuenta con el apoyo incondicional de su esposo y sus hijos.
texts.en:
Ruth Maribel is in charge of this group, Dúo Efecios.  She has sold shampoo, soap, disposable diapers, and lotions in the town market for three years.

She needs to buy more products for her store.  She doesn't have enough money, though, so she needs to request another loan to be able to buy the products she needs for her business.

Her dream is still to have her own store so she won't have to rent anymore, and so she can grow every day with her business.  She has the unconditional support of her husband and children.

loans.use: to buy shampoo, soap, disposable diapers, lotions, and other products

loans.name: Samson

texts.en:
HELLO LENDERS! Meet 23-year-old Samson, a very young, hard-working and energetic farmer. He hails from the Kapsowar area of Kenya, an area that is blessed with good climatic conditions and favorable weather patterns that favor farming. 

Samson is still single and has been doing farming for the past two years. He was raised in a humble family, and he never got the opportunity to go to college because of a lack of tuition funds. As a result of this, he never got any formal employment - but he didn’t surrender to that. He started farming, and through farming he has been able to take care of himself and also to take care of his aging parents. 

Samson's source of income are vegetables, milk, and eggs; these products are very perishable and require timely delivery to the market, but one problem that he faces is delivering to the market on time.  Kapsowar area has bad terrain, poor road networks and poor feeder roads that really hamper timely delivery of products to the market; that is why Samson is kindly seeking a loan to buy a motorbike. Through the motorbike he will deliver products to the market on time and reap more profits because the products will still be fresh. 

Samson is very determined to succeed and because he is very disciplined with finances, he plans that through accumulated profits he will be able to provide a secure future for himself and also for his parents. His dream is to save more profits and go back to school, study hard and be an agricultural extension officer; with your loan he is sure of realizing his dream. 

Help Samson realize his dream by investing in him through this loan!

loans.use: To buy a motorbike

loans.name: Sitidia

texts.en:
Sitidia is 30 years old and has been in the business for four years. She lives in Kasese Uganda and earns additional income from farming.  

Sitidia is a hard working woman with a dream of buying land and educating her children. However, her dream is shattered by limited capital and competition. 

Sitidia will use the money to buy second hand dresses, shirts, trousers and blouses for sale.

loans.use: to buy second hand dresses, shirts, trousers, and blouses for sale.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Three years ago Florence started farming on a small inherited piece of land in Kipsaiya, a remote village in the Kapsowar area of Kenya. Today, this humble mother of four children sells milk, eggs and a variety of food crops. She is a passionate farmer and, because of the immense knowledge she has on farming, she commands a lot of respect from other farmers in her village.Taking care of her poultry is an activity that she finds very enjoyable, and feeding her poultry is her hobby. 

Poultry farming is a very profitable business venture in the Kapsowar area. Florence has good knowledge of the market and has been taking advantage of the ready market - the demand is very high. Being a visionary woman, she has always wanted to increase her poultry, so now she is seeking a loan to buy additional poultry. 

Accessing financial services for women is very difficult, but through institutions such as Kiva, enterprising women like Florence can achieve their dreams and goals. Florence believes that the key to increased egg production is proper feeding and good care. By ensuring that the poultry are fed well, she is guaranteed to reap the benefits. 

In addition to selling eggs and poultry meat, she will also sell poultry feathers that are commonly used to make earrings. The increased income will be used to improve her living conditions and to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy additional poultry

loans.name: Naira

texts.en:
Naira is a student living in Haytagh village, Armavir region. She lives with her parents and studies in University to become a pedagogue. She currently is in her second year of study and is a very hard-working girl. 

By applying for this loan, Naira asks lenders to support her with her tuition fee. She will be very thankful if lenders support her studies and give her an opportunity to continue her higher education.

loans.use: to pay for university tuition

loans.name: Benon

texts.en: Benon is a 33-year-old married man with three children and three dependents. He is a farmer and also has a produce store selling maize and beans. Benon faces the problem of limited capital, but hopes to educate his children. He is requesting a loan to buy maize, beans and cassava flour for resell

loans.use: to buy maize, beans and cassava flour to sell.

loans.name: Reina Isabel

texts.es:
Reina de 54 años de edad, estudió hasta bachillerato, está casada y tiene 4 hijos pero solo dos viven con ella.

Reina es una mujer emprendedora, ella posee un negocio de venta de carne de res, de queso y crema, los cuales obtiene de su pequeña ganadería. Sus dos hijos se levantan en la madrugada para ordeñar a las vacas y destazar algunos de los animales, el negocio lo inició desde que tuvo a su primera hija lo cual le ha servido para criar a todos sus demás hijos.

El préstamo solicitado lo necesita para comprar 4 vacas, ya que se las venden a un precio cómodo y quiere aprovechar la oportunidad.
Reina sueña con ver que sus hijos se superen y lleguen a ser personas de bien, además le gustaría crecer en su negocio de la ganadería.
texts.en:
Reina is 54 years old. She studied through high school. She is married and has 4 children but only 2 are living with her.

Reina is an enterprising woman. She has a business selling beef, cheese, and cream which she obtains from her small ranch. Her two children get up at dawn in order to milk the cows and butcher some of the animals. She started her business when she had her first daughter and it has allowed her to bring up all the other children.

She is asking for a loan to buy 4 cows as they are selling them at a good price and she wants to take advantage of the opportunity.

Reina dreams of seeing her children succeed and become good people, and she also would like to grow her livestock business.

loans.use: to buy 4 cows, as they are selling them at a good price and she wants to take advantage of the opportunity

loans.name: Tereza

texts.en:
Tereza is a 39-year-old married mother of four children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. A farmer growing crops such as maize and bananas, she faces the challenges of price fluctuation and inflation. 

Tereza is requesting a loan to buy maize seeds for planting. She hopes to have a self-supporting business.

loans.use: to buy maize seeds for planting

loans.name: Yovani

texts.en:
Yovani is a 32-year-old man with 4 children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. 

He is a maize farmer, and also earns additional income from a boda-boda (motorcycle) transport business. He faces the challenge of limited capital but still hopes to educate his children. 

He needs a loan to buy beans, maize and ground nuts to sell.

loans.use: to buy beans, maize and ground nuts to sell.

loans.name: Pablo Emilio

texts.es: Emilio es un joven de 24 años de edad, tiene una hija de 8 años que asiste a la escuela,  Emilio se dedica a jornal desde que tenía 16 años  y son 4 años de lo que decidió sembrar sus pequeñas huertas de papas que es el producto que más se da en estas tierras, el crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de fungicidas para curar y que no se le dañe su cultivo, lo que Emilio espera es obtener una buena cosecha y en algún momento comprarse un terreno para seguir sembrando  y trabajando  para el bienestar de su hija
texts.en:
Emilio is a young man who is 24 years old and the father of an 8-year-old girl that goes to school. 

Emilio has been a day laborer since he was about 16, and four years ago, he decided to grow potatoes in his small garden plots. Potatoes are the most abundant crop in this region. He is going to invest the loan to buy fungicides to cure his crop, and prevent any damage to it. 

Emilio hopes to have a good harvest and, at some time, buy his own land to continue farming and working for his daughter's wellbeing.

loans.use: To buy fungicides

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy seedlings.

loans.name: Norma Elizabeth

texts.es: Norma de 32 años de edad es madre soltera vive con sus dos hijos en casa propia, ella se dedica a la venta de lociones, cosméticos, perfumes, cremas, etc. con venta al detalle y por mayoreo desde hace 6 años, el negocio lo tiene ubicado en su casa de habitación, tiene mucha clientela por la variedad de productos y los buenos precios, con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas logra cubrir algunos gastos de la casa,  Norma está solicitando un crédito a INETGRAL para compra de mas productos por mayor y surtir su negocio, para tener mejores ingresos y darle a su familia una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
Norma is 32 years old. She is a single mother living with her 2 children in her own home. 

She has been selling lotions, cosmetics, perfumes, creams, etc., buying in bulk and selling at retail, for 6 years. The business is located in her home. She has many customers because of the variety of products and the good prices. The earnings she obtains cover the household expenses. 

Norma is asking for a loan from Integral to buy more products at wholesale to supply her business in order to have higher income and give her family more financial stability.

loans.use: to buy lotions, cosmetics, perfumes, creams, etc., buying in bulk

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
Martha deals in second-hand clothes and has been in this business for one year. She is twenty-nine years old and married with two children, and they live in Kasese, Uganda. 

Martha dreams of educating her children and expanding her business. She is hardworking even though she is faced with the challenge of limited capital. 

She needs the money to buy second-hand dresses, shirts, trousers and blouses to sell.

loans.use: to buy second-hand dresses, shirts, trousers and blouses to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy food concentrate, vitamins and poultry to raise.

loans.name: Katojo Tukore Group

texts.en:
Angella is married with six children who attend school; her major source of income is agricultural production. Angella took a loan of shs 500,000 to buy more agricultural inputs like seedlings and herbicides to increase her production. Using the loans from UGAFODE, she has been able to send her children to school and expand her agricultural production. She joined UGAFODE after realizing that her business alone could meet all her financial needs.  

Angella joined Katojo Tukore Group since she couldn’t stand alone to acquire financial assistance and she claims that ever since she joined the group, her life has changed. The group members appreciate UGAFODE for financial assistance which has improved their standard of living.

loans.use: to buy seedlings and herbicides

loans.name: God Is Able Group

texts.en:
These members are part of the group called God is Able and are beginning their seventh loan cycle with ID-Ghana. The God is Able group is made up of two members who are into the sale of smoked fish, bed sheets and gents’ shirts. The loan they are taking out will benefit these small entrepreneurs, one of whom is Esther. She says that she joined ID-Ghana three years ago, at the invitation of a relative who was a client of the institution. At present, Esther has a business in the sale of bed sheet and gents shirts. She began this business with the seventh loan that she obtained through ID-Ghana. 

The loan that she will obtain this time is for an increase in capital for the purchase of more bed sheets and gents’ shirts from the market at a wholesale price. Later, she will sell these bed sheets and gents’ shirts to her clients from door to door. This kind of work enables her to generate resources to assist her family, since she is married and has children. When she was asked what she liked about ID-Ghana, she replied that she was pleased with the loan and with the training that the institution offers her.

loans.use: To purchase of more bed sheets and gents' shirts from the market at a wholesale price

loans.name: Dromo Group

texts.en:
These members are part of the group called Dromo and are beginning their fifth loan cycle with ID-Ghana. The Dromo group is made up of five members who are into the sale of fresh fish, jewelries and kenkey (cooked corn dough, similar to a sourdough dumpling). The loan they are taking out will benefit these small entrepreneurs.  

One of the group members is Peace. She says that she joined ID-Ghana three years ago, at the invitation of of a relative who was a client of the institution. At present, Peace has a business in the sale of fresh fish. She began this business with the fifth loan that she obtained through ID-Ghana. The loan that she will obtain this time is for an increase in capital to be used for the purchase of more fresh fish from the fishermen (at the wholesale level). She will sell this fresh fish to her clients, door to door. This kind of work enables her to generate resources to assist her family, since she is married and has children.

When she was asked what she liked about ID-Ghana, she replied that she was pleased with the loan and with the training that the institution offers her.

loans.use: To purchase more fresh fish from the fishermen at the wholesale level

loans.name: Beijing Group

texts.en:
Halima, who is in her early 20’s, is single. She has been a food vendor for one month now. She works from 6am to 5pm daily and is able to make a small monthly profit.

This will be Halima’s first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She will use this loan to buy cooking ingredients. She dreams of being successful in life.

Halima will share this loan with her loan group "Beijing" which consists of four members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy cooking ingredients

loans.name: Oscar Oswaldo

texts.es: Oscar de 32 años de edad vive en casa propia con sus dos hijos y su esposa quien vende frutas en el mercado, el se dedica desde hace 25 años a la agricultura  especialmente al cultivo de maíz, esos años le han dado la experiencia necesaria para poder sembrar los mejores cultivos, comercializa en los alrededores de la zona y tiene mucha clientela ya establecida que lo prefieren por la calidad de los productos y los buenos precios, Oscar solicita un crédito para la compra de insumos agrícolas como: herbicidas, abonos, fertilizantes, controles de plagas, semillas, etc. para darle a su familia un mejor nivel de vida sin limitación alguna.
texts.en:
Oscar is 32 years old. He lives in his own house with his two children and his wife, who sells fruit at the market. 

For 25 years, he has devoted his life to agriculture, especially the growing of corn. Those years have given him the experience needed to grow the best crops. He sells them around the region and has many established customers who prefer him based on the quality of his produce and good prices. 

Oscar is requesting a loan to buy agricultural supplies, such as herbicides, manure, fertilizer, pest control, seed, etc. in order to give his family a better living situation without any limitations.

loans.use: To buy herbicides, manure, fertilizer, pest control, seed, etc.

loans.name: Sara

texts.en:
Sara is a married woman. She lives in a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

Sara operates a fruit and vegetable stall; she sells at the market to town dwellers and neighbors. She faces a challenge of competition and seasonality in her business. With her KES 20,000 loan, she wants to purchase sacks of fruit - including oranges and bananas - and green vegetables for resale. She dreams of expanding her business and establishing a retail shop in the future.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of fruits and green vegetables for resale

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is married with one child who attends school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. She operates an open-air food business, selling in a shop to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business.  

With her KES 25,000 loan, Rose wants to purchase stock of wheat flour, maize flour, sugar, and rice. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business. Her dream is to establish a wholesale business in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase stock of wheat flour, maize flour, sugar, and rice

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is 37 years old. She is married with three children in Teshie. Margaret has been in the sale of cereals; wheat and 'tom brown' (wheat flour).

Today she wants to increase the size of the business so she will buy more wheat and 'tom brown' (wheat flour). For this reason, she needs a loan in the amount of GHS 1,500. Margaret says, “Thanks to Kiva lenders for support. I’m greatly thankful to you.”

In the future she wants to develop her business.

loans.use: to buy more wheat and 'tom brown' (wheat flour).

loans.name: Nozanin

texts.ru:
Нозанин молодая замужняя женщина в возрасте 24 лет. Она проживает в районе Спитамен, который назван в честь Спитамена - согдийского военачальника, руководителя восстания в Согдиане и Бактрии против Александра Македонского в 329 году до н. э. Площадь района Спитамена составляет 355,7 км2. В состав Спитаменского района входят 2 посёлок городского типа и 6 сельских общин. 
Нозанин живет в сельской общине Тагояк вместе с мужем. Она занимается там сельским хозяйством. У нее имеется орошаемый участок земли, где она занимается посевом. Параллельно с растениеводством, она еще и занимается животноводством. На протяжении 4,5 года Нозанин выращивает крупнорогатый скот для продажи. Эта деятельность ей по душе. Она сейчас хочет увеличить поголовье скотов и с такой целью обратилась за кредитом. Нозанин надеется на поддержку. Она хочет увеличить семейный бюджет.
texts.en:
Nozanin is a young married woman, aged 24. She lives in the Spitamen district, which is named after the Sogdian commander Spitamen who led the revolt in Sogdiana and Bactria against Alexander the Great in 329 BCE. Spitamen is 355.7 square kilometers and consists of a town and six rural communities.

Nozanin is a farmer who lives in the Tagoyak community with her husband. She has an irrigated plot of land for planting crops and she also raises livestock. She has been raising cattle to sell for four and a half years and she enjoys the work. She currently wants to acquire more livestock and has applied for a loan for this reason. Nozanin wants to increase her family budget and hopes for support.

loans.use: to buy cattle and expand her business

loans.name: Salvacion

texts.en:
Salvacion is 48 years old and married with four children, two of whom are in school.

Salvacion works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Salvacion has borrowed and paid five loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for two years and also earns an income from food vending and rice retailing.

Salvacion aspires to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Belinda

texts.en:
Belinda, 58, is married and has two children.  

Belinda is in the agricultural business, farming vegetables in the Philippines. Belinda requested a 12000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

Belinda has been farming vegetables for 22 years now, and has borrowed 26 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her livelihood.

In the future, Belinda would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Bella

texts.en:
Bella is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a electronics repair shop business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 25000 PHP through NWTF to buy new tools and equipment for her business.

Bella successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

NWTF is re-listing Bella's business profile in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy new tools and equipment.

loans.name: Martha

texts.es:
Martha de 38 años de edad, es ama de casa y su nivel de estudio fue hasta el 1° grado, por problemas de la economía no pudo continuar sus estudios y decidió acompañarse ahora es madre de 2 hijos de 1 año y de 3 meses de edad de los cuales solo estudia uno. Viven con ella su compañero de vida y sus dos hijos. 

Martha y su compañero de vida se dedican a la siembra de 3500 mts cuadrados de maíz y hortalizas como pipián, frijoles etc., también se dedican a la corta de caña, trabajo que lo desempeñan desde hace 3 años, además tiene una vaca que la ordeña todos los días, su horario de trabajo es de 6:00 am a 10:00 am.

El crédito que esta solicitando, es para comprar abono para mejorar su cosecha y así espera tener un poco mas de ingresos, por lo tanto mejorara su calidad de vida y la de su familia.

El sueño de Martha es mejorar su vivienda para poder darles a sus hijos una mejor comodidad.
texts.en:
Martha is 38 years old. She is a housewife and studied through the first grade. She was not able to continue her studies because of financial problems. She decided to become a mother with her partner and she has  two children. One is 1 year 3 months old and the other is a student and they live with her and her life companion.

Martha and her life partner work farming 3500 square meters of corn and vegetables such as pipián (a squash), beans, etc., and also they have been  cutting sugar cane for 3 years. She also has a cow that she milks daily. Her working day is from 6:00am until 10:00am.

She is requesting a loan to buy fertilizer to improve her crop and thus is hoping to have a little more income so she can improve the quality of life for her and her family.

Martha’s dream is to improve her home in order to be able to provide her children more comfort.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for 3500 square meters of sowing

loans.name: Vitalis

texts.en:
Vitalis is a married man with four children, all of whom attend school. He lives in his own house that has electricity and piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food.

For the past ten years, Vitalis has operated a clothes selling business, selling from door to door, to his neighbours and passersby. He faces a major challenge of high costs of transportation. With the loan that he is requesting of KES 40,000, he wants to purchase bales of clothes for resale. he decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business. He dreams of expanding his business and establishing a boutique in the future.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale

loans.name: Claudia Liliana

texts.es: Son 32 años que tiene Liliana, es madre soltera  y tiene 2 hijos que asisten a la escuela, Liliana  juntamente con sus hijos y  su madre  viven en una casa por la que paga arriendo, Liliana se dedica a trabajar al jornal  de trabajo en el campo y también a la crianza de animales menores, en esta ocasión con el dinero del crédito va a comprar chanchos para mejorar su negocio, la meta que se ha puesto Liliana es trabajar duro y reunir algo de dinero para lograr comprarse una casita que le permita mejorar la calidad de vida de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Liliana is 32 years old. She is a single mother and has two children that go to school. Liliana, her children and her mother live in a rental house. 

Liliana works as a day laborer in the country and also raises small farm animals. This time, she will buy pigs with the loan money to improve her business. 

The goal Liliana has set for herself is to work hard and save up some money to buy a little house so she can give her children a better quality of life.

loans.use: To buy pigs

loans.name: Shida

texts.en:
Shida is married and has been blessed with three school-going children. Her husband is a businessman, and he contributes in the upbringing of their children. They own a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

Shida operates a fruit and vegetable stall, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge in the high cost of transportation in her place of operation. With her KES 20,000 loan, she wants to purchase sacks of potatoes, tomatoes, onions and fruit for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business. She dreams of expanding to a wholesale shop in the future.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of potatoes, tomatoes, onions and fruit for resale

loans.name: Molice

texts.en:
Molice is an old client of UGAFODE who has applied for a loan of UGX 800,000. The 38-year-old man is a widower with four children and operates a retail shop with a small bar as his major source of income. However, he has been faced with a challenge of limited capital and goods to compete favorably in the market. 

Molice found it hard to meet all his financial needs with his business alone and he decided to join UGAFODE to access financial assistance so as to buy more stock, e.g., soap, salt, and matches to increase his sales. He hopes with this loan from UGAFODE, he will be able to boost his business and pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: To buy salt, sugar, soap, and boxes of matches for sale

loans.name: Maarina

texts.en:
Marina is 56 years old, married and has six children. Two of her children are in school.

Marina is in the agricultural business, farming vegetables in the Philippines. Marina requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Marina has been farming vegetables for three years now, and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Marina would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Hassan

texts.en:
Hassan is a married man. He has 4 children. He describes himself to be a business risk-taker. He operates a retail business where he sells bread. He has been involved in this business for 10 years. His business is located in an area with high potential. He describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of capital. 

Hassan will use his KES 80,000 loan to buy more stock of bread. His business goal is to be a large scale distributor of bread within 5 years. He hopes that in the future, he will have a stable business to enable him to sustain his family. This is his third loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. He will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: buy more stock of bread

loans.name: Clemence

texts.en:
Clemence is a married woman with two children, both of whom attend school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past two years, she has operated a charcoal selling business. She sells from home to her neighbours and passersby. Her major challenge in the business is the high cost of transportation. With the loan she is requesting of KES 20,000, Clemence wants to purchase 10 bags of charcoal for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase 10 bags of charcoal for resale

loans.name: Keila Evelin

texts.es:
Keila, es  una joven emprendedora de 25 años de edad, está soltera y no tiene hijos, con esfuerzo logró culminar sus estudios de bachillerato, luego se graduó de un curso de cosmetología y actualmente posee un negocio de venta de ropa.


Keila tiene dos años de experiencia en el negocio de la venta de ropa, decidió dedicarse a esto por iniciativa propia, ya que la idea principal que ella tenía era poner una sala de belleza pero el capital no le alcanzaba y decidió empezar con la venta de ropa, ella se traslada todos los días de su casa al trabajo a las 7 de la mañana ya que su negocio está a 10 kilómetros de distancia de sus casa y retorna a las 4 de la tarde.  

Ella necesita este crédito para comprar más ropa para vender en el negocio y para pagar el alquiler de un nuevo local más amplio del que ahora tiene para atender a sus clientes con más comodidad.

Sus metas son comenzar a arreglar el nuevo local que le alquilarán ya que es más grande, poner su sala de belleza que es su objetivo principal, y ampliar más el negocio de ropa que tiene, además desea casarse y formar su propia familia.
texts.en:
Keila is an enterprising young woman, who is 25 years old, single and has no children. Despite difficulties, she was able to finish her high school education. Later, she graduated from a cosmetology course and currently has a clothing business. 

Keila has two years of experience in the clothing business. She decided to dedicate her time to this business on her own. Her original idea was to open a beauty salon, but she didn't have enough capital and decided to start by selling clothing. She commutes from home to work every day at 7 a.m.  because her business is 10 kilometers from her house. She comes home at 4 p.m.

She needs this loan to buy more clothes to sell and to pay the rent on a new shop that is larger than the one she has now, so she can wait on her customers more comfortably. 

Her goals are to start to decorate the new shop that will be rented to her, because it is bigger; open her beauty salon, which is her primary objective, and grow the clothing business that she has. She would also like to marry and have her own family.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to sell in the business and pay the rent on a new shop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy corn, beans and other ingredients to make pupusas, and tables and chairs for her customers.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam, aged 36 years, is married and has been blessed with five children. She owns a house that has electricity, but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past five years, she has operated a retail shop business, selling household consumables such as wheat flour, rice, and cooking oil. She cites theft and competition as her major challenges in her business. 

Mariam is requesting KES 50,000 to boost her kiosk, and to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat oil. She dreams of expanding to a wholesale shop in the near future.

loans.use: to boost her kiosk, and purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat oil.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy clothes and footwear for resale

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma is a 39-year-old married woman with two children, both attend school.

Gemma has grown vegetables for 13 year  and has previously borrowed 18 times from NWTF to sustain the business. Gemma requests 15,000 PHP through NWTF to buy fertilizer and other farming supplies.

In the future, Gemma would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to educate her children.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farming supplies.

loans.name: Arnoldo German

texts.es: Arnoldo es un señor de 55 años, es casado y tiene 7 hijos, mismos de los cuales 5 aun viven con Arnoldo y su esposa trabaja al jornal, este señor vive en el campo y comenta que la  fuente de ingresos de este lugar es la agricultura y la ganadería y por este motivo se dedica a l jornal, siembra alguna pequeña huerta de papas y hace un año que decidió dedicarse a  criar terneros, dice Arnoldo que por falta de recursos económicos sus hijos solamente terminaron la primaria y ya no les pudo mandar al colegio, el crédito lo necesita para comprar terneros, lo que este señor aspira es trabajar juntamente con sus hijos y que ellos salgan adelante y tengan una buena calidad de vida juntamente con un buen futuro.
texts.en:
Arnoldo is a 55-year-old man. He's married and has seven children, of whom five still live with Arnoldo and his wife.

He works for hire. This man lives in the countryside and says the source of income in this area is farming and ranching. Because of this, he earns a living through hired work, plants a small garden of potatoes and decided one year ago to raise calves. 

Arnoldo says that due to a lack of economic resources,  his children only finished primary school, and he wasn't able to send them to high school. 

He needs the loan to buy calves. What this man aspires is to work together with his children, and for them to get ahead and have a good quality of life together with a good future.

loans.use: to buy calves.

loans.name: Dúo Union Y Confianza Group

texts.es:
Dúo unión y Confianza
Doña Felisa es originaria del municipio de Tecpán, Guatemala ella tiene 51 años de edad, bajo su responsabilidad están sus 4 hijos menores de edad que necesitan el cuidado de ella, 3 mujeres y un varón, ella se dedica a la venta de comida y a la venta de ropa en el mercado municipal de Tecpán. 
Gracias al apoyo de sus hijas doña Felisa sigue adelante con el negocio ya que con la ayuda de ellas se están ayudando para sacar adelante el negocio ya que es el único medio que tienen para salir adelante.
El sueño de ella es ampliar mas su negocio, surtirlo con mas variedad de productos asi tendrá mejores ganancias y poder mandar a sus hijos a la escuela para un futuro mejor.
texts.en:
Felisa, of the group, Dúo Unión y Confianza, is a native of the municipality of Tecpán, Guatemala. She is 51 years old and has four minor children that depend on her and need her care - three girls and one boy. She devotes her time to selling food and clothing in the municipal market in Tecpan. 

Thanks to the support of her daughters, Felisa is moving forward with the business. Her daughters are helping her grow the business, which is the only means they have to succeed. 

Her dream is to expand the business and stock a wider variety of products, so her profits will improve and she will be able to send her children to school so they have a better future.

loans.use: To buy supplies to make snacks for sale

loans.name: Mireya Luisa

texts.es: Mireya es madre soltera, trabaja como cocinera en un hospital privado y a la vez vende cosméticos en sus tiempos libres para poder obtener otros ingresos los cuales le ayuda para mantener los estudios universitarios de sus hijos y suplir otros gastos primordiales, Mireya solicita el apoyo de crédito para poder mantener este ingreso extra que tanto ha beneficiado a su familia, con el financiamiento podrá comprar variedades de crema, loción, perfumes, vanidades entre otros.
texts.en:
Mireya is a single mother. She works as a cook in a private hospital and in her free time also sells cosmetics to have another source of income. This helps her to finance the university education of her children and to cover other important expenses.

Mireya asks for the help of a loan to keep up this additional income which has helped her family so much. With the loan she will buy various creams, lotions, perfumes, compacts, and more.

loans.use: to buy various cosmetics.

loans.name: Ma. Delia

texts.en:
Ma. Delia is 55 years old, married, and has three children.  

Ma. Delia has grown vegetables for 3 years  and has previously borrowed five times from NWTF to sustain her business. Ma. Delia requests 10,000 PHP through NWTF to buy fertilizer and other farming supplies.

In the future, Ma. Delia would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farming supplies.

loans.name: Adelaida

texts.en:
Adelaida is 65 years old and married with five children. Adelaida works very hard to provide for them.

Adelaida has operated a general store for 24 years and requests 15,000 PHP through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell.
She sells a variety of items such as snack foods, canned goods and other groceries. 

In the future Adelaida, would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Lialyn

texts.en:
Lialyn is 29 years old and married with one child. Lialyn works very hard to provide for them.

Lialyn has operated a general store for 7 years and requests 15,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell.

She sells a variety of items such as snack foods, canned goods and other groceries. 

In the future, Lialyn would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Jonalyn

texts.en:
Jonalyn is married and works hard to support her family.

She has a fish vending business and earns additional income operating a general store.  Jonalyn requests 17,000 through NWTF to buy more fish to sell to customers.

Jonalyn has sustained her business activities through  six previous loans from NWTF and Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her to attain her dream which is to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell to customers.

loans.name: Nena

texts.en:
Nena is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a pottery business in the Philippines. 

She requests 20,000 PHP through NWTF to buy raw materials needed for her pottery business.

Nena successfully repaid her previous loan and requests a new loan to further build her business.

NWTF is re-listing Nena's business profile  in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for her pottery business.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is married and she works hard to support her family.

She sells dried fish in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening. Marites is borrowing 29,000 PHP through NWTF in order to buy more dried fish to sell to customers.

Marites has been sustaining her business activities through her past 21 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business, and to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more dried fish to sell.

loans.name: Natalia

texts.en: Natalia lives in Oe-cusse and is a business woman. She is applying for a loan of $800 to improve her business in the future. She has a kiosk and is taking this loan to buy some additional supplies to keep in her kiosk, including candies, sugar, coffee, detergent, noodles, cooking oils and other things. She started her business in 2013 with a working capital of $350. She hopes that with the loan offered from Tuba Rai Metin, she will open a big store in the future. Also, with the loan from Tuba Rai Metin, she can improve her management.

loans.use: to buy  candies, sugar, coffee, detergent, noodles, cooking oils and other things to sell.

loans.name: Varduhi

texts.en:
Varduhi is from Gay village, in the Armavir region. She lives with her husband, brother-in-law, mother-in-law and two small kids. All of them put their efforts together to be able to earn a living. Apart from her daily household work, Varduhi, with the help of her family members, is engaged in the cultivation of several vegetables (onion, cabbage, eggplant, peppers and greens). They sell the agricultural products in the local market, which is an important source of the family's income. 

To make her farming business sustainable and more productive, Varduhi needs to make some financial investments. She needs a loan of USD 3,000 to purchase fertilizer and a polyethylene cover for the greenhouse, and to hire workers for land cultivation. As this is Varduhi’s first loan, it has been approved within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and SEF. The first-chance loan program provides loans to people who didn’t have access to credit products before, because they had no credit history. Varduhi and her family highly rely on the good will of the lenders and will be grateful to them for their support.

loans.use: to pay for fertilizer and a polyethylene cover for the greenhouse, and to hire workers for land cultivation

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica is 57 years old and lives in Poblacion, Tampilisan, Zamboanga del Norte. She is widowed with 7 children. She works in the fish industry and sells fish for a living. She has been doing this for 15 years. 

Veronica has requested a loan to buy more boxes of fish to sell at the market. She has been a member of PMPC for 3 years. In the future, she hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more boxes of fish to sell at the market

loans.name: Mitchiel

texts.en:
Mitchiel is single. She is 26 years old and lives in Poblacion, Tampilisan, Zamboanga del Norte. She runs a sari-sari store to earn a living and has had this business for 1 year. Each month, she earns PHP 10,000 doing this type of business. 

Mitchiel has requested a loan of PHP 35,000 to buy more basic items to display and sell. She is a new member of PMPC. In the future, she hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more basic items to display and sell.

loans.name: Henelyn

texts.en:
Henelyn is 47 years old and married with five children.

Henelyn has grown sugarcane for 5 years and requests 50,000 PHP through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farming supplies.

She has previously borrowed seven times from NWTF and  Kiva to sustain her business.

She works tirelessly to attain  her dream which is to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farming supplies.

loans.name: Estrella

texts.en:
Estrella is 54 years old and married with seven children. She is a very hard  working entrepreneur. 

Estrella has operated a fish vending business for 18 years and requests 21,000 PHP  through NWTF to buy more fish to sell.

In the future, Estrella would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Ofelia

texts.en:
Ofelia is 57 years old and married with three children. Ofelia works very hard to provide for them.

Ofelia has operated a general store for 5 years and requests 30,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell.

She sells a variety of items such as snack foods, canned goods and other groceries. 

In the future, Ofelia would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.
